original: de 'di ltar rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa dag gang mthong ba de 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log ces shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'di ltar rang gi ngo bos ma grub pa dag gang mthong ba de 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci log ces shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that whatever is seen by those who do not see the non-existence of essential nature is called ‚Äúthe error of the world.‚Äù

original: gang yang de dag de lta bas na des na skye ba dang 'jig pa dag stong pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang de dag de lta bas na des na skye ba dang 'jig pa dag stong pa'o //
translated: Since they are like that, therefore arising and ceasing are empty.üîΩWhen they are empty, then nirvana is taught through the teaching of their arising and ceasing.

original: gang gi tshe de dag stong pa nyid na de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa bstan pa las mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes nye bar bstan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan par mi 'thad do //üîΩbyis pa'i skye bos rtogs pa'i don du des mthong pa'i rjes su 'jug pas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang 'jig pa @307a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag stong pa nyid na de'i skye ba dang 'jig pa bstan pa las mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro zhes nye bar bstan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam bstan par mi 'thad do // byis pa'i skye bos rtogs pa'i don du des mthong pa'i rjes su 'jug pas bcom ldan 'das kyis skye ba dang 'jig pa @307a * //
translated: But it is not tenable to teach the path to nirvana.

original: gsungs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gsungs par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the Transcendent Lord taught arising and ceasing in accordance with the way things are seen by childish beings, in order to make them understand.

original: ji ltar du /
analyzed: ji ltar du /
translated: How so?

original: skye ba shes pas 'jig pa shes //
analyzed: skye ba shes pas 'jig pa shes //
translated: Through knowing arising, one knows ceasing.

original: 'jig pa shes pas mi rtag shes //
analyzed: 'jig pa shes pas mi rtag shes //
translated: Through knowing ceasing, one knows impermanence.

original: mi rtag nyid la 'jug shes pas //
analyzed: mi rtag nyid la 'jug shes pas //
translated: Through knowing the engagement of impermanence,

original: des ni chos kyang rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni chos kyang rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: one will also understand the Dharma.

original: zhes so // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: zhes so // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: skye med 'gag pa med ce na ;
analyzed: skye med 'gag pa med ce na ;
translated: If it is said that non-arising is non-ceasing,

original: / ci zhig 'gags pas mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: / ci zhig 'gags pas mya ngan 'da' //
translated: then what ceases through nirvana?

original: gang zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa med na de'i tshe sdug bsngal med la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dag skyes pa mi rtag pas sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: gang zhig skye ba dang 'jig pa med na de'i tshe sdug bsngal med la nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dag skyes pa mi rtag pas sdug bsngal la /
translated: If there is neither arising nor disintegration, then at that time there is no suffering. The five appropriated aggregates are suffering due to impermanence because they arise.

original: de 'gags pa las mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de 'gags pa las mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is due to the cessation of that.

original: gang gi tshe skye ba dang 'gags pa gang yang med pas sdug bsngal med pa de'i tshe ci zhig 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skye ba dang 'gags pa gang yang med pas sdug bsngal med pa de'i tshe ci zhig 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur /
translated: When there is neither arising nor cessation, then at that time, since there is no suffering, what ceases through nirvana?

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod la /
translated: In this way, nirvana is due to the cessation of suffering.

original: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dag yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, arising and disintegration exist.

original: smras pa / 'di la skyon med de /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di la skyon med de /
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gang gi phyir 'gags pa las mya ngan las 'das par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gags pa las mya ngan las 'das par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no error here because nirvana is not posited due to cessation.

original: de ni sdug bsngal med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal med pa nyid de /
translated: That is the absence of suffering.

original: skye ba med cing 'gag med pa'i //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'gag med pa'i //
translated: It is neither arisen nor ceased.

original: ngo bo gang zhig thar min nam //
analyzed: ngo bo gang zhig thar min nam //
translated: How could its nature be either liberation or non-liberation?

original: nges par yang 'di ltar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par yang 'di ltar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: One must definitely accept this.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te 'gags las myang 'das chad //
analyzed: gal te 'gags las myang 'das chad //
translated: If nirvana were a thing,üîΩIf it were a non-thing,

original: gal te cig shos ltar na rtag / de phyir dngos po dngos med dag / mya ngan 'das par rung ma yin //
analyzed: gal te cig shos ltar na rtag / de phyir dngos po dngos med dag / mya ngan 'das par rung ma yin //
translated: Nirvana would not be tenable as either a thing or a non-thing.

original: gal te sdug bsngal rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mi 'dod la //üîΩsdug bsngal gyi ngo bo'i rgyun las log pa la mya ngan las 'das par yongs su rtogs na ;
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags par mi 'dod la // sdug bsngal gyi ngo bo'i rgyun las log pa la mya ngan las 'das par yongs su rtogs na ;
translated: If you do not assert that suffering is essentially non-arisen and non-ceased,üîΩand if you think that nirvana is the cessation of the continuum of the entity of suffering,

original: de ni sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya la /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya la /
translated: then nirvana would be a nihilistic cessation, because it would be the cessation of the continuum of suffering.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chad par 'gyur ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chad par 'gyur ba mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is not tenable that nirvana is a nihilistic cessation.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta bar thal ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pa las rgyun chad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de phyin ci log tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta bar thal ba dang / ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pa las rgyun chad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa de phyin ci log tu 'gyur la /
translated: It would follow that it would be a view grasping an extreme, and nirvana would be a cessation that is not established by virtue of its own nature.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa phyin ci log ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because nirvana is not erroneous,

original: sdug bsngal rgyun chad ba'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyun chad ba'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das par mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable that nirvana is the nature of the cessation of suffering.üîΩMoreover, if you assert that nirvana is the nature of suffering

original: yang na skyon 'di dag yongs su spang bar 'dod nas /üîΩde la cig shos khas len na /
analyzed: yang na skyon 'di dag yongs su spang bar 'dod nas / de la cig shos khas len na /
translated: and you wish to completely abandon these errors,

original: de'i tshe @307b sdug bsngal ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe @307b sdug bsngal ma 'gags pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir /
translated: then at that time, because the nature of suffering has not ceased,

original: ther zug pas mya ngan las 'das pa de rang bzhin du 'gyur la /
analyzed: ther zug pas mya ngan las 'das pa de rang bzhin du 'gyur la /
translated: nirvana would be permanent.

original: sdug bsngal rtag pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rtag pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that nirvana is the nature of permanent suffering,

original: de ni sdug bsngal zad pa'i mtshan nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal zad pa'i mtshan nyid du nye bar bstan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is taught that it is characterized by the exhaustion of suffering.

original: / gang gi tshe 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mi rung bas /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe 'di ltar dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mi rung bas /
translated: Since it is not tenable that things exist or do not exist,

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal rang bzhin gyis gang ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa de nyid thar pa zhes rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal rang bzhin gyis gang ma skyes shing ma 'gags pa de nyid thar pa zhes rigs so //
translated: therefore it is reasonable to assert that that which is essentially unborn and unceasing is nirvana.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: sdug bsngal las log pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las log pa'i rang bzhin mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: Nirvana is not a nature that is the opposite of suffering.

original: gal te 'di ltar 'gyur na de'i tshe sdug bsngal las log pa'i rang bzhin ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar 'gyur na de'i tshe sdug bsngal las log pa'i rang bzhin ni ci yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it were, then since the nature of the opposite of suffering is nothing at all,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ci yang ma yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ci yang ma yin par 'gyur la /
translated: then what is called ‚Äúnirvana‚Äù would be nothing at all.

original: ci yang ma yin pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: ci yang ma yin pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical for what is nothing at all to be nirvana.

original: lam gyi bden pas thob bya ;
analyzed: lam gyi bden pas thob bya ;
translated: The object to be attained by the truth of the path

original: skye ba 'gags par gyur pa'i chu skyegs pa'i skyegs kyi gnas lta bu sdug bsngal las don gzhan du gyur pa la 'gog pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: skye ba 'gags par gyur pa'i chu skyegs pa'i skyegs kyi gnas lta bu sdug bsngal las don gzhan du gyur pa la 'gog pa zhes brjod do //
translated: is called ‚Äúcessation,‚Äù which is a state that is different from suffering, like the state of a water lily when its bloom has withered.

original: gal te de don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de don gzhan du gyur pa ma yin na /
translated: If it were not different from suffering,

original: bden pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi rnam par gzhag pa mi 'byung la /
translated: the presentation of the four truths would not occur.

original: des na 'gog pa sdug bsngal rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
analyzed: des na 'gog pa sdug bsngal rtag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin la /
translated: Therefore cessation is not a nature that is permanent suffering.

original: sdug bsngal log pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal log pa'i rang bzhin yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not a nature that is the opposite of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal las don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes pa'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Because it is different from suffering.

original: 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gal te 'gog par 'ga' gnas na //
analyzed: gal te 'gog par 'ga' gnas na //
translated: If cessation existed as something,

original: dngos po las gzhan de yod 'gyur /üîΩdngos po med phyir 'di med la //
analyzed: dngos po las gzhan de yod 'gyur / dngos po med phyir 'di med la //
translated: it would exist as different from something.üîΩBecause of the nonexistence of that, this does not exist.

original: dngos po med phyir de yang med //
analyzed: dngos po med phyir de yang med //
translated: Because of the nonexistence of this, that also does not exist.

original: gal te sdug bsngal gyi dngos po las gzhan du ste /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gyi dngos po las gzhan du ste /
translated: If cessation existed as something different from the thing that is suffering,

original: de las tha dad pa'i 'gog par gyur na /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'i 'gog par gyur na /
translated: then it would be different from that.

original: rtag par gnas par gyur te /
analyzed: rtag par gnas par gyur te /
translated: It would exist permanently,

original: de dngos po las kyang gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de dngos po las kyang gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: and it would be different from the thing.

original: de ni dngos po las gzhan du yod pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po las gzhan du yod pa nyid 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable that it exists as different from the thing.

original: sdug bsngal las gzhan du de 'gags pa rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las gzhan du de 'gags pa rnam par gzhag par mi nus so //
translated: Because it is not possible to posit cessation as different from suffering.

original: gal te yang sdug bsngal las tha dad na 'gog pa rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yang sdug bsngal las tha dad na 'gog pa rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if cessation were different from suffering, it would be permanent.

original: der gyur na 'jig rten pa thams cad la sdug bsngal log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gyur na 'jig rten pa thams cad la sdug bsngal log par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were so, then the cessation of suffering would occur for all worldly beings.

original: @308a * // sdug bsngal las log pa des 'thob po zhe na /
analyzed: @308a * // sdug bsngal las log pa des 'thob po zhe na /
translated: If it were different from suffering, it would be obtained by that which is not suffering.

original: thob par gyur na gang gis sdug bsngal skyes pa 'gag par byas nas 'di'i khyad par ci zhig skyed par byed /
analyzed: thob par gyur na gang gis sdug bsngal skyes pa 'gag par byas nas 'di'i khyad par ci zhig skyed par byed /
translated: If it is attained, then what is generated that is different from it, having ceased the generation of suffering?

original: de thob pa'i rgyud la skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: de thob pa'i rgyud la skye'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it arises in the continuum of one who attains it,

original: phyis ci zhig 'di'i khyad par skye ba gang gis de thob pa'i rgyud la skye na /
analyzed: phyis ci zhig 'di'i khyad par skye ba gang gis de thob pa'i rgyud la skye na /
translated: then what is generated later that is different from it, by which it arises in the continuum of one who attains it?

original: dus thams cad du de thob pa'i rgyud la skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: dus thams cad du de thob pa'i rgyud la skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It would either arise in the continuum of one who attains it at all times,

original: nam yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: or it would never arise.

original: de las lam bsgoms pa 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis ma btsal bar yang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las lam bsgoms pa 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis ma btsal bar yang mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And then, without seeking the path of meditation, all worldly beings would attain nirvana.

original: de'i phyir nges par sdug bsngal la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyis de 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir nges par sdug bsngal la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin gyis de 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, it definitely arises due to the nature of being related to suffering.

original: de la yang sdug bsngal ni srid pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang sdug bsngal ni srid pa'o //
translated: And in that case, suffering is existence.

original: des na / dngos po med phyir 'di med de //üîΩsdug bsngal med pas de med do //
analyzed: des na / dngos po med phyir 'di med de // sdug bsngal med pas de med do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúBecause it does not exist, this does not exist,

original: zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i don to //
translated: because suffering does not exist, that does not exist‚Äù is this.

original: yang gzhan zhig gis smras pa /
analyzed: yang gzhan zhig gis smras pa /
translated: Again, another says this:

original: gal te sdug bsngal 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal 'gags pa ste /
translated: If nirvana were a thing,

original: sdug bsngal med pa'i rang bzhin dngos por gyur pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur na skyon 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa'i rang bzhin dngos por gyur pa mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur na skyon 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: then nirvana would be the cessation of suffering, the nature of which is non-existence.

original: rnam pa de lta bu ni med do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu ni med do //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'on kyang 'di de ni sdug bsngal las log pa tsam mo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di de ni sdug bsngal las log pa tsam mo zhe na /
translated: If you say that nirvana is the mere absence of suffering,

original: smras pa / 'di ltar brtags pas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar brtags pas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: we reply that even if you imagine it in this way, nirvana is not attained,

original: sdug bsngal gyi dngos por yod na sdug bsngal dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi dngos por yod na sdug bsngal dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: because if suffering existed as a thing, then one would be endowed with suffering.

original: sdug bsngal yang mi srid na de med pa ga la zhig ces bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang mi srid na de med pa ga la zhig ces bya'o //
translated: But if suffering is impossible, how can you say that it does not exist?

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that nirvana is the nature of the non-existence of a thing,

original: des na dngos po med pas ni dngos po med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: des na dngos po med pas ni dngos po med pa'i phyir la /
translated: then because of the non-existence of a thing, nirvana is the non-existence of the non-existence of a thing.

original: de yang med de /
analyzed: de yang med de /
translated: And that also does not exist.

original: dngos po med par gyur pas med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med par gyur pas med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, because of the non-existence of the non-existence of a thing, nirvana does not exist.

original: yang na 'di'i don gzhan te /
analyzed: yang na 'di'i don gzhan te /
translated: Or, the meaning of this is different.

original: gal te 'gog pa zhes bya ba dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'gog pa zhes bya ba dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo grub par gyur na /
translated: If so-called cessation were an established entity,

original: de sdug bsngal la mi ltos pas kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: de sdug bsngal la mi ltos pas kyang 'byung ste /
translated: it would occur even without depending on suffering,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it would be established by its own characteristics.

original: 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But it does not occur.

original: des na 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa med do //üîΩyang na gal te 'dod na yang nges par de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis sam /
analyzed: des na 'gog pa'i rang gi ngo bo grub pa med do // yang na gal te 'dod na yang nges par de ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis sam /
translated: Therefore the nature of cessation is not established.üîΩMoreover, if you assert that, then it would definitely occur by the nature of an entity

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'byung bar @308b 'gyur ;
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'byung bar @308b 'gyur ;
translated: or by the nature of a nonentity.

original: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that it is by the nature of an entity,

original: de ni dngos po bkag pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ni dngos po bkag pa'i phyir //
translated: then because it is the negation of an entity,

original: dngos po med phyir de yang med //
analyzed: dngos po med phyir de yang med //
translated: it does not exist because it is a nonentity.

original: yang na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: yang na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: Moreover, if it is by the nature of a nonentity,

original: 'di ltar dngos po med kyang bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po med kyang bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: in that case, it is a negation because it is a nonentity.

original: 'gag pa nyid dngos po med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gag pa nyid dngos po med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because cessation itself is a nonentity,

original: dngos po med pas yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: dngos po med pas yod pa nyid ma yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: it is said that because it is a nonentity, it does not exist.üîΩIt is said:

original: dngos po med phyir de yang med //
analyzed: dngos po med phyir de yang med //
translated: Because it is a nonentity, it does not exist.

original: ces so // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: ces so // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Nirvana exists.

original: de'i tshe mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, its characteristics exist.

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu la mtshan nyid yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The son of a barren woman, who does not exist, does not have characteristics.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la mtshan nyid yod de so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang bral ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la mtshan nyid yod de so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa gang bral ba'o zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: But nirvana has characteristics, because of the statement, ‚ÄúThe cessation that is a specific entity is freedom.‚Äù

original: smras pa / mya ngan las 'das pa de'i mtshan nyid yod na yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / mya ngan las 'das pa de'i mtshan nyid yod na yod par 'gyur na /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds, If nirvana had a characteristic, it would exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩmtshan gzhi las gzhan mtshan nyid las //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / mtshan gzhi las gzhan mtshan nyid las //
translated: But it does not exist. To demonstrate this, he says:üîΩThe characterized does not exist apart from the characteristic.

original: mtshan gzhi grub pas rang ma grub //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi grub pas rang ma grub //
translated: The characterized does not exist through its own nature.

original: phan tshun las kyang ma grub cing //
analyzed: phan tshun las kyang ma grub cing //
translated: It does not exist through mutual dependence.

original: ma grub ma grub sgrub byed min //
analyzed: ma grub ma grub sgrub byed min //
translated: That which does not exist does not establish anything.

original: 'dir gal te mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i ngo bo cung zad grub par gyur na /
analyzed: 'dir gal te mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i ngo bo cung zad grub par gyur na /
translated: Here, if something called a ‚Äúcharacteristic‚Äù existed in the least,

original: de mtshan gzhi la mi ltos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de mtshan gzhi la mi ltos par 'gyur la /
translated: it would not depend on the characterized.

original: mtshan gzhi lam ltos pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu med pa thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi lam ltos pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu med pa thob par 'gyur la /
translated: The definition of the definiendum is that it is obtained without a cause.

original: rgyu med par yang mi rigs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu med par yang mi rigs so zhes bya ste /
translated: But it is not tenable that it is without a cause.

original: des na nges par mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid grub pas /
analyzed: des na nges par mtshan gzhi las mtshan nyid grub pas /
translated: Therefore, since the definition is necessarily established from the definiendum,

original: mtshan gzhi'i rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi'i rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the definition that is the cause of the definiendum is not established.

original: yang na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Or, it might be thought that

original: mtshan gzhi la ltos nas mtshan nyid grub par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi la ltos nas mtshan nyid grub par yod do zhe na /
translated: the definition is established in reliance on the definiendum.

original: smras pa / gal te mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid la ma ltos par yod na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid la ma ltos par yod na /
translated: If the definiendum exists without depending on the definition,

original: de la ltos nas mtshan nyid yod la /üîΩltos pa med pa'i mtshan gzhi mi srid la /
analyzed: de la ltos nas mtshan nyid yod la / ltos pa med pa'i mtshan gzhi mi srid la /
translated: then the definition would exist in reliance on it.üîΩBut it is impossible for the definiendum to exist without depending on the definition.

original: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i mtshan gzhi rgyu med par thal bas /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i mtshan gzhi rgyu med par thal bas /
translated: And it follows that the definiendum would be without a cause, since it would be devoid of a definition.

original: des na mtshan gzhi yang de'i mtshan nyid las grub pas /
analyzed: des na mtshan gzhi yang de'i mtshan nyid las grub pas /
translated: Therefore, since the definiendum is established from its definition,

original: rang las ma grub ste /
analyzed: rang las ma grub ste /
translated: it is not established from itself.

original: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang mtshan gzhi ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is that the definition and the definiendum are not inherently established.

original: yang na 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Or else, one might think as follows:

original: gal te yang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag rang las ma grub kyang /
analyzed: gal te yang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag rang las ma grub kyang /
translated: Even though the characterized and the characteristic are not established from themselves,

original: de lta na yang @309a * //
analyzed: de lta na yang @309a * //
translated: in that case,

original: phan tshun ltos nas grub pas yod do zhe na /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos nas grub pas yod do zhe na /
translated: they exist because they are established in mutual dependence.üîΩIn response, it is said:

original: smras pa / phan tshun las kyang ma grub cing /
analyzed: smras pa / phan tshun las kyang ma grub cing /
translated: They are not established from each other,üîΩand they are not established through mutual dependence.

original: phan tshun ltos pas grub pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pas grub pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The point is that they do not exist.

original: yang ci'i phyir phan tshun ltos pas grub pa med ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir phan tshun ltos pas grub pa med ce na /
translated: Again, why are they not established through mutual dependence?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / ma grub ma grub sgrub byed min //
analyzed: gsungs pa / ma grub ma grub sgrub byed min //
translated: That which is not established does not establish the other.

original: zhes pa'o ; /'dir mtshan gzhi la brten pa'i phyir nyid mtshan gzhi la rten du grub par 'dod na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o ; /'dir mtshan gzhi la brten pa'i phyir nyid mtshan gzhi la rten du grub par 'dod na /
translated: Here, if you assert that the characteristic is established in dependence on the characterized because it depends on the characterized,

original: mtshan gzhi las gzhan du mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi las gzhan du mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad pas /
translated: since it is untenable that the characteristic of the characterized is other than the characterized,

original: mtshan nyid kyis brten pas mtshan gzhi grub bo zhes bya la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis brten pas mtshan gzhi grub bo zhes bya la /
translated: the characterized is established because it is established through the characteristic.

original: de ltar phan tshun ltos pas mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid grub pa rnam par gzhag par gyur pa 'di dag dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar phan tshun ltos pas mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid grub pa rnam par gzhag par gyur pa 'di dag dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, since they are mutually dependent, the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics are posited.

original: gal te mtshan gzhi la ltos nas mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pas de nyid kyis na re zhig mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis med la /
analyzed: gal te mtshan gzhi la ltos nas mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pas de nyid kyis na re zhig mtshan gzhi mtshan nyid la ma ltos par ngo bo nyid kyis med la /
translated: But if the characteristic is posited in reliance on the basis of those characteristics, then by that very fact, the basis of those characteristics does not exist by its own intrinsic reality in reliance on the characteristic.

original: de ni rang nyid ma grub pas med pas ji ltar gzhan mtshan nyid 'grub par byed /
analyzed: de ni rang nyid ma grub pas med pas ji ltar gzhan mtshan nyid 'grub par byed /
translated: And since it does not exist because it is not established by itself, how could it establish another, the characteristic?

original: de bzhin du mtshan gzhi la yang sbyar ro //üîΩde ni 'di ltar mtshan gzhi'am mtshan nyid dag ma grub pa ma grub pa'i mtshan gzhi'am mtshan nyid grub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan gzhi la yang sbyar ro // de ni 'di ltar mtshan gzhi'am mtshan nyid dag ma grub pa ma grub pa'i mtshan gzhi'am mtshan nyid grub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: The same should be applied to the basis of those characteristics.üîΩIn that case, an unestablished basis of those characteristics or an unestablished characteristic does not establish a basis of those characteristics or a characteristic.

original: des na mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med do //
analyzed: des na mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med do //
translated: Therefore the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med pa de'i tshe mtshan nyid yod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ga la 'grub ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag med pa de'i tshe mtshan nyid yod pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ga la 'grub ces bya ste /
translated: When the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves do not exist, how can nirvana, which is said to exist through the characteristics, be established?

original: 'di ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs so //
translated: This is unreasonable.

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid la dpyad pa'i rim pas phan tshun ltos pas grub pa'i dngos po lhag ma rnams kyang ma grub par bde blag tu khong du chud par gzigs nas /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid la dpyad pa'i rim pas phan tshun ltos pas grub pa'i dngos po lhag ma rnams kyang ma grub par bde blag tu khong du chud par gzigs nas /
translated: Seeing that the remaining things that are established through mutual dependence are easily understood to be unestablished through the process of the analysis of the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves,

original: de legs par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de legs par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: he stated the following in order to teach that well:üîΩBy this, all of the following are explained:üîΩcause and effect,üîΩthe feeler and the feeling,üîΩthe seen and the seer,

original: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang // tshor dang tshor ba po sogs dang // blta bya lta ba po la sogs //üîΩdes gang cung zad ma lus bshad //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang // tshor dang tshor ba po sogs dang // blta bya lta ba po la sogs // des gang cung zad ma lus bshad //
translated: and so on.

original: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma grub pa'i rim pa 'dis /
analyzed: mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma grub pa'i rim pa 'dis /
translated: By this process of the nonestablishment of the basis of those characteristics and the characteristics themselves,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yang ma grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs pa yang ma grub par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that cause and effect and so on are also unestablished.

original: byas pa ni 'bras bu /
analyzed: byas pa ni 'bras bu /
translated: The produced is the effect.

original: byed pa ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed pa ni rgyu'o //
translated: The producer is the cause.

original: myong bar gyur pas tshor ba ste /
analyzed: myong bar gyur pas tshor ba ste /
translated: That which is experienced is the feeling.

original: las la lugs byas nas tshor ba la tshor bar gsungs so //
analyzed: las la lugs byas nas tshor ba la tshor bar gsungs so //
translated: and having made action the norm, he taught feeling as feeling.

original: tshor ba po ni nyams su @309b myong ba yang tshor ba dang tshor ba po ste /
analyzed: tshor ba po ni nyams su @309b myong ba yang tshor ba dang tshor ba po ste /
translated: The feeler is the one who experiences, and feeling is the feeling of the feeler.

original: tshor ba dang tshor ba po'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang tshor ba po'o //
translated: feeling and the feeler.

original: de tshor ba dang tshor ba po dag lhan cig 'jug pas tshor ba dang tshor ba po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de tshor ba dang tshor ba po dag lhan cig 'jug pas tshor ba dang tshor ba po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since feeling and the feeler operate together, they are called feeling and the feeler.

original: sogs pa'i sgras 'du shes dang 'du shes par bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras 'du shes dang 'du shes par bya ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include perception and the perceived, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúThe seer, etc.,‚Äù includes the hearer and the heard, etc.

original: blta bya dang lta ba po la sogs pa gang cung zad kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras thos pa dang thos pa po la sogs pa lnga po rnams kyi gnyis gnyis pa gzung la /
analyzed: blta bya dang lta ba po la sogs pa gang cung zad kyang zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgras thos pa dang thos pa po la sogs pa lnga po rnams kyi gnyis gnyis pa gzung la /
translated: The words ‚Äúin any way‚Äù include the five pairs.

original: gang cung zad ces pa 'dis phan tshun ltos nas grub pa'i gnyis gnyis pa'i dngos po rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang cung zad ces pa 'dis phan tshun ltos nas grub pa'i gnyis gnyis pa'i dngos po rnams gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúin any way‚Äù include all things that are established in mutual dependence.

original: dngos po 'di dag thams cad kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma grub pa'i rim pas ma grub par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'di dag thams cad kyang mtshan gzhi dang mtshan nyid dag ma grub pa'i rim pas ma grub par sbyar ro //
translated: All these things are to be connected with the non-establishment of the characterized and the characteristic.

original: rab tu byed pa 'dir yang re re'i dngos po'i grangs 'jug pa la dpyad pa'i rim pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'dir yang re re'i dngos po'i grangs 'jug pa la dpyad pa'i rim pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In this chapter, the order of analysis is in terms of the number of things.

original: re zhig thog mar dngos po gcig rnam par dpyad de /
analyzed: re zhig thog mar dngos po gcig rnam par dpyad de /
translated: So, first, one thing is analyzed.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus, essence.

original: de'i rjes la rgyu gcig pu nyid de ;
analyzed: de'i rjes la rgyu gcig pu nyid de ;
translated: After that, the single cause is analyzed.

original: 'bras bu yod na 'bras ldan la //
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na 'bras ldan la //
translated: If the effect exists, then it has an effect.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: de yang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rnam pa mang po rnam par dpyad la /
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa la sogs pa'i rim pas rnam pa mang po rnam par dpyad la /
translated: Moreover, the many aspects are analyzed in terms of the order of ignorance and so on.

original: de'i rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la /
translated: After that,

original: ma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
analyzed: ma rig 'du byed med mi 'byung //
translated: ignorance and formations do not occur without it.

original: zhes pa de nas brtsams nas 'di'i bar du gnyis gnyis pa'i dngos po phan tshun ltos pas gnas pa rnams dpyad la /
analyzed: zhes pa de nas brtsams nas 'di'i bar du gnyis gnyis pa'i dngos po phan tshun ltos pas gnas pa rnams dpyad la /
translated: From there, up to here, the things that are mutually dependent in pairs are analyzed.

original: 'di las gzhan pas /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pas /
translated: Other than that,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i gsum gyi grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po rnams rnam par dpyad pa brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa'i gsum gyi grangs kyis yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po rnams rnam par dpyad pa brtsam par bya'o //
translated: the things that are completely determined by the number of the three that have dependence are to be analyzed.

original: gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated:

original: dngos po yod na rtag pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos po yod na rtag pa nyid //
translated: If things exist, then they are permanent.

original: med na nges par chad pa nyid //
analyzed: med na nges par chad pa nyid //
translated: If not, it would definitely be annihilated.

original: dngos por gyur na de gnyis la //
analyzed: dngos por gyur na de gnyis la //
translated: If it were a thing, those two

original: de phyir dngos po khas mi blang //
analyzed: de phyir dngos po khas mi blang //
translated: Therefore, we do not accept things.

original: zhes pa de ni mi 'thad de //
analyzed: zhes pa de ni mi 'thad de //
translated: This is untenable.

original: gal te dngos po khas mi len na de'i tshe dus gsum med la /üîΩdus gsum yod pas de'i phyir dngos po yod de /
analyzed: gal te dngos po khas mi len na de'i tshe dus gsum med la / dus gsum yod pas de'i phyir dngos po yod de /
translated: If you do not accept things, then the three times would not exist.

original: dus gsum gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dus gsum gyi rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: But since the three times exist, therefore things exist, because they are the basis of the three times.

original: /'dir skyes la ma 'gags pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis gnas bzhin pa'i phyir dang / yod bzhin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i sgras brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'dir skyes la ma 'gags pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis gnas bzhin pa'i phyir dang / yod bzhin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i sgras brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, because a thing that has arisen but not yet ceased endures by its own intrinsic nature, and because it exists, it is expressed by the term ‚Äúpresent.‚Äù

original: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs ma thob pa la ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs ma thob pa la ma 'ongs pa zhes brjod la /
translated: That which has not yet attained the state of present is called ‚Äúfuture.‚Äù

original: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs las @310a * //
analyzed: da ltar ba'i gnas skabs las @310a * //
translated: That which has passed beyond the state of present

original: 'das pa nyid la 'das pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'das pa nyid la 'das pa zhes brjod do //
translated: is called ‚Äúpast.‚Äù

original: gal te dngos po med na de ci'i rgyu mtshan gyis dus gsum 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te dngos po med na de ci'i rgyu mtshan gyis dus gsum 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: If things do not exist, by what basis would the three times arise?

original: de'i phyir dus gsum yod pas dngos po yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gsum yod pas dngos po yod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the three times exist, things exist.

original: smras pa / gal te dus gsum yod na dngos po yod par 'gyur la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te dus gsum yod na dngos po yod par 'gyur la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Objection: If the three times exist, then things would exist, but they do not exist.

original: ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩgnas med phan tshun las grub pa //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa de ltar bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa / gnas med phan tshun las grub pa //
translated: In order to demonstrate how they do not exist, he said:üîΩThey do not endure, they are not mutually established,

original: 'chol phyir rang nyid ma grub phyir //
analyzed: 'chol phyir rang nyid ma grub phyir //
translated: They are not established by themselves,

original: dngos po med phyir yod min te //
analyzed: dngos po med phyir yod min te //
translated: They do not exist because things do not exist,

original: dus gsum po ni btags pa tsam //
analyzed: dus gsum po ni btags pa tsam //
translated: The three times are mere designations.

original: gal te dus zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na de la 'dzin la rag na mi 'dzin la //
analyzed: gal te dus zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na de la 'dzin la rag na mi 'dzin la //
translated: If something called ‚Äútime‚Äù exists, then it should be apprehended, but it is not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir 'dzin pa med pas dus med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dzin pa med pas dus med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is not apprehended, time does not exist.

original: yang ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not apprehended?

original: gnas med phyir te /
analyzed: gnas med phyir te /
translated: Because it does not endure.

original: dus zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no //üîΩther zug pa'i dngos po yod na gang zhig 'dzin la rag na /
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba cung zad yod pa ma yin no // ther zug pa'i dngos po yod na gang zhig 'dzin la rag na /
translated: Time does not exist in the least.

original: de las ma bzung ba'i phyir dus med do //
analyzed: de las ma bzung ba'i phyir dus med do //
translated: If a thing that is permanent exists, then it should be apprehended, but since it is not apprehended, time does not exist.

original: yang na gal te yang ther zug pa'i dus gang cung zad mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: yang na gal te yang ther zug pa'i dus gang cung zad mi 'dzin la /
translated: Or, if you say that a permanent time is not apprehended in the least,

original: de lta na yang dus yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang dus yod pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case time would exist.

original: skad cig la sogs pas mngon par gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig la sogs pas mngon par gsal bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is clearly manifest through moments and so on.

original: 'di skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo phyed dang / lo la sogs pa'i dus kyi tshad kyi khyad par rnams te /
analyzed: 'di skad cig dang thang cig dang / yud tsam dang / zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang / lo phyed dang / lo la sogs pa'i dus kyi tshad kyi khyad par rnams te /
translated: The distinctions of time are moments, seconds, minutes, half months, months, half years, years, and so on.

original: khyad par de rnams kyis 'dzin bzhin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par de rnams kyis 'dzin bzhin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they apprehend those distinctions,

original: dus yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dus yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: time exists.

original: smras pa / gal te lo la sogs pa nyid yod na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te lo la sogs pa nyid yod na /
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: If years and so on exist,

original: lo la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'i dus 'dzin la rag na /
analyzed: lo la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'i dus 'dzin la rag na /
translated: then time possessing the measure of years and so on is apprehended.

original: de skad cig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i ther zug pa'i lo la sogs pa mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: de skad cig la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i ther zug pa'i lo la sogs pa mi 'dzin no //
translated: But you do not apprehend years and so on that are permanent and different from moments and so on.

original: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
translated: Again, you may think that

original: re zhig skad cig ma yod na /
analyzed: re zhig skad cig ma yod na /
translated: if moments exist,

original: de la 'dzin pas des na de 'dus pa'i rang bzhin thang cig la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dzin pas des na de 'dus pa'i rang bzhin thang cig la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then since they are apprehended, time consisting of the collection of those moments and so on will arise.

original: smras pa / gang du gnas pa med pa'i skad cig ma rnams la 'dus pa ga la zhig gang du thang cig la sogs pa 'dzin par gyur cing skad cig ma yang yod na thang cig la sogs pa rnam par 'jog grang na /
analyzed: smras pa / gang du gnas pa med pa'i skad cig ma rnams la 'dus pa ga la zhig gang du thang cig la sogs pa 'dzin par gyur cing skad cig ma yang yod na thang cig la sogs pa rnam par 'jog grang na /
translated: Objection: How could there be a collection of moments that do not endure? If one grasps a moment as a second and so on, and if moments exist, then seconds and so on are posited.

original: skad cig de la yang thog ma dang bar dang tha ma yod la /
analyzed: skad cig de la yang thog ma dang bar dang tha ma yod la /
translated: But even in that moment there is a beginning, middle, and end.

original: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma de rnams la yang thog ma dang bar dang tha ma @310b yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma de rnams la yang thog ma dang bar dang tha ma @310b yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those beginning, middle, and end have a beginning, middle, and end,

original: gnas pa med pas skad cig ma yang med na /
analyzed: gnas pa med pas skad cig ma yang med na /
translated: endurance does not exist. If moments do not exist,

original: skad cig ma 'dus pa'i thang cig la sogs pa ga la 'grub /
analyzed: skad cig ma 'dus pa'i thang cig la sogs pa ga la 'grub /
translated: how could seconds and so on that are a collection of moments be established?

original: blo'i rang bzhin gyi 'dus par brtags pas skad cig ma grub pa mi srid de /
analyzed: blo'i rang bzhin gyi 'dus par brtags pas skad cig ma grub pa mi srid de /
translated: Since a collection of moments is imputed to be the nature of cognition, it is impossible for a moment to be established.

original: blo'i skad cig de yang yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dang / de nyid gnas pa med pa'i phyir dus med do //
analyzed: blo'i skad cig de yang yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dang / de nyid gnas pa med pa'i phyir dus med do //
translated: Because that moment of cognition is also imputed and because it does not endure, time does not exist.

original: dus med na dus gsum ni ga la zhig / gnas pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis dus gsum med par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dus med na dus gsum ni ga la zhig / gnas pa med pa 'ba' zhig gis dus gsum med par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only does the three times not exist because of the nonexistence of abiding,

original: phan tshun las grub pas kyang dus gsum med de /üîΩ'di ltar da ltar ba 'das pa las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun las grub pas kyang dus gsum med de / 'di ltar da ltar ba 'das pa las 'das pa'o //
translated: but also the three times do not exist because they are established from each other.

original: da ltar ba ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs pa la /
analyzed: da ltar ba ma 'ongs pa las ma 'ongs pa la /
translated: In this way, the present is established from the past, the past is established from the present, and the future is established from the present.üîΩThe present is established from the future because it is the present that is abiding.

original: gnas bzhin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'o zhes de ltar phan tshun ltos nas grub la /
analyzed: gnas bzhin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'o zhes de ltar phan tshun ltos nas grub la /
translated: Thus, they are established in dependence on each other.

original: dus gsum phan tshun ltos nas grub pas de ma grub pa nyid do zhes bsgrubs pas so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus gsum phan tshun ltos nas grub pas de ma grub pa nyid do zhes bsgrubs pas so zhes bya'o //
translated: But since the three times are established in dependence on each other, they are not established.

original: des na yang dus gsum med do //
analyzed: des na yang dus gsum med do //
translated: Therefore the three times do not exist.

original: 'di ltar yang dus gsum med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dus gsum med de /
translated: In this way, the three times do not exist.

original: 'chol ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'chol ba'i phyir te /
translated: They are confused because

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus de nyid da ltar bar 'ongs pa la da ltar ba zhes brjod la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus de nyid da ltar bar 'ongs pa la da ltar ba zhes brjod la /
translated: the future time itself is called the present when it arrives in the present.

original: da ltar ba la 'das par zhugs pas 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar ba la 'das par zhugs pas 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The present is called the past when it enters the past.

original: gcig nyid la dus gsum du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'chol ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid la dus gsum du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir 'chol ba'o //
translated: Because the three times are posited as one, they are confused.

original: yang na phan tshun ltos nas grub pa'i phyir dus gsum po med de /
analyzed: yang na phan tshun ltos nas grub pa'i phyir dus gsum po med de /
translated: Or, because they exist in mutual dependence, the three times do not exist.

original: 'das pa ni da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa la ma ltos par med la /
analyzed: 'das pa ni da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa la ma ltos par med la /
translated: The past does not exist without depending on the future and present.

original: gal te yang 'das par da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa yod na de'i tshe de la ltos pa 'thad kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang 'das par da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa yod na de'i tshe de la ltos pa 'thad kyi /
translated: If the present and future existed in the past, then it would be tenable to depend on them.

original: 'das pa ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med la /
analyzed: 'das pa ni mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med la /
translated: But the past does not exist like the son of a barren woman.

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu mi ltos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i mo gsham gyi bu mi ltos pa bzhin no //
translated: And like the son of a barren woman, who does not exist, it does not depend on them.

original: gang gi tshe yang 'das par da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag yod na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang 'das par da ltar ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag yod na de'i tshe /
translated: When the present and future exist in the past,

original: 'das par da ltar ba yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das par da ltar ba yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then because the present exists in the past,

original: 'das pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin 'das par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'das pa'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin 'das par 'gyur la /
translated: it would be like the past itself.

original: de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa dang da ltar ba la yang bsam par bya'o ;
analyzed: de ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa dang da ltar ba la yang bsam par bya'o ;
translated: So too, the past and future should be considered in relation to the present.

original: /'di ltar de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba rnams la so sor dus gsum du thal bar 'chol bas /
analyzed: /'di ltar de ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar ba rnams la so sor dus gsum du thal bar 'chol bas /
translated: Thus, since the past, future, and present are individually related to the three times,üîΩthe error of infinite regress would ensue.

original: 'chol ba'i phyir yang dus gsum med do //
analyzed: 'chol ba'i phyir yang dus gsum med do //
translated: Because of the confusion, the three times do not exist.

original: 'di ltar yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang /
translated: In this way,

original: dus gsum mon de rang nyid ma grub phyir //üîΩ'dir skad cig ma la sogs pas dus @311a * //
analyzed: dus gsum mon de rang nyid ma grub phyir // 'dir skad cig ma la sogs pas dus @311a * //
translated: because the three times themselves are not established,

original: mngon par gsal bar pha rol po 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon par gsal bar pha rol po 'dod do //
translated: Here the opponent asserts that time is manifested by the moment and so on.

original: skad cig ma la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dus gang cung zad yod cing /
analyzed: skad cig ma la sogs pa las tha dad pa'i dus gang cung zad yod cing /
translated: But time is not in the least different from the moment and so on,

original: gang zhig des mngon par gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig des mngon par gsal bar byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not manifested by them.

original: ri bong gi rva rang gi ngo bor ma grub pas sus kyang mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva rang gi ngo bor ma grub pas sus kyang mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the rabbit‚Äôs horns are not established as an entity, no one manifests them.

original: des na ngo bo nyid kyis dus ma grub bo //
analyzed: des na ngo bo nyid kyis dus ma grub bo //
translated: Therefore time is not established by its own nature.

original: dus kyang med na de'i gsum nyid ga la zhig ces bya ste /
analyzed: dus kyang med na de'i gsum nyid ga la zhig ces bya ste /
translated: If time does not exist, how could there be a third of it?

original: dus gsum med do //
analyzed: dus gsum med do //
translated: The three times do not exist.

original: gzhan yang khyod kyis dngos po bsgrub pa'i phyir dus gsum nye bar gzhag la /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod kyis dngos po bsgrub pa'i phyir dus gsum nye bar gzhag la /
translated: Moreover, you posit the three times in order to establish entities.

original: dus de yang dngos po la ma ltos par ma grub la /
analyzed: dus de yang dngos po la ma ltos par ma grub la /
translated: But that time is not established without depending on entities,

original: dngos po nyid la brten nas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nyid la brten nas de rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is posited in dependence on entities themselves.

original: dngos po de yang sngar nyid du med do zhes bsgrubs la /
analyzed: dngos po de yang sngar nyid du med do zhes bsgrubs la /
translated: That entity also does not exist previously.

original: dus gsum po /
analyzed: dus gsum po /
translated: The three times

original: dngos po med phyir yod min te //
analyzed: dngos po med phyir yod min te //
translated: do not exist because the entity does not exist.

original: gal te de ltar dus gsum po med na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dus gsum po med na /
translated: If the three times do not exist in that way,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar dus gsum du tha snyad byed ce na ;
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar dus gsum du tha snyad byed ce na ;
translated: then how are the three times conventionally designated?

original: smras pa / dus gsum po btags pa tsam yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro btags pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / dus gsum po btags pa tsam yang dag pa ma yin pas sgro btags pa tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: We reply: The three times are mere designations, not real. The meaning of ‚Äúmere designation‚Äù is this.

original: dus gsum med la /
analyzed: dus gsum med la /
translated: The three times do not exist.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yang med do zhes grub po //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po yang med do zhes grub po //
translated: The reason for that is that the entity does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdngos po yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dngos po yod pa nyid de /
translated: Here someone might say this:

original: de yang 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin te de'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin te de'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: An entity exists because its nature, that is, its characteristic, exists.

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa la mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa la mtshan nyid med de /
translated: That which is not existent does not have a characteristic,

original: 'di lta ste mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'o //
translated: just like, for example, the son of a barren woman.

original: dngos po ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa zhes bya ba yod la /
analyzed: dngos po ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa zhes bya ba yod la /
translated: An entity has the characteristics of the produced: arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pas 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po yod do zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / gal te de'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yod pas 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po yod do zhe na / smras pa / gal te de'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yod na /
translated: Therefore, since its characteristics exist, conditioned phenomena exist.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩIf the characteristics of conditioned phenomena exist,

original: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin yod la /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rang bzhin yod la /
translated: conditioned phenomena would exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But they do not exist.üîΩThe characteristics of conditioned phenomena

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid skye ba dang // gnas 'jig gsum po 'di yang med ;
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid skye ba dang // gnas 'jig gsum po 'di yang med ;
translated: Are arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: / gang phyir 'dus byas med 'di las //
analyzed: / gang phyir 'dus byas med 'di las //
translated: Since conditioned phenomena do not exist,

original: 'dus ma byas pa cung zad med //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa cung zad med //
translated: Unconditioned phenomena do not exist in the least.

original: de la 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la 'dis mtshon par byed pas na mtshan nyid de /
translated: Here ‚Äúcharacteristics‚Äù are so called because they characterize something.

original: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pas shes pas /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen 'dus pas shes pas /
translated: Since they are known through the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: 'dus pa las 'byung bar byed pa 'dus byas la /
analyzed: 'dus pa las 'byung bar byed pa 'dus byas la /
translated: they arise from an assembly.

original: 'dus byas dang mtshan nyid pas 'dus @311b byas kyi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang mtshan nyid pas 'dus @311b byas kyi mtshan nyid de /
translated: Since they are characteristics of conditioned phenomena, they are characteristics of conditioned phenomena.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: skye ba gnas dang 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gnas dang 'jig pa'o //
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasing.

original: skye gnas 'jig pa zhes bya ba gsum po de nyid kyang med na /
analyzed: skye gnas 'jig pa zhes bya ba gsum po de nyid kyang med na /
translated: If those three, arising, enduring, and ceasing, do not exist,

original: gang gi phyir gsum pos 'dus byas 'jug pa med par de ni sngar nyid du bsgrubs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsum pos 'dus byas 'jug pa med par de ni sngar nyid du bsgrubs te /
translated: Because the three conditions do not cause the engagement of the produced, that was already proven above.

original: yod pa yod phyir skye ba min //
analyzed: yod pa yod phyir skye ba min //
translated: Production does not exist because existence exists.

original: med pa med phyir mi skye ba //
analyzed: med pa med phyir mi skye ba //
translated: Nonproduction does not exist because nonexistence does not exist.

original: zhes pas 'dir gang gi tshe gang las 'dus byas 'jug pa de'i gsum po ma grub na /
analyzed: zhes pas 'dir gang gi tshe gang las 'dus byas 'jug pa de'i gsum po ma grub na /
translated: Here, when the three conditions do not establish the engagement of the produced,

original: de'i tshe 'dus byas ma grub pa don gyis bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dus byas ma grub pa don gyis bsgrubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the nonestablishment of the produced is implicitly established.

original: gang gi phyir 'dus byas med na 'di las 'dus ma byas yin pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dus byas med na 'di las 'dus ma byas yin pa yang cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Because if the produced does not exist, then the unproduced also does not exist in the least.

original: de la gzugs med pas nam mkhar tha snyad byas la /
analyzed: de la gzugs med pas nam mkhar tha snyad byas la /
translated: In that regard, because form does not exist, space is a convention.

original: 'dus byas rnams rkyen ma tshang pas mi skye ba la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams rkyen ma tshang pas mi skye ba la so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The nonproduction of produced things due to the incompleteness of conditions is nonanalytical cessation.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas rnams nyid shes rab kyi stobs kyis bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thob bya'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus byas rnams nyid shes rab kyi stobs kyis bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi thob bya'i 'gog pa ni so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The cessation that is to be attained through the power of wisdom, which is the characteristic of separation from contaminated produced things, is analytical cessation.

original: 'dus byas med na de la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas kyang med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas med na de la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas kyang med pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas med do zhes bya'o //
translated: If the conditioned does not exist, then the unconditioned does not exist, since it does not depend on that.

original: smras pa / slar yang skye ba la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag ci ltar med ces brjod //üîΩ'di ni skyes pa bskyed bya min //
analyzed: smras pa / slar yang skye ba la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag ci ltar med ces brjod // 'di ni skyes pa bskyed bya min //
translated: Objection: Again, how could these three, arising and so on, be nonexistent?üîΩIt is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúThat which has arisen does not arise again,‚Äù

original: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pas bsgrubs pa yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa bstan pas bsgrubs pa yang ma yin nam /
translated: and so on, because this is established by the statement, ‚ÄúThat which has arisen has arisen.‚Äù

original: de ni rgyu brtag pa dang 'brel pas 'dus byas brtag pa dang 'brel par brjod la /
analyzed: de ni rgyu brtag pa dang 'brel pas 'dus byas brtag pa dang 'brel par brjod la /
translated: This is related to the investigation of causes, but it is stated in the context of the investigation of the conditioned.

original: ji ltar de ltar smos pas kyang 'di dag gsungs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar smos pas kyang 'di dag gsungs par 'gyur la /
translated: And just as it is stated in this way, it is also stated in this way.

original: gal te de ltar yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag med par bstan na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag med par bstan na /
translated: If the conditioned and the unconditioned are taught to be nonexistent in this way,

original: slar yang de bsgrub pa brtsam pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slar yang de bsgrub pa brtsam pa'i phyir /
translated: then again, in order to establish this,

original: 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: it is said here:

original: 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig cing //
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig cing //
translated: That which is not destroyed does not perish.

original: gnas pa gnas par mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: gnas pa gnas par mi 'gyur la //
translated: That which endures does not endure.

original: gnas pa min pa'ang mi gnas te //
analyzed: gnas pa min pa'ang mi gnas te //
translated: That which does not endure does not endure.

original: skyes pa skye min ma skyes pa'ang //
analyzed: skyes pa skye min ma skyes pa'ang //
translated: That which has arisen does not arise. That which has not arisen does not arise.

original: 'dir gal te 'jig pa zhes bya ba cung zad yod na /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po'am /üîΩmi 'jig par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dir gal te 'jig pa zhes bya ba cung zad yod na / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dngos po'am / mi 'jig par 'gyur la /
translated: Here, if something called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù exists,üîΩthen the TathƒÅgata would be impermanent.

original: de la re zhig 'jig pa med pa la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'jig pa med pa la mi 'thad de /
translated: But that is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang las 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig ste //üîΩ'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa dang @312a * //
analyzed: gang las 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig ste // 'jig pa med pa zhes bya ba 'jig pa dang @312a * //
translated: That which is not destroyed does not cease.üîΩHow could one say that that which is called ‚Äúnon-destruction,‚Äù

original: bral ba de 'jig pa med la 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par ji ltar nus /
analyzed: bral ba de 'jig pa med la 'jig par 'gyur ro zhes brjod par ji ltar nus /
translated: that is, that which is free from destruction, is destroyed?

original: de'i phyir 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig cing //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig cing //
translated: Therefore, that which is not destroyed does not cease.

original: da ni zhig pa'ang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: da ni zhig pa'ang 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Now, that which is destroyed also does not cease.

original: zhig pa zhes bya ba yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhig pa zhes bya ba yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù does not exist.

original: de yang 'jig ces brjod par ji ltar rung //
analyzed: de yang 'jig ces brjod par ji ltar rung //
translated: How could it be said to be destroyed?

original: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dag las gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dag las gzhan du rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: There is no third alternative apart from that which is destroyed and that which is not destroyed.üîΩMoreover, that which is called ‚Äúdestroyed‚Äù does not exist.

original: gang zhig 'jig par 'gyur zhes pa yang gang gi tshe 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig cing zhig pa yang mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig par 'gyur zhes pa yang gang gi tshe 'jig pa med pa mi 'jig cing zhig pa yang mi 'jig pa de'i phyir /
translated: How could it be said to be destroyed?

original: 'jig pa med do zhes grub po //
analyzed: 'jig pa med do zhes grub po //
translated: Thus, it is established that destruction does not exist.

original: da ni ji ltar gnas pa yod med do zhes bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar gnas pa yod med do zhes bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: Now, how is it established that endurance does not exist?

original: 'dir 'di dag gnas par yongs su rtog pa na /
analyzed: 'dir 'di dag gnas par yongs su rtog pa na /
translated: Here, when endurance is imagined,

original: gnas pa'i dngos po'am mi gnas pa'i dngos por yongs su rtog / gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnas pa'i dngos po'am mi gnas pa'i dngos por yongs su rtog / gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: it is imagined as an enduring entity or a non-enduring entity. In order to establish that both are untenable, it is said:

original: gnas pa gnas par mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: gnas pa gnas par mi 'gyur la //
translated: Endurance does not endure.

original: gnas pa med pa'ang mi gnas te //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'ang mi gnas te // zhes pa la /
translated: Nor does non-endurance endure.

original: re zhig gnas pa'i dngos po la gnas pa med de /
analyzed: re zhig gnas pa'i dngos po la gnas pa med de /
translated: First, an enduring entity does not endure.

original: gnas par bya ba dang bral ba'i dngos po gnas pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: gnas par bya ba dang bral ba'i dngos po gnas pa zhes brjod la /
translated: An entity devoid of the activity of enduring is called enduring.

original: gnas pa la gnas pa'i bya ba dang bral ba mi srid pas de'i phyir gnas pa gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa la gnas pa'i bya ba dang bral ba mi srid pas de'i phyir gnas pa gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is impossible for endurance to be devoid of the activity of enduring, therefore endurance does not endure.

original: gnas pa med pa'ang gnas pa'i bya ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa'ang gnas pa'i bya ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: Nor does non-endurance endure, because it is devoid of the activity of enduring.

original: gang yang gnas pa'i bya ba dang bral ba de ji ltar gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang gnas pa'i bya ba dang bral ba de ji ltar gnas par 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is devoid of the activity of enduring endure?

original: de'i phyir gnas pa yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa yang med do //
translated: Therefore, endurance does not exist.

original: da ni skye ba mi srid par bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni skye ba mi srid par bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to prove that arising is impossible, it is said:

original: skyes pa skye min ma skyes pa'ang //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: skyes pa skye min ma skyes pa'ang // zhes pa la /
translated: That which has arisen does not arise. That which has not arisen does not arise.

original: skyes pa re zhig mi skye ste //
analyzed: skyes pa re zhig mi skye ste //
translated: That which has arisen does not arise,

original: skye ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the activity of arising.

original: ma skyes pa'ang mi skye ste //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'ang mi skye ste //
translated: That which has not arisen does not arise,

original: skye ba'i bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i bya ba'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not an object of the activity of arising.

original: des na 'dus byas med la /
analyzed: des na 'dus byas med la /
translated: Therefore, the conditioned does not exist.

original: de ma grub na /
analyzed: de ma grub na /
translated: If that is not established,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang med do zhes grub po //üîΩgal te na yang 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang med do zhes grub po // gal te na yang 'dus byas sam /
translated: then the unconditioned also does not exist.

original: 'dus ma byas gang cung zad yod na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas gang cung zad yod na /
translated: If something, whether conditioned or unconditioned, exists in the least,

original: de nges par tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa zhig grang /
analyzed: de nges par tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa zhig grang /
translated: then it must definitely be either different or not different.

original: gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang mi 'thad do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to prove that both are untenable, it is said:üîΩThe conditioned and the unconditioned

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa dag / du ma ma yin gcig ma yin //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas pa dag / du ma ma yin gcig ma yin //
translated: are not many and not one.

original: med min yod min yod med min //
analyzed: med min yod min yod med min //
translated: They are not nonexistent, not existent, and not both existent and nonexistent.

original: mtshams 'dir sna tshogs thams @312b cad 'dus //
analyzed: mtshams 'dir sna tshogs thams @312b cad 'dus //
translated: Here, all varieties are included.

original: re zhig 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag tha dad par grub pa med la /
analyzed: re zhig 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag tha dad par grub pa med la /
translated: First, the conditioned and the unconditioned are not established as different.

original: gal te yod na 'dus byas la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas yod de /
analyzed: gal te yod na 'dus byas la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas yod de /
translated: If they were, the unconditioned would exist without depending on the conditioned,

original: bum pa las gzhan pa snam bu'i rang gi ngo bo grub pas bum pa la mi ltos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa las gzhan pa snam bu'i rang gi ngo bo grub pas bum pa la mi ltos pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the intrinsic reality of a cloth that is different from a pot is established without depending on a pot.

original: 'dus byas la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas kyi rang gi ngo bo grub pa mi srid la /
analyzed: 'dus byas la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas kyi rang gi ngo bo grub pa mi srid la /
translated: The intrinsic reality of the unconditioned is not possible without depending on the conditioned.

original: ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar yang sngar bsgrubs so //
analyzed: ji ltar mi srid pa de ltar yang sngar bsgrubs so //
translated: We have already proven how it is impossible.

original: gzhan yang 'dus ma byas kyi sgras /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus ma byas kyi sgras /
translated: Moreover, the term unconditioned

original: 'dus byas rnam par bcad nas rang gi don rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'dus byas rnam par bcad nas rang gi don rtogs par byed de /
translated: makes its referent known by excluding the conditioned.

original: 'di ni 'dus byas ma yin la 'on kyang 'dus ma byas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dus byas ma yin la 'on kyang 'dus ma byas so zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not conditioned, but rather it is unconditioned.

original: gang gi tshe yang de de ltar na de'i tshe 'dus byas kho na la ltos nas 'dus ma byas rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang de de ltar na de'i tshe 'dus byas kho na la ltos nas 'dus ma byas rnam par gzhag la /
translated: If that is so, then the unconditioned is posited in dependence on the conditioned.

original: du ma grub par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: du ma grub par mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that it is established as many.

original: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas dag 'gal bas kyang 'gal zla'i dngos po gzhan la ma ltos par rang nyid dang 'gal ba mi rigs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas 'dus ma byas dag 'gal bas kyang 'gal zla'i dngos po gzhan la ma ltos par rang nyid dang 'gal ba mi rigs so zhes bya ste /
translated: Since the conditioned and the unconditioned are contradictory, it is illogical that they are contradictory without relying on another contradictory object.

original: des na yang 'dus byas la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas mi srid do //
analyzed: des na yang 'dus byas la ma ltos par 'dus ma byas mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, the unconditioned is impossible without relying on the conditioned.

original: de bzhin du 'dus byas la yang brjod do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus byas la yang brjod do zhes bya ste /
translated: The same applies to the conditioned.

original: de ltar na re zhig du ma 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig du ma 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the many are neither conditioned nor unconditioned.

original: da ni gcig nyid la yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag med de /
analyzed: da ni gcig nyid la yang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag med de /
translated: Now, the conditioned and the unconditioned do not exist in the one either,

original: snang ba dang mun pa bzhin phan tshun 'gal bar khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / gnyis nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa bzhin phan tshun 'gal bar khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / mtshan nyid tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / gnyis nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because light and darkness are mutually contradictory, because their characteristics are contradictory, and because they are contradictory in being two.

original: gzhan yang 'dus byas zhes bya ba cung zad yod na /üîΩde yod pa'am med pa'am yod med skye //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus byas zhes bya ba cung zad yod na / de yod pa'am med pa'am yod med skye //
translated: Moreover, if the so-called conditioned exists,üîΩit would arise as existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent.

original: de la re zhig yod pa mi skye ste yod bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la re zhig yod pa mi skye ste yod bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, the existent does not arise because it exists.

original: med pa yang mi skye ste med bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yang mi skye ste med bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, what is nonexistent does not arise because it is nonexistent.

original: yod med kyang mi skye ste phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig pa mi srid do //
analyzed: yod med kyang mi skye ste phan tshun 'gal ba dag gcig pa mi srid do //
translated: Also, what is both existent and nonexistent does not arise because mutually contradictory things cannot be one.

original: yang na gal te 'dus byas zhes bya ba cung zad yod na /
analyzed: yang na gal te 'dus byas zhes bya ba cung zad yod na /
translated: Moreover, if something called ‚Äúconditioned‚Äù existed in the least,

original: de yod pa'am med pa'am yod med du yod par 'gyur la /üîΩde la re zhig yod pa ma yin te /
