analyzed: de yod pa'am med pa'am yod med du yod par 'gyur la / de la re zhig yod pa ma yin te /
translated: it would exist as existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent.

original: yod pa rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / rgyu med pa la yod bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir dang / rgyu med pa la yod bzhin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, it is not existent because what exists does not depend on a cause and what is causeless does not exist as existent.

original: ji srid du /
analyzed: ji srid du /
translated: As long as

original: 'phags pa lhas /üîΩma brten yod pa nam yang ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa lhas / ma brten yod pa nam yang ni //
translated: ƒÄryadeva says:üîΩWithout support, an existent

original: 'ga' zhig gang na'ang yod ma yin //üîΩnam yang @313a * //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang na'ang yod ma yin // nam yang @313a * //
translated: never exists anywhere at all.üîΩWithout support, a nonexistent

original: 'ga' zhig gang na yang //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gang na yang //
translated: never exists anywhere at all.

original: med pa des na rtag ma yin //üîΩzhes so // med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa des na rtag ma yin // zhes so // med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not permanent.

original: ngo bo nyid ma grub pa kho nas dngos po med pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma grub pa kho nas dngos po med pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not nonexistent because, since it is not established as an entity, nonentity also does not exist.

original: dngos po rab tu ma grub na //
analyzed: dngos po rab tu ma grub na //
translated: If an entity is not established,

original: dngos med 'grub par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos med 'grub par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could a nonentity be established?

original: zhes pa'i tshig las so ;
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig las so ;
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: / yod med kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: / yod med kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it both existent and nonexistent,

original: gcig la 'gal ba'i chos gnyis kyi bdag nyid can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la 'gal ba'i chos gnyis kyi bdag nyid can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for a single thing to have the nature of two contradictory properties.

original: de bzhin du 'dus ma byas la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus ma byas la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas 'ba' zhig kho na la gcig dang / gzhan dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga yang mi srid pa 'thad par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dus byas 'ba' zhig kho na la gcig dang / gzhan dang / yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyi ga yang mi srid pa 'thad par ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it impossible for conditioned things to be identical, different, both, or neither,

original: gzhan yang nges par zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / gzugs can dang gzugs med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang / thogs bcas dang thogs med dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / mtshan gzhi dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang nges par zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa dang / gzugs can dang gzugs med pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang / thogs bcas dang thogs med dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / mtshan gzhi dang /
translated: but it is also impossible for them to be both contaminated and uncontaminated, to have form and to be formless, to be both visible and invisible, both resistant and nonresistant, both cause and effect, both the basis of characteristics and the characteristics themselves, both the basis of the secondary characteristics and the secondary characteristics themselves, both the basis of the mental factors and the mental factors themselves, both wholesome and unwholesome, both virtue and nonvirtue, both determined and undetermined, both compounded and uncompounded, both transcendent and not transcendent, both mundane and supramundane, and both with training and without training.

original: mtshan nyid dang nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa po dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa la sogs pa dang dngos po thams cad la yang 'di ltar brtag pa'i rnam par gzhag pa las shin tu mi rtogs te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang nye bar len pa dang / nye bar len pa po dang / 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa la sogs pa dang dngos po thams cad la yang 'di ltar brtag pa'i rnam par gzhag pa las shin tu mi rtogs te /
translated: In the same way, one should understand that all things, such as characteristics and the appropriated, the appropriator, the elements and the derivative of the elements, are not at all established in the way they are imagined, by way of the alternatives of identity and difference, etc.

original: ji skad du smos pa'i de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa las bsams pa'i sgo nas dgag pa'i ngag gi go skabs thob par byas pas so //
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pa las bsams pa'i sgo nas dgag pa'i ngag gi go skabs thob par byas pas so //
translated: Because they are refuted by the attainment of the opportunity of the words of negation by way of the consideration of the alternatives of identity and difference, etc., as they have been stated.

original: der 'dus pa'i phyir yang nges par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ltar de dag dgag par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /üîΩmtshams 'dir sna tshogs thams cad 'dus //
analyzed: der 'dus pa'i phyir yang nges par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas ltar de dag dgag par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs pa / mtshams 'dir sna tshogs thams cad 'dus //
translated: And because they are included there, they should be understood to be refuted, like the produced and the unproduced.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: Here, ‚Äúall varieties are included.‚Äù

original: mtshams dang khrims dang de'i bar du zhes pa don gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshams dang khrims dang de'i bar du zhes pa don gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Here, ‚Äúhere‚Äù and ‚Äúthere‚Äù and ‚Äúin between‚Äù do not have a different meaning.

original: thams cad kyi sgra ni zad par gyi don to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgra ni zad par gyi don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúall‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúexhaustively.‚Äù

original: sna tshogs kyi sgra ni rnam pa'i don to zhes rig par bya'o /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi sgra ni rnam pa'i don to zhes rig par bya'o /
translated: The word ‚Äúvarieties‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúaspects.‚Äù

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: ji skad du smos pa'i 'dus byas la sogs pa rang bzhin med par bsgrub par mi nus te /
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i 'dus byas la sogs pa rang bzhin med par bsgrub par mi nus te /
translated: The lack of intrinsic existence of the produced and so forth, as they have been presented, cannot be established.

original: lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: This is because it contradicts scripture.

original: 'di ltar / bla ma bcom ldan la gnas dang // las kyi bdag nyid 'bras bu gsungs //
analyzed: 'di ltar / bla ma bcom ldan la gnas dang // las kyi bdag nyid 'bras bu gsungs //
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn said that the self is the locus of karma and its effects:

original: sems can rang gi las dang ni //
analyzed: sems can rang gi las dang ni //
translated: The sentient being is the agent of karma,

original: las ni rnam par 'jig med gsungs //
analyzed: las ni rnam par 'jig med gsungs //
translated: And the effects of karma are said not to disintegrate.

original: mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the s≈´tras:

original: nor dang 'bru dang sa le sbram //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru dang sa le sbram //
translated: Wealth, grain, and gold,

original: nor bu'i rna @313b rgyan ba lang rta //
analyzed: nor bu'i rna @313b rgyan ba lang rta //
translated: Pearls, earrings, cows, horses,

original: bran dang las byed mngag gzhug pa //
analyzed: bran dang las byed mngag gzhug pa //
translated: Servants, workers, and slaves,üîΩWhatever wealth is to be left behind,

original: gang yang gzhag pa'i nor rnams dang // cung zad khyer nas 'gro min zhing //
analyzed: gang yang gzhag pa'i nor rnams dang // cung zad khyer nas 'gro min zhing //
translated: One cannot take even a little with one when one goes.

original: thams cad bor nas 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad bor nas 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: One must go leaving everything behind.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs mngon gyur pa //
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs mngon gyur pa //
translated: The final state will manifest,

original: mi yi srid pa spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi yi srid pa spong bar 'gyur //
translated: And one will leave behind the human state.

original: ci nge rang gis cung zad tsam //
analyzed: ci nge rang gis cung zad tsam //
translated: What is it that one takes with one

original: blangs nas de ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: blangs nas de ni 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: When one goes?

original: 'di yis ci zhig mi spong na //
analyzed: 'di yis ci zhig mi spong na //
translated: What is it that one does not leave behind?

original: ji ltar grib ma rjes 'gro bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar grib ma rjes 'gro bzhin //
translated: Like a shadow that never departs.üîΩThe evil and the merit

original: gang zhig skyes bu 'dir byas pa'i //üîΩsdig pa dang ni bsod nams gnyis //üîΩde ni de yi rang gir 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig skyes bu 'dir byas pa'i // sdig pa dang ni bsod nams gnyis // de ni de yi rang gir 'gyur //
translated: That a person has done hereüîΩWill be his own.

original: de yang blangs nas 'gro bas na //
analyzed: de yang blangs nas 'gro bas na //
translated: And he will take them with him when he goes.

original: 'di dag de yis mi spong ste //
analyzed: 'di dag de yis mi spong ste //
translated: They will not abandon him,

original: ji ltar grib ma rjes 'gro bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar grib ma rjes 'gro bzhin //
translated: Like a shadow that follows him.

original: ji ltar lam ngan nas 'gro ba //
analyzed: ji ltar lam ngan nas 'gro ba //
translated: Just as a traveler on a bad road

original: 'gro ba po 'dir sdug bsngal 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro ba po 'dir sdug bsngal 'gyur //
translated: Suffers on this earth,

original: de bzhin bsod nams ma byas pa'i //
analyzed: de bzhin bsod nams ma byas pa'i //

analyzed: sems can ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur //

original: ji ltar lam bzangs nas 'gro ba //
analyzed: ji ltar lam bzangs nas 'gro ba //

original: 'gro ba po 'dir bde bas 'gro //
analyzed: 'gro ba po 'dir bde bas 'gro //

original: de bzhin 'dir byas bsod nams kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir byas bsod nams kyis //

analyzed: sems can bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur // skyes bu yun ring 'dren byas nas //
translated: Will go to the higher realms.üîΩWhen a person has been led a long time

analyzed: ring nas dge bar 'ongs pa na //

analyzed: gnyen 'dun snying dga' 'grogs bshes rnams //
translated: His heart‚Äôs delight, his companions,

analyzed: 'dir 'ongs pa la mngon par bstod //

original: de bzhin bsod nams byas pa yi //
analyzed: de bzhin bsod nams byas pa yi //
translated: In the same way, when a person

analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas pha rol 'gro //
translated: You will go from this world to the next.

original: bsod nams kho na mngon bstod de //
analyzed: bsod nams kho na mngon bstod de //

original: mdza' sdug bshes gnyen lta bur 'ongs //üîΩde phyir bsod nams phung po ni //
analyzed: mdza' sdug bshes gnyen lta bur 'ongs // de phyir bsod nams phung po ni //
translated: and it comes like a friend or relative.üîΩTherefore, you who are going to the next world,

analyzed: pha rol 'gro ba rnams kyis byos // bsod nams 'jig rten pha rol du //

analyzed: srog chags rnams kyis rab gnas brjod //

analyzed: bsod nams lha rnams bsngags par byed //

original: zhi ba'i spyod pa'ang gang spyod pa //
analyzed: zhi ba'i spyod pa'ang gang spyod pa //

analyzed: 'dir yang smod par mi 'gyur zhing //

analyzed: mtho ris 'gro la rjes yi rang //

original: zhes pa mdo 'dir /
analyzed: zhes pa mdo 'dir /
translated: In this sutra,

analyzed: nor dang 'bru la sogs pa chud zos kyang las gnas par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //

original: slar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: slar yang gsungs pa /
translated: He also said:

original: bsod nams me yis mi tshig cing //
analyzed: bsod nams me yis mi tshig cing //
translated: Merit is not burned by fire

original: rlung gis 'jig pa'ang ma yin to //
analyzed: rlung gis 'jig pa'ang ma yin to //
translated: and is not destroyed by wind.

original: chu yis gsher ba ma yin la //
analyzed: chu yis gsher ba ma yin la //
translated: It is not moistened by water

original: sa la nub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa la nub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and does not sink into the earth.

original: zhes pa 'dis kyang gnas par gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis kyang gnas par gsungs la /
translated: This also teaches that it remains.

original: yod bzhin pa @314a * //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa @314a * //
translated: It is not tenable to indicate that something that exists

original: ma yin pa'i nam mkha'i me tog la gnas pa nye bar bstan pa mi 'thad do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa'i nam mkha'i me tog la gnas pa nye bar bstan pa mi 'thad do zhes bya'o //
translated: abides in a sky flower that does not exist.

original: des na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas bzhin chos thams cad med par gnas par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas bzhin chos thams cad med par gnas par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, just as conditioned and unconditioned phenomena cannot be said to exist, it is not possible to say that all phenomena abide in nonexistence.

original: las kyi bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: las kyi bdag nyid kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also taught the nature of karma:

original: dge slong dag mtha' gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa yang mtha' gcig tu gnag pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag mtha' gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa yang mtha' gcig tu gnag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, the karmic ripening of actions that are completely black is completely black.

original: mtha' gcig tu dkar ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yang mtha' gcig tu dkar ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' gcig tu dkar ba'i las kyi rnam par smin pa yang mtha' gcig tu dkar ba'o //
translated: The karmic ripening of actions that are completely white is completely white.üîΩThe karmic ripening of mixed actions is mixed.‚Äù

original: 'dren ma rnams kyi 'dren ma'o zhes pa'i tshig las /üîΩgang gi las kyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo de /
analyzed: 'dren ma rnams kyi 'dren ma'o zhes pa'i tshig las / gang gi las kyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo de /
translated: From these words,üîΩthe nature of karma is its essence.

original: las kyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: las kyi bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the nature of karma is the result of karma.

original: las kyi med na yang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges par mi brjod pas /
analyzed: las kyi med na yang de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nges par mi brjod pas /
translated: If karma does not exist, then its cause and result cannot be said to be certain.

original: des na las yod par rigs la /
analyzed: des na las yod par rigs la /
translated: Therefore it is logical that karma exists.

original: de las dngos po thams cad grub po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las dngos po thams cad grub po zhes bya'o //
translated: and from that, all things are established.

original: sems can rang gi las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can rang gi las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also taught the karma of sentient beings:üîΩ‚ÄúThe karma of sentient human beings is such that some give gifts,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can mi rnams kyi rang gi las la las ni sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig las lus zhig na nor dang 'bru la sogs pa 'jog par byed la /
analyzed: sems can mi rnams kyi rang gi las la las ni sbyin pa sbyin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig las lus zhig na nor dang 'bru la sogs pa 'jog par byed la /
translated: Since the karma of sentient beings is such that some give gifts, when their bodies disintegrate, they leave behind their wealth and grain, and so on.

original: las ni 'jig rten pha rol du rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir las kyang gang gi rang gi bde ba ni rang gi las so //
analyzed: las ni 'jig rten pha rol du rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir las kyang gang gi rang gi bde ba ni rang gi las so //
translated: Since karma follows them into the next world, karma is also one‚Äôs own karma, which is one‚Äôs own happiness.

original: des na yang de'i las yod la /
analyzed: des na yang de'i las yod la /
translated: Therefore, karma exists for them.

original: sems can de'ang yod pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de'ang yod pas dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: And since sentient beings exist, things do not lack intrinsic existence.‚Äù

original: las rnam par 'jig pa med par yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: las rnam par 'jig pa med par yang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs te /
translated: The TathƒÅgata also taught that karma is indestructible:

original: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi las rnams ni //
translated: The karma of embodied beings

original: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang chud mi za //
translated: Does not disintegrate even in a hundred eons.

original: tshogs pa rnyed nas dus su ni //
analyzed: tshogs pa rnyed nas dus su ni //
translated: When the assemblage and the occasion are complete,

original: 'bras bu gdon mi za bar smin //
analyzed: 'bras bu gdon mi za bar smin //
translated: There is no doubt that the fruit will ripen.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang las med na chud mi za ba'i tshig rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang las med na chud mi za ba'i tshig rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if karma does not exist, the statement ‚Äúit does not expire‚Äù is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir las yod la las yod pa'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir las yod la las yod pa'i phyir dngos po rnams rang bzhin dang bcas pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since karma exists, and since karma exists, things are said to possess intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa la lung 'dis gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pa la lung 'dis gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: This scripture does not undermine the absence of intrinsic reality of things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir sngar nyid du de lta bu la sogs pa'i lung 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs so zhes bsgrubs @314b pa rjes su gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar nyid du de lta bu la sogs pa'i lung 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gis gsungs so zhes bsgrubs @314b pa rjes su gnas so //
translated: Because previously it was established that such scriptures were taught in terms of worldly convention.

original: 'di dag kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: And this must be accepted without doubt.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Because the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: las rnams rang bzhin med gsungs te //
analyzed: las rnams rang bzhin med gsungs te //
translated: Karma has no intrinsic reality.

original: ma skyes gang de chud mi za //
analyzed: ma skyes gang de chud mi za //
translated: What is not arisen does not expire.

original: de las kyang ni bdag 'dzin med //
analyzed: de las kyang ni bdag 'dzin med //
translated: And from that, there is no grasping of self.

original: des bskyed 'dzin pa'ang rnam rtog las //
analyzed: des bskyed 'dzin pa'ang rnam rtog las //
translated: That which is generated is also grasped from conceptualization.

original: de la mi rtag dang ldan 'dus byas rnams //üîΩzhes gsungs pas na /
analyzed: de la mi rtag dang ldan 'dus byas rnams // zhes gsungs pas na /
translated: And they are impermanent, compounded, and produced.

original: las kyang mi rtag go zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /üîΩgang mi rtag pa de yang rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyang mi rtag go zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa / gang mi rtag pa de yang rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the BhagavƒÅn has said that karma is impermanent.

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever is impermanent is also essenceless, because an essence cannot change into something else.

original: de yang gal te rang bzhin yod pa la dgongs nas las yod do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs par gyur na /
analyzed: de yang gal te rang bzhin yod pa la dgongs nas las yod do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs par gyur na /
translated: If the BhagavƒÅn had in mind that karma exists essentially when he said that karma exists,

original: slar yang las mi rtag par gsung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar yang las mi rtag par gsung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then he would not have said that karma is impermanent.

original: de ni mi rtag pa dang rang bzhin yod pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de ni mi rtag pa dang rang bzhin yod pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro // bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: This is because it would be contradictory for it to be both impermanent and to exist essentially.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed du gsungs la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed du gsungs la /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said that ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are karmic processes.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin yod bzhin pa la brten nas skye ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod bzhin pa la brten nas skye ba 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable for something that exists essentially to arise in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ni las rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed pa nyid do zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' ni las rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed pa nyid do zhes bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to prove that the BhagavƒÅn‚Äôs word clarifies that actions lack intrinsic existence, it is said:

original: las rnams rang bzhin med gsungs pa //
analyzed: las rnams rang bzhin med gsungs pa //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn has said that actions lack intrinsic existence.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: gang kho nas rang bzhin med pa de nyid kyis na ma skyes la /üîΩgang yang ma skyes pa de nyid kyis na de ni 'jig pa med par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gang kho nas rang bzhin med pa de nyid kyis na ma skyes la / gang yang ma skyes pa de nyid kyis na de ni 'jig pa med par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: because they lack intrinsic existence, they are not produced.üîΩAnd because they are not produced, they do not disintegrate.üîΩThe BhagavƒÅn has said that actions do not expire.

original: las rnams chud mi za zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang yang 'di ltar mi 'dod na /
analyzed: las rnams chud mi za zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang yang 'di ltar mi 'dod na /
translated: If you do not accept this,

original: de las 'dus byas su yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de las 'dus byas su yang khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: then you should not accept that they are conditioned.

original: 'di dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these are mutually contradictory.

original: gang yang 'di ltar las rang bzhin gyis ma skyes la des na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig las ni 'di dag ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'di ltar las rang bzhin gyis ma skyes la des na rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig las ni 'di dag ste /
translated: And in this way, actions are not intrinsically produced, and because of that, they lack intrinsic existence.üîΩAnd because of that, they are not produced.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba yan lag lngas rab tu 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba zhes bya ba yan lag lngas rab tu 'jug pa ni /
translated: The five members beginning with consciousness and ending with feeling are the basis for the world‚Äôs conceit of ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pas bdag tu mngon par rlom pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas bdag tu mngon par rlom pa'i rgyu mtshan te /
translated: because they are the cause of the world‚Äôs conceit of ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de la bdag gi zhes 'dir 'dzin pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi zhes 'dir 'dzin pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúmine‚Äù is the grasping at that.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i ming can de yang rang bzhin med pa'i las kyis @315a * //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i ming can de yang rang bzhin med pa'i las kyis @315a * //
translated: And that which is called grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù is also essenceless, because it is produced by essenceless karma.

original: bskyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsal bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsal bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus one should understand clearly that it is essenceless.

original: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
translated: Or, you might think as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yan lag lnga po rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yan lag lnga po rang bzhin med de /
translated: The five members beginning with consciousness are essenceless.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes yin du chug na yang gang yang bdag tu 'dzin pa ngar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di yang rang bzhin med pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phyir ro zhes yin du chug na yang gang yang bdag tu 'dzin pa ngar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can 'di yang rang bzhin med pa'i las kyis bskyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if we grant that it is so, then this grasping at ‚ÄúI,‚Äù which has the character of grasping at self, would also have intrinsic reality, because it is produced by an action that lacks intrinsic reality.

original: 'di dag kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang med de /
translated: But these are also nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir na gang gi phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir na gang gi phyir //
translated: Why? Because

original: des bskyed 'dzin pa'ang rnam rtog las //
analyzed: des bskyed 'dzin pa'ang rnam rtog las //
translated: grasping produced by that also arises from conceptuality.

original: gang yang 'di bdag tu sgro btags pas bskyed pa'i ngar 'dzin pa de yang rang bzhin med pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pas bskyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba grub bo //
analyzed: gang yang 'di bdag tu sgro btags pas bskyed pa'i ngar 'dzin pa de yang rang bzhin med pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rnam par rtog pas bskyed pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba grub bo //
translated: Also, this grasping at ‚ÄúI,‚Äù which is produced by the superimposition of self, is also only without intrinsic reality, because it is produced by conceptuality, which has the character of incorrect mental activity.üîΩThis is established.

original: gdon mi za bar 'di ni 'di ltar khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'di ni 'di ltar khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: This must be accepted without doubt:

original: 'di lta ste las ni rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste las ni rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAction is without intrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: gal te las la rang bzhin yod //
analyzed: gal te las la rang bzhin yod //
translated: If karma had intrinsic reality,

original: de skyes ther zug bdag dngos 'gyur //
analyzed: de skyes ther zug bdag dngos 'gyur //
translated: then it would be permanent, and the self would be a real entity.

original: las kyang sdug bsngal rnam smin du //
analyzed: las kyang sdug bsngal rnam smin du //
translated: Also, karma would not be the cause of the ripening of suffering,

original: mi 'gyur de phyir bdag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'gyur de phyir bdag tu 'gyur //
translated: and therefore the self would be permanent.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po 'di'o zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yan lag lnga po zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i dngos po 'di'o zhes bya ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i yan lag lnga po zhes brjod do //
translated: This entity called ‚Äúself‚Äù is said to be the five branches, such as consciousness.

original: gal te las la rang bzhin yod na de mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te las la rang bzhin yod na de mi rtag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If karma had intrinsic reality, it would not be impermanent,

original: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i las kyis bskyed pa yang rgyu dang 'dra bar 'bras bu 'jug pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i las kyis bskyed pa yang rgyu dang 'dra bar 'bras bu 'jug pas /
translated: because intrinsic reality is immutable. Also, the effect of permanent karma would be similar to its cause.

original: rtag pa'i bdag gi dngos por 'gyur la rtag pa nyid du gyur na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag gi las kyis sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'i bdag gi dngos por 'gyur la rtag pa nyid du gyur na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag gi las kyis sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the self would be a permanent entity. If it were permanent, the suffering that arises from the ripening of karma would not occur.

original: las ni mi rtag pas rnam par smin par 'byung ste /
analyzed: las ni mi rtag pas rnam par smin par 'byung ste /
translated: Karma is impermanent, and the ripening of karma occurs.

original: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin par 'gyur la /
translated: Whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: rtag par gyur na las la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag par gyur na las la sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were permanent, then karma would not ripen as suffering.

original: gang mi rtag pa de yang bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de yang bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever is impermanent is also without self.

original: gang gi tshe yang las kyi 'bras bu dang las ther zug pa yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang las kyi 'bras bu dang las ther zug pa yin nam /
translated: Moreover, is the result of karma and karma permanent?

original: de'i phyir bdag tu 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu 'gyur la /
translated: If so, then it would be a self.

original: de las kyang chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes ston par mi @315b rigs so //
analyzed: de las kyang chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes ston par mi @315b rigs so //
translated: And it would not be right to teach that all phenomena are without self.

original: des na gdon mi za bar las rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar las rang bzhin med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, karma should be understood to be essenceless.

original: yang las rang bzhin med pa'i 'thad pa ci zhig tu rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang las rang bzhin med pa'i 'thad pa ci zhig tu rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the reasoning that karma is essenceless?üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / las ni rkyen skyes yod min zhing //
analyzed: gsungs pa / las ni rkyen skyes yod min zhing //
translated: Karma is not arisen from conditions.

original: rkyen min las skyes cung zad med //üîΩ'du byed rnams ni dri za yi//
analyzed: rkyen min las skyes cung zad med // 'du byed rnams ni dri za yi//
translated: There is not the slightest arisen from nonconditions.üîΩFormations are like a city of gandharvas,

original: grong khyer sgyu ma smig rgyur mtshungs //
analyzed: grong khyer sgyu ma smig rgyur mtshungs //
translated: like an illusion, like a mirage.

original: gal te las zhes bya ba cung zad yod na /
analyzed: gal te las zhes bya ba cung zad yod na /
translated: If there were the slightest thing called karma,

original: nges par de ni rkyen las skyes pa'ang rkyen med pa las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nges par de ni rkyen las skyes pa'ang rkyen med pa las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: If it definitely arises from conditions, it would arise from nonconditions.

original: re zhig gal te rkyen las skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te rkyen las skye bar 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that it arises from conditions,

original: nges par 'bras bu rkyen las yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nges par 'bras bu rkyen las yod par 'gyur la /
translated: then the effect would definitely exist in the conditions.

original: ma skyes pa rkyen la yod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa rkyen la yod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not possible for the nonarisen effect to exist in the conditions.

original: 'bras bu ma skyes na yang sa'i rgyu dang rkyen la de'i 'bras bu rkyen la med pa zhig rkyen las skye na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes na yang sa'i rgyu dang rkyen la de'i 'bras bu rkyen la med pa zhig rkyen las skye na /
translated: If the effect does not arise, then the effect of earth would not exist in the causes and conditions of earth.üîΩIf it arose from conditions, then it would also arise from nonconditions, but it does not.

original: de'i tshe rkyen ma yin pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur la de dag kyang med do zhes bya bas des na rkyen las skye ba'i las cung zad med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe rkyen ma yin pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur la de dag kyang med do zhes bya bas des na rkyen las skye ba'i las cung zad med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not arise from conditions.

original: rkyen med pa yang rgyu med pas 'bras bu cung zad kyang mi srid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen med pa yang rgyu med pas 'bras bu cung zad kyang mi srid do zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it does not arise from conditions, it does not arise from nonconditions either, because it is impossible for an effect to exist in the absence of a cause.

original: des na las med do //
analyzed: des na las med do //
translated: Therefore, karma does not exist.üîΩWhen karma does not exist, consciousness and so on do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe las med pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med par gyur pas nye bar len pa med pas nye bar len pa po yang med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe las med pa de'i tshe rnam par shes pa la sogs pa med par gyur pas nye bar len pa med pas nye bar len pa po yang med do zhes bya ste /
translated: Since appropriation does not exist, the appropriator also does not exist.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent and all phenomena are without self.

original: rang bzhin khas ma blangs na thams cad legs par gnas par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te de ngos rnams rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin khas ma blangs na thams cad legs par gnas par 'gyur ro // gal te de ngos rnams rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: If you do not accept intrinsic nature, everything is well.

original: zhes 'chad na /
analyzed: zhes 'chad na /
translated: But if you explain that the parts of a pot have no intrinsic nature,

original: 'o na de ltar gyur na dngos po thams cad med do zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na de ltar gyur na dngos po thams cad med do zhes bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then you would have to accept that all things are nonexistent.

original: smras pa / rang bzhin med pa'i don ni med pa'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / rang bzhin med pa'i don ni med pa'i don ma yin te /
translated: Objection: The meaning of ‚Äúno intrinsic nature‚Äù is not the meaning of ‚Äúnonexistent.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang 'khrul ba'i don te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khrul ba'i don te /
translated: Rather, it means ‚Äúdeceptive‚Äù

original: brdzun zhing slu ba'i chos can nyid kyi don to //
analyzed: brdzun zhing slu ba'i chos can nyid kyi don to //
translated: and ‚Äúhaving the nature of being false and deceptive.‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don 'di dag rang bzhin med pa'i don to zhes bya ba du mar bsgrubs pas mang pos zhig bya /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don 'di dag rang bzhin med pa'i don to zhes bya ba du mar bsgrubs pas mang pos zhig bya /
translated: We have established many times that the meaning of ‚Äúdependent arising‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúno intrinsic existence.‚Äù

original: don 'di yang dpes yongs su gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa /üîΩ'du byed rnams ni dri za yi //
analyzed: don 'di yang dpes yongs su gsal bar byed pa gsungs pa / 'du byed rnams ni dri za yi //
translated: This point is also clarified by the following analogy.üîΩFormations are like a city of gandharvas

original: grong khyer sgyu ma smig rgyur mtshungs //
analyzed: grong khyer sgyu ma smig rgyur mtshungs //
translated: and like a mirage.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di ltar yul dang dus su rnam par lta ba'i dbang po phyin ci log gi rkyen las skyes pa khang pa dang / @316a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di ltar yul dang dus su rnam par lta ba'i dbang po phyin ci log gi rkyen las skyes pa khang pa dang / @316a * //
translated: In this way, due to the condition of the sense faculties that see a place and time in a distorted way, a city is perceived as real due to a delusion that is beautified by houses,

original: skyed mos tshal dang / shing dang / ldum ra dang / khang bzangs dang / bag ma dang / phyugs lhas la sogs pas nye bar mdzes pa 'khrul pas grong khyer rang bzhin du dmigs la /
analyzed: skyed mos tshal dang / shing dang / ldum ra dang / khang bzangs dang / bag ma dang / phyugs lhas la sogs pas nye bar mdzes pa 'khrul pas grong khyer rang bzhin du dmigs la /
translated: parks, trees, gardens, mansions, brides, cattle pens, and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa byis pa'i skye bo grong khyer du mngon par rlom pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa byis pa'i skye bo grong khyer du mngon par rlom pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can no //
translated: The real city is a false and deceptive phenomenon that is the basis for the childish to conceive a city.

original: ji ltar yang sgyu ma'i rnam pa ston pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i sngags kyi sbyor bas /
analyzed: ji ltar yang sgyu ma'i rnam pa ston pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i sgyu ma'i mkhan po'i sngags kyi sbyor bas /
translated: Just as a magician who possesses the power to display illusory forms,

original: glang po dang / stag dang / ma he dang / skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i dngos po yang dag pa'i bud med la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bar gnas kyang byis pa rnams bud med la sogs pa'i mngon par rlom pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can la rmongs pa'i skye bos chags
analyzed: glang po dang / stag dang / ma he dang / skyes pa dang / bud med la sogs pa'i dngos po yang dag pa'i bud med la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral bar gnas kyang byis pa rnams bud med la sogs pa'i mngon par rlom pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can la rmongs pa'i skye bos chags
translated: They are attached to women and so on,

original: pa'o // ji ltar yul dang dus dang gnas skabs khyad par can gzhan thob pa'i nyi ma la brten pa'i tsha bas phyogs su shin tu phog pa las 'bab par mthong bas phyin ci log thob pas yang dag pa'i chu'i rnam pa can /
analyzed: pa'o // ji ltar yul dang dus dang gnas skabs khyad par can gzhan thob pa'i nyi ma la brten pa'i tsha bas phyogs su shin tu phog pa las 'bab par mthong bas phyin ci log thob pas yang dag pa'i chu'i rnam pa can /
translated: Just as in the case of a mirage, which is seen to be water in a particular place, time, and situation, due to the heat of the sun. The water that is seen is completely mistaken, and is devoid of the nature of real water.

original: chu'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yang smig rgyu nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa yang smig rgyu nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: The nature of water is empty, and yet a mirage is perceived.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams rang rang gi rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa la brten nas nye bar dmigs pa rnams rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid nye bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams rang rang gi rgyu rkyen gyi tshogs pa la brten nas nye bar dmigs pa rnams rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid nye bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: Likewise, things such as consciousness are perceived in dependence on the assembly of their own causes and conditions.

original: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to be devoid of intrinsic nature because they arise in dependence, like a city of gandharvas and so on.

original: 'dir kha cig brtsad ba /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig brtsad ba /
translated: Here someone might object:

original: dri za'i grong khyer ni rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i tshul gyis snang la /
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer ni rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i tshul gyis snang la /
translated: A city of gandharvas appears in the form of houses, parks, and so on, which are dependently arisen from grass, trees, and so on.

original: de na khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de na khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang med do zhes bya'o //
translated: But there is no dependently arisen house, park, and so on, there.

original: de'i phyir dpe 'di ni stong pa nyid bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe 'di ni stong pa nyid bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore this example cannot establish emptiness,

original: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa de la yod pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa de la yod pa'i phyir zhes bya'o //
translated: because it exists in the grass, trees, and so on.

original: de la ltos nas smras pa /
analyzed: de la ltos nas smras pa /
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: gang nye bar dmigs pa'i khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang nye bar dmigs pa'i khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The house, garden, etc. that are perceived do not arise in dependence.

original: khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rtsva dang shing la @316b sogs pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: khang pa dang skyed mos tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rtsva dang shing la @316b sogs pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur /
translated: And like the house, garden, etc., grass, trees, etc. would not arise in dependence.

original: de'i phyir khang pa la sogs pa yang nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir khang pa la sogs pa yang nye bar dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the house, etc. are perceived,

original: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa bzhin rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'thad do //
analyzed: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa bzhin rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar 'thad do //
translated: it is reasonable that they arise in dependence, like grass, trees, etc.

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha'i phyogs nyid du sprul pa stong ston par mdzad la /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha'i phyogs nyid du sprul pa stong ston par mdzad la /
translated: Moreover, when the Tathagata manifests a thousand emanations in the very direction of space,üîΩat that time how could grass, trees, etc. be conceived to exist?

original: de'i tshe rtsva dang shing la sogs pa yod par ga la rtog / de'i phyir gang nye bar dmigs pa de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid nye bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtsva dang shing la sogs pa yod par ga la rtog / de'i phyir gang nye bar dmigs pa de rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid nye bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, whatever is perceived is perceived as dependent origination.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po yang 'jig rten pas kha cig ni bden pa'i rang bzhin du rtog la /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po yang 'jig rten pas kha cig ni bden pa'i rang bzhin du rtog la /
translated: In this regard, some worldly people imagine that things that are dependently arisen have a nature that is real,

original: kha cig ni mi bden pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni mi bden pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: while others imagine that they have a nature that is unreal.

original: de la dri za'i grong khyer dang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang sprul pa dang chu zla dang mgal me'i 'khor lo dang gzugs brnyan dang snang brnyan la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi bden par mngon par 'dod pas /
analyzed: de la dri za'i grong khyer dang sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang sprul pa dang chu zla dang mgal me'i 'khor lo dang gzugs brnyan dang snang brnyan la sogs pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi bden par mngon par 'dod pas /
translated: In this regard, it is reasonable to say that since such things as a gandharva‚Äôs city, an illusion, a mirage, a magical creation, the reflection of the moon in water, a circle of firebrand, a reflection, and an echo are dependently arisen and are accepted as unreal,

original: bden par mngon par 'dod pa'i bden par mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'o zhes rigs so //
analyzed: bden par mngon par 'dod pa'i bden par mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'o zhes rigs so //
translated: the conception that they are real is reversed.

original: gang yang pha rol pos smos pa'i skyon sel bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: gang yang pha rol pos smos pa'i skyon sel bar 'dod pas /
translated: Now, in order to remove the error that the opponent mentioned,

original: ji ltar rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba glang po che la sogs pa'i tshul du snang la /
analyzed: ji ltar rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba glang po che la sogs pa'i tshul du snang la /
translated: it is like the nature of such things as grass and trees, which are devoid of the nature of an elephant, etc., but appear in the aspect of an elephant, etc.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i tshul du snang ngo zhes smra ba ni /üîΩglang po la sogs pa rtog pa dang bral ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i tshul du snang ngo zhes smra ba ni / glang po la sogs pa rtog pa dang bral ba la /
translated: Likewise, consciousness and so on are devoid of the nature of consciousness and so on, but appear in the manner of consciousness and so on.üîΩBut, like grass and trees, etc.,

original: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa ji lta bar yod pa ltar glang po che la sogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: rtsva dang shing la sogs pa ji lta bar yod pa ltar glang po che la sogs pa yang med do //
translated: an elephant and so on do not exist.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang de'i cha shas gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas de ni rtsva dang shing la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo la sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yang bsal bzhin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub bo zhes bya bar thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang de'i cha shas gang zhig rten cing 'brel par 'byung bas de ni rtsva dang shing la sogs pa bzhin du yod pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo la sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yang bsal bzhin pa'i phyir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin grub bo zhes bya bar thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, in consciousness and so on, that part which is dependently arisen exists like grass and trees, etc., and the nature imputed to the entity of consciousness, etc., which is dependently arisen, is removed. Therefore, it is established that the nature of entities is established.

original: des na rnam par rig par smra ba'i rjes su mthun pa brjod par 'di 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na rnam par rig par smra ba'i rjes su mthun pa brjod par 'di 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, this is stated in accordance with the Proponents of Cognition.

original: dbu mar smra ba'i rjes su mthun par brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbu mar smra ba'i rjes su mthun par brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not stated in accordance with the Proponents of the Middle.

original: yang na rmi lam mthong ba'i rjes su 'jug pas khas blang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rmi lam mthong ba'i rjes su 'jug pas khas blang bar mi bya ste /
translated: Or, one should not accept this because it follows the perception of a dream.

original: de'i tshe @317a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe @317a * //
translated: At that time,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs nyid rnam par rig par smra ba la ltos nas rjes su mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir yang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par sgrub pa la ltos nas nus pa med pa nyid du khong du chud par byas pa gzhan gyis smras pa'i skyon spangs so zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gtan tshigs nyid rnam par rig par smra ba la ltos nas rjes su mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir yang dngos po rnams rang bzhin med par sgrub pa la ltos nas nus pa med pa nyid du khong du chud par byas pa gzhan gyis smras pa'i skyon spangs so zhe na /
translated: since the reason of dependent arising itself is not inconsistent in relation to the Proponents of Cognition, and since it is contradictory, one should understand that it is ineffective in relation to the proof that things lack intrinsic existence.

original: de ltar bshad pa 'di mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa 'di mi rung ste /
translated: This explanation is not correct.

original: de ni 'di ltar smos pa'i rig pas dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar smos pa'i rig pas dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is like this: because of being dependently arisen, like a city of gandharvas and so on,

original: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i zhes gnas pas yang gdon mi za bar 'di dag khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rang bzhin med pa'i zhes gnas pas yang gdon mi za bar 'di dag khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is definitely necessary to accept the following:

original: 'du byed dri za'i grong khyer dang mtshungs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'du byed dri za'i grong khyer dang mtshungs zhes gsungs so //
translated: Compounded phenomena are like a city of gandharvas.

original: ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin dang bcas par gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin dang bcas par gyur na /
translated: Because if they had an essence,

original: 'di dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di dag rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: they would not be dependently arisen.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang yod pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang yod pas /
translated: But since they are dependently arisen,üîΩthey are empty.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: las ni nyon mongs rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: las ni nyon mongs rgyu mtshan can //
translated: Karma has the afflictions as its cause.

original: nyon mongs 'du byed las bdag las //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'du byed las bdag las //
translated: The afflictions arise from the mind.

original: lus ni las kyi rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: lus ni las kyi rgyu mtshan can //
translated: The body arises from karma.

original: gsum ka ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
analyzed: gsum ka ngo bo nyid kyis stong //
translated: All three are empty of essence.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed do zhes bya bas las ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mtshan te nyon mongs pa 'di rgyur byas pas /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed do zhes bya bas las ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu mtshan te nyon mongs pa 'di rgyur byas pas /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are the karmic formative forces‚Äù indicates that karma has the afflictions as its cause.

original: nyon mongs las bdag las ni 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs las bdag las ni 'du byed rnams te /
translated: The afflictions arise from the mind.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa las gang zhig rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid pas /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa las gang zhig rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid pas /
translated: Since they are the nature of karma and affliction,

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de rnams 'du byed kyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid de ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de rnams 'du byed kyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid de ma rig pa dang 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: those consciousnesses and so on are the nature of karmic action and affliction because they are generated by ignorance and formation.

original: de rnams kyang 'dir 'du byed yongs su rdzogs pa'i skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyis lus thob pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ste tha dad pa'i lus 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'dir 'du byed yongs su rdzogs pa'i skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyis lus thob pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ste tha dad pa'i lus 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They also become the reason for obtaining a body in the phase of the six sense bases that fully complete the formative factors.

original: lus de yang 'du byed bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can kho na'o zhes byas nas /
analyzed: lus de yang 'du byed bzhin du las dang nyon mongs pa'i rgyu can kho na'o zhes byas nas /
translated: That body also has only karma and affliction as its cause, just like the formative factors.

original: gcig gis kyang nye bar mtshon nas las kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gcig gis kyang nye bar mtshon nas las kyi rgyu mtshan can gyi lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is illustrated by one, it is called a body that is the sign of karmic action.

original: de las kyang de dag gi las dang de'i 'bras bu lus po ste /
analyzed: de las kyang de dag gi las dang de'i 'bras bu lus po ste /
translated: From that, their karma and the body that is the result of that

original: gsum po rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid la /
analyzed: gsum po rnams kyang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid la /
translated: all three are dependent origination.

original: des na dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du 'di dag gsum yang ngo bo nyid @317b kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: des na dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa bzhin du 'di dag gsum yang ngo bo nyid @317b kyis stong pa'o //
translated: Therefore, these three are empty of intrinsic reality, like the city of gandharvas and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: las yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: las yod pa nyid de /
translated: Karma exists.

original: de'i byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i byed pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its agent exists.

original: 'dir las kyi byed pa po nye bar bstan pa /
analyzed: 'dir las kyi byed pa po nye bar bstan pa /
translated: Here, the agent of karma is indicated:

original: ma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i gang zag 'di ni bsod nams kyi mngon par 'du byed pa mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nas byed pa po yod pa'i phyir las yod pa 'bras bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i gang zag 'di ni bsod nams kyi mngon par 'du byed pa mngon par 'du byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nas byed pa po yod pa'i phyir las yod pa 'bras bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThis person who is accompanied by ignorance creates meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable actions.‚Äù Since the agent exists, karma exists and its effect will also arise.

original: 'bras bu yod na gdon mi za bar de la longs spyod pa po yod la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod na gdon mi za bar de la longs spyod pa po yod la /
translated: If the effect exists, then the experiencer of that effect exists.

original: de'i phyir las dang byed pa po dang de'i 'bras bu dang de la longs spyod pa po rnams yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang byed pa po dang de'i 'bras bu dang de la longs spyod pa po rnams yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because karma, its agent, its effect, and its experiencer exist,

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin yod pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: the intrinsic reality of all things exists.

original: smras pa / gal te las yod na de'i tshe de'i byed pa po la sogs pa yod la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te las yod na de'i tshe de'i byed pa po la sogs pa yod la /
translated: Objection: If karma exists, then its agent and so on exist.üîΩBut when you establish that karma does not exist through the reasoning stated above,

original: gang gi tshe yang ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas las med par bsgrubs pas de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas las med par bsgrubs pas de'i tshe na /
translated: then at that time,

original: las med gyur na byed po med //üîΩde nyid med pas 'bras bu min //
analyzed: las med gyur na byed po med // de nyid med pas 'bras bu min //
translated: If karma does not exist, then an agent does not exist.üîΩSince that does not exist, there is no effect.

original: de med nye bar spyod pa med //
analyzed: de med nye bar spyod pa med //
translated: Since that does not exist, there is no experiencer.

original: des na dngos pos dben pa yin //
analyzed: des na dngos pos dben pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is devoid of entities.

original: gang gi tshe rkyen las skyes pas las cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba 'dis las med pa nyid du bsgrubs la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rkyen las skyes pas las cung zad kyang med do zhes bya ba 'dis las med pa nyid du bsgrubs la /
translated: When you establish that karma does not exist through the statement ‚ÄúSince it arises from conditions, karma does not exist in the least,‚ÄùüîΩthen at that time,

original: de'i tshe las med par gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe las med par gyur na /
translated: if karma does not exist,

original: su'i byed pa por yongs su rtog par byed /
analyzed: su'i byed pa por yongs su rtog par byed /
translated: then with respect to what do you conceive of an agent?

original: byed pa po dang las med na /
analyzed: byed pa po dang las med na /
translated: If an agent and karma do not exist,

original: rgyu med pa'i 'bras bu ga la zhig /'bras bu med na yang su'i longs spyod pa por yongs su rtog par byed ces bya bas /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i 'bras bu ga la zhig /'bras bu med na yang su'i longs spyod pa por yongs su rtog par byed ces bya bas /
translated: how could there be a causeless effect? If an effect does not exist, then with respect to what do you conceive of an experiencer?

original: des na las la sogs pa med pas rnam par dben pa ste thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba grub bo //
analyzed: des na las la sogs pa med pas rnam par dben pa ste thams cad stong ngo zhes bya ba grub bo //
translated: Therefore, since karma and so on do not exist, it is devoid of entities. It is established that everything is empty.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: slar yang de ltar 'bad pa chen po sa stong pa nyid du bsgrubs par gyur pas /
analyzed: slar yang de ltar 'bad pa chen po sa stong pa nyid du bsgrubs par gyur pas /
translated: ‚ÄúAgain, through great effort, you have established emptiness.üîΩWhat is the result for you?

original: khyod la 'bras bu ci zhig / ji srid du las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa na /
analyzed: khyod la 'bras bu ci zhig / ji srid du las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa na /
translated: As long as you deprecate karma and its effects,

original: log lta'i gang zag spyod pa bzang po yang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
analyzed: log lta'i gang zag spyod pa bzang po yang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu ster bar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
translated: the BhagavƒÅn has said that the person who has a wrong view will be given a result that is not desired.

original: shi nas kyang dmyal bar skye bar gsungs so //
analyzed: shi nas kyang dmyal bar skye bar gsungs so //
translated: And after death, he will be born in hell.‚Äù

original: des na 'dir shin tu 'bad pa chen pos don ma yin pa sgrub par byed pas zhog shig / smras pa /
analyzed: des na 'dir shin tu 'bad pa chen pos don ma yin pa sgrub par byed pas zhog shig / smras pa /
translated: Therefore, here, since you are accomplishing a great deal of non-purpose through great effort, stop!üîΩWe reply:

original: gang zhig las stong pa'i don ni las med pa'i de la ji skad smos pa'i nyes par 'gyur la /üîΩgang yang rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir @318a * //
analyzed: gang zhig las stong pa'i don ni las med pa'i de la ji skad smos pa'i nyes par 'gyur la / gang yang rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir @318a * //
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúempty of karma‚Äù is that karma does not exist, then the fault that you have stated would apply to us.

original: las stong pa'o zhes khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: las stong pa'o zhes khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: However, since it is understood that ‚Äúkarma is empty‚Äù because it is devoid of intrinsic nature,

original: las ni stong par yang dag par //
analyzed: las ni stong par yang dag par //
translated: if karma is understood to be empty,

original: shes na de nyid mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: shes na de nyid mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: then because that is seeing suchness,

original: las mi 'byung ste de med na //
analyzed: las mi 'byung ste de med na //
translated: karma does not arise.

original: las las 'byung gang mi 'byung ngo //üîΩgang zhig las rang bzhin med pa'o zhes khong du chud na //
analyzed: las las 'byung gang mi 'byung ngo // gang zhig las rang bzhin med pa'o zhes khong du chud na //
translated: What arises from karma does not arise.üîΩOne who understands that karma is essenceless

original: des ni las phyin ci ma log pa'i stong pa nyid du yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni las phyin ci ma log pa'i stong pa nyid du yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: will understand emptiness correctly.

original: las de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: las de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'di ni bden pa'o zhes mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: That karma is the condition of ignorance, and that it is the conception that this is true.

original: las rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa la 'bras bu mi 'dod do //
analyzed: las rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang bzhin med pa la 'bras bu mi 'dod do //
translated: Since karma is essenceless, one does not assert that an essenceless effect arises from it.üîΩTherefore, one does not come to have a nihilistic view by deprecating karma.

original: des na des skur pa btab nas log lta thob pa ma yin las kyang rang bzhin med par rtog pas 'di dag bden par mngon par zhen pa spong la /
analyzed: des na des skur pa btab nas log lta thob pa ma yin las kyang rang bzhin med par rtog pas 'di dag bden par mngon par zhen pa spong la /
translated: By understanding that karma is essenceless, one abandons the conception that these are truly existent.

original: las la ma chags pas slar yang las mi rtsom mo //
analyzed: las la ma chags pas slar yang las mi rtsom mo //
translated: Since one is not attached to karma, one does not create karma.

original: las ma brtsams par gyur na las kyi rgyu can 'bras bu log go //
analyzed: las ma brtsams par gyur na las kyi rgyu can 'bras bu log go //
translated: When one does not create karma, the effect of karma is stopped.

original: las kyi 'bras bu 'khor ba las log na nges par 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu 'khor ba las log na nges par 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: When the effect of karma, cyclic existence, is stopped, one definitely proceeds to nirvana.

original: de ltar de kho na nyid mthong bas las yang dag par shes pa ste rang bzhin gyis stong par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar de kho na nyid mthong bas las yang dag par shes pa ste rang bzhin gyis stong par rtog pa'o //
translated: Thus, by seeing reality, one understands karma, that is, one realizes that it is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: de kho na nyid mthong bas ma rig pa spong la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong bas ma rig pa spong la /
translated: By seeing reality, one abandons ignorance.

original: ma rig pa spangs na rgyu med pas las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa spangs na rgyu med pas las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If ignorance is abandoned, then since there is no cause, karma does not arise.

original: der las med na gang zhig las las 'byung ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de la mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: der las med na gang zhig las las 'byung ba rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de la mi 'byung ngo //
translated: If karma does not exist, then consciousness and so on, which arise from karma, do not arise.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang skye ba med par gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa grub bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa rnams kyang skye ba med par gyur na mya ngan las 'das pa grub bo zhes bya ste /
translated: If consciousness and so on do not arise, then nirvana is established.

original: rigs pa des skyes bu mngon par rlom pas gnas pa la ;
analyzed: rigs pa des skyes bu mngon par rlom pas gnas pa la ;
translated: By this reasoning, the person who is conceited about abiding

original: rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la mkhas pas /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa la mkhas pas /
translated: in the accomplishment of his own and others‚Äô goals

original: las rang bzhin med par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: las rang bzhin med par sgrub pa'i phyir ro // 'dir smras pa /
translated: proves that karma lacks intrinsic existence.

original: gal te ji ltar bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas las rang bzhin med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog de /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar bsgrubs pa'i rigs pas las rang bzhin med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog de /
translated: Here, someone might say, ‚ÄúBy the reasoning that proves that karma lacks intrinsic existence, you have refuted the arising of karma.

original: gang zhig 'di dag las las skyes pa'i sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs de yang mi 'thad la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di dag las las skyes pa'i sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten sna tshogs de yang mi 'thad la /
translated: And it is also untenable that the various worlds of sentient beings and their environments arise from karma.

original: gang yang las dang byed pa po nye bar bstan pa 'di yang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang las dang byed pa po nye bar bstan pa 'di yang thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the presentation of karma and agents is also not tenable.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pas /
translated: Because of the city of gandharvas and so on, which are essenceless.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa dang byed pa po yod @318b bzhin pa yang mi 'thad do zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu sgrub pa dang byed pa po yod @318b bzhin pa yang mi 'thad do zhes so //
translated: Thus it is not tenable that the various results are established and that the agent exists.

original: 'o na dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i don kyang rnam par shes pa rang gi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i dngos por bsgrub bzhin pas na /
analyzed: 'o na dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i don kyang rnam par shes pa rang gi dmigs pa la dmigs pa'i dngos por bsgrub bzhin pas na /
translated: Well, since the meaning of the city of gandharvas and so on is established as the object observed by consciousness,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams sgrub par byed pa por 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba rnams sgrub par byed pa por 'gyur te /
translated: it follows that mind and mental factors are the establishing agent.

original: rang rang gi rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skye bzhin pas byed pa po yod bzhin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi rgyu dang rkyen la brten nas skye bzhin pas byed pa po yod bzhin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they arise in dependence on their own causes and conditions, the agent exists.

original: smras pa / gal te yang rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa nyid du bsgrubs na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te yang rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa nyid du bsgrubs na /
translated: Objection: Even if you prove that consciousness is the object of perception,

original: de lta na yang 'khrul pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid du bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'khrul pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu nyid du bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
translated: in that case, you have not proven that error is the cause of error.

original: rnam par shes pa ma 'khrul bas de'i phyir mi bden pa bden pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba nyid la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ma 'khrul bas de'i phyir mi bden pa bden pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba nyid la /
translated: Since consciousness is non-erroneous, therefore, an unreal object cannot be the cause of a real consciousness.

original: mi bden pa yang mi bden pa'i ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi bden pa yang mi bden pa'i ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: And an unreal object cannot be the cause of an unreal consciousness.

original: de la rnam par shes pa yang mi bden pa nyid du 'dod la /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa yang mi bden pa nyid du 'dod la /
translated: In that regard, you assert that consciousness is unreal.

original: de lta na yang rang bzhin med pa yang rang bzhin med pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa po nyid du gsal bar byed pa shin tu gsal bar dper nye bar bstan pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang rang bzhin med pa yang rang bzhin med pa'i 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pa po nyid du gsal bar byed pa shin tu gsal bar dper nye bar bstan pas gsungs pa /
translated: Even so, the fact that something essenceless is the producer of an effect that is essenceless is clearly demonstrated by the following very clear example.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan de bzhin gshegs //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, the TathƒÅgata,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis ni sprul pa sprul //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis ni sprul pa sprul //
translated: through his magical power emanates an emanation.

original: sprul pa de yis slar yang ni //
analyzed: sprul pa de yis slar yang ni //
translated: That emanation in turn

original: sprul pa gzhan zhig sprul par 'gyur //
analyzed: sprul pa gzhan zhig sprul par 'gyur //
translated: emanates another emanation.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i sems can gyi bye brag 'ga' zhig ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i sems can gyi bye brag 'ga' zhig ni chos rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Some sentient beings who have completed the accumulations of merit and sublime wisdom realize the nature of phenomena just as it is.

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad gshegs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad gshegs pa /
translated: Or, because they go just as all the buddhas of the past went,

original: de ltar gshegs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar gshegs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: they are called ‚Äúthus-gone.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du sde pa gzhan gyi gzhung las /
analyzed: de bzhin du sde pa gzhan gyi gzhung las /
translated: Similarly, in the scriptures of other schools,

original: 'og min kho nar de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'og min kho nar de kho na nyid rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: it is said that the thus-gone one fully realizes the nature of reality in Akani·π£·π≠ha alone.

original: de yang gtso bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis sprul pa sprul nas 'dzam bu'i gling du mngon par byang chub pa ston par byed do //
analyzed: de yang gtso bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyis sprul pa sprul nas 'dzam bu'i gling du mngon par byang chub pa ston par byed do //
translated: Moreover, the principal one emanates emanations through his miraculous powers and displays the attainment of manifest enlightenment in Jambudvƒ´pa.

original: sprul pa'i mngon par byang chub de yang yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang mthu mnyam pas dgos pa'i dbang gis sprul pa gzhan ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: sprul pa'i mngon par byang chub de yang yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang mthu mnyam pas dgos pa'i dbang gis sprul pa gzhan ston par mdzad de /
translated: That manifest enlightenment of the emanation is equal in power to the true thus-gone one, and therefore he displays other emanations for the sake of a purpose.

original: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: ma skyes gnas pa med pa yi //
analyzed: ma skyes gnas pa med pa yi //
translated: It is unborn, and does not endure.

original: 'di ni chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs //
analyzed: 'di ni chos kyi dbyings dang mtshungs //
translated: It is the same as the ultimate realm.

original: mngal du 'jug pa ston pa yang //
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa ston pa yang //
translated: The teaching on entering the womb

original: 'di dag 'jig rten rjes 'jug phyir //üîΩ@319a * // zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag 'jig rten rjes 'jug phyir // @319a * // zhes gsungs so //
translated: is in accordance with the world.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yin du chug na yang /
translated: Even if it is granted that the perfect Buddha is the true TathƒÅgata in Jambudvƒ´pa,

original: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu mnga' bas /
analyzed: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthu mnga' bas /
translated: nevertheless, the TathƒÅgata has inconceivable power.

original: sprul pa sprul nus pa'i nus pa can nyid de /
analyzed: sprul pa sprul nus pa'i nus pa can nyid de /
translated: He is able to emanate emanations.

original: bsams bzhin du rnam pa de lta bu'i sprul pa sprul la /
analyzed: bsams bzhin du rnam pa de lta bu'i sprul pa sprul la /
translated: He emanates an emanation in the form of a buddha,

original: gang zhig sprul pa las sprul pa gzhan yang 'jug par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang zhig sprul pa las sprul pa gzhan yang 'jug par mdzad do //
translated: and that emanation emanates another emanation.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs stong sprul //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs stong sprul //
translated: The TathƒÅgata emanates a thousand emanations,

original: sprul pas sprul pa smos ci dgos //
analyzed: sprul pas sprul pa smos ci dgos //
translated: so what need is there to speak of one?

original: gnyis po ming tsam yod pa yang //
analyzed: gnyis po ming tsam yod pa yang //
translated: Even the two, name and form, exist only nominally.

original: gang ci rung ste rtog pa tsam //
analyzed: gang ci rung ste rtog pa tsam //
translated: Whatever there is, is mere imagination.

original: gang 'dir yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i sprul pa de nyid re zhig stong pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'dir yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa'i sprul pa de nyid re zhig stong pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'o //
translated: Here, the emanation of the TathƒÅgata is empty, that is, devoid of the nature of the TathƒÅgata.

original: ci 'on te gang sprul pa'i sprul pa the tshom med par 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ci 'on te gang sprul pa'i sprul pa the tshom med par 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba yin gyi /
translated: But how can one say that the emanation of an emanation is devoid of the nature of the TathƒÅgata?

original: sprul pa 'di yang rnam pa thams cad kyis med do zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: sprul pa 'di yang rnam pa thams cad kyis med do zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: One cannot say that this emanation is completely nonexistent,

original: de dag nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa /
translated: because it is perceived.

original: gnyis po'i ming tsam yod pa yang //
analyzed: gnyis po'i ming tsam yod pa yang //
translated: The existence of both is only nominal.

original: gang cung zad de rtog pa tsam zhes bya ba snying po dang bral ba ste rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang cung zad de rtog pa tsam zhes bya ba snying po dang bral ba ste rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Whatever is only imagination is devoid of essence, that is, devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: slar yang ji ltar de yod ce na /
analyzed: slar yang ji ltar de yod ce na /
translated: But how can it exist?

original: gsungs pa rtogs pa tsam zhes bya ba la yongs su brtags pa tsam yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa tsam brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsungs pa rtogs pa tsam zhes bya ba la yongs su brtags pa tsam yang dag pa ma yin par sgro btags pa tsam brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can tsam zhes bya ba'i don to //
