translated: The meaning of ‚Äúmere conceptualization‚Äù is ‚Äúmere imputation as not real,‚Äù ‚Äúmere false and deceptive phenomena.‚Äù

original: re zhig de dag gi rang bzhin med la /
analyzed: re zhig de dag gi rang bzhin med la /
translated: They are not even mere errors,

original: gal te yang 'khrul ba tsam du yang dmigs pa med do zhes bya bar gyur na de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnod par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'khrul ba tsam du yang dmigs pa med do zhes bya bar gyur na de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la gnod par yang 'gyur te /
translated: and if they are not even observed as mere errors, then conventional reality would be undermined.

original: ri bong gi rva bzhin nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva bzhin nye bar dmigs par yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: They would not be observed at all, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'bras bu gzhan sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur te /üîΩ'di thams cad kyang yod pas des phyir rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan sgrub par byed par mi 'gyur te / 'di thams cad kyang yod pas des phyir rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: They would not produce any other effects.üîΩBut all of this does exist, so we posit that they exist as mere conceptualization,

original: kun rdzob tsam du de dag yod do zhes rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam du de dag yod do zhes rnam par gzhag go //
translated: as mere conventionalities.

original: de yang gang rang bzhin med pa mthong ba de ni don dam pa mthong la ngo bo mi dmigs pas kyang de la mi bden pa las skyes pa la /
analyzed: de yang gang rang bzhin med pa mthong ba de ni don dam pa mthong la ngo bo mi dmigs pas kyang de la mi bden pa las skyes pa la /
translated: Moreover, those who see that things lack intrinsic existence see the ultimate truth. Since they do not observe any essence, they do not consider it to be arisen from falsity.

original: sred pa zad pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa zad pas rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And through the exhaustion of craving, one becomes liberated.

original: de ni 'di ltar brdzun par mthong ba @319b ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin mthong bas rnam par grol lo zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar brdzun par mthong ba @319b ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin mthong bas rnam par grol lo zhes gnas so //
translated: Thus, one is liberated by seeing the falsity of the afflictions.

original: ji ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa rang bzhin med pa las gzhan rang bzhin med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa can gyi sprul pa mtha' yas pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa rung ba rab tu 'jug pas /üîΩde bzhin byed po sprul par mtshungs //
analyzed: ji ltar yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa rang bzhin med pa las gzhan rang bzhin med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam pa can gyi sprul pa mtha' yas pas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bya ba sgrub pa rung ba rab tu 'jug pas / de bzhin byed po sprul par mtshungs //
translated: Just as the emanations of the TathƒÅgata, which are devoid of intrinsic reality, are suitable to engage in various activities through the infinite emanations of the TathƒÅgata, which are also devoid of intrinsic reality,üîΩThe agent is similar to an emanation.

original: las ni sprul pas sprul dang mtshungs //üîΩrang bzhin gyis stong gang cung zad //
analyzed: las ni sprul pas sprul dang mtshungs // rang bzhin gyis stong gang cung zad //
translated: The action is similar to the emanated object.üîΩWhatever exists is merely conceptual.

original: yod pa de dag rtog pa tsam //
analyzed: yod pa de dag rtog pa tsam //
translated: Whatever exists is merely conceptual.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa lta bu'i las kyi byed pa po ma rig pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ni /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa lta bu'i las kyi byed pa po ma rig pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag ni /
translated: Just as the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs emanation, the agent of action, is a person who follows ignorance,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa bzhin du rang bzhin med la 'di yang rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sprul pa bzhin du rang bzhin med la 'di yang rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: The TathƒÅgata is like a magical creation, and this is just a conceptual thought.

original: kun rdzob tsam brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can byis pa'i skye bo slu ba tsam rmongs pa'i skye bo chags pa tsam du yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tsam brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can byis pa'i skye bo slu ba tsam rmongs pa'i skye bo chags pa tsam du yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is just a conventional fiction, a false and deceptive phenomenon, which merely deceives childish beings, and which exists merely for the attachment of deluded beings.

original: gal te yang las de rang bzhin med pa'i byed pa pos bskyed la /
analyzed: gal te yang las de rang bzhin med pa'i byed pa pos bskyed la /
translated: Moreover, if that action is produced by an agent that lacks intrinsic nature,

original: de yang rang bzhin med pa nyid du yod pas /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin med pa nyid du yod pas /
translated: and that action exists as lacking intrinsic nature,

original: 'gro ba sna tshogs pa bskyed par nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba sna tshogs pa bskyed par nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is able to produce the various reincarnating beings.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is not reasonable,

original: dpe dang don dag mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe dang don dag mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the example and the meaning are not similar.

original: dpe ni yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod la /üîΩde'i phyir yang dag pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: dpe ni yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod la / de'i phyir yang dag pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: The example is that the real TathƒÅgata exists,üîΩand therefore it is reasonable that a real magical creation arises from a real one,

original: yang dag pa'i sprul pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rigs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sprul pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rigs so //
translated: or that an unreal magical creation arises from an unreal one.

original: 'dir yang dag pa'i dngos po med na gang zhig sprul nus pa'i byed pa po 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir yang dag pa'i dngos po med na gang zhig sprul nus pa'i byed pa po 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du rtogs par byed de /
translated: But if there is no real thing, what is the reason for positing the creator as the cause of the emanation?

original: de'i phyir dpe dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: Therefore, the example is not apt.

original: smras pa / gang 'dir yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes mngon par 'dod na /
analyzed: smras pa / gang 'dir yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes mngon par 'dod na /
translated: Objection: But if you assert that the real TathƒÅgata exists,

original: de byed pa por gyur pa'am las su gyur pa'i yang dag pa nyid du yongs su rtogs /
analyzed: de byed pa por gyur pa'am las su gyur pa'i yang dag pa nyid du yongs su rtogs /
translated: then you must think that he is the creator or the real thing.

original: gal te re zhig byed pa por gyur par yongs su rtogs na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig byed pa por gyur par yongs su rtogs na /
translated: If you think that he is the creator,

original: de yang / yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang / yang dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: then he is not the real TathƒÅgata.

original: byed pa po'i phyir sprul pa'i byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa bzhin /
analyzed: byed pa po'i phyir sprul pa'i byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa bzhin /
translated: Because he is the creator, like the creator of an emanation, he is an emanation of the TathƒÅgata.

original: yang na las su gyur pas yang dag par yongs su rtogs na /üîΩde lta na yang sprul pa ni sprul pas sprul pa bzhin 'di la @320a * //
analyzed: yang na las su gyur pas yang dag par yongs su rtogs na / de lta na yang sprul pa ni sprul pas sprul pa bzhin 'di la @320a * //
translated: If you think that he is the real thing,

original: yang dag par brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then it is not right to say that he is like an emanation, like an emanation of an emanation.

original: nges par de bzhin gshegs pa yang med dam ci zhe na /
analyzed: nges par de bzhin gshegs pa yang med dam ci zhe na /
translated: But is it not certain that the TathƒÅgata does not exist?

original: su zhig 'di skad du yod pa'am med do zhes smra /
analyzed: su zhig 'di skad du yod pa'am med do zhes smra /
translated: Who says that he exists or does not exist?

original: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin du rtogs na de ni de la yod pa'am med par yongs su rtogs par byed na /
analyzed: gang zhig de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin du rtogs na de ni de la yod pa'am med par yongs su rtogs par byed na /
translated: If someone imagines that the so-called TathƒÅgata exists essentially, then he would be imagining that he exists or does not exist.

original: gang yang rang bzhin med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa bzhin du rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: gang yang rang bzhin med pa ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa bzhin du rtog pa med pa /
translated: But he who is essenceless, like the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs magical creation, is not imagined.

original: sprul pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pas de la yod pa'am med par brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyis zhi ba ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pas de la yod pa'am med par brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Like a magical creation, he is essentially peaceful, not essentially arisen. Therefore, one should not imagine that he exists or does not exist.

original: de na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin grub pa med pas dpe dang mi 'dra bar rtog par ga la byed /
analyzed: de na de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin grub pa med pas dpe dang mi 'dra bar rtog par ga la byed /
translated: Since the TathƒÅgata does not exist essentially, how could he be imagined to be like an example?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgang 'di skad du smras pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin med pas /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gang 'di skad du smras pa'i stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin med pas /
translated: Here someone might say,üîΩ‚ÄúSince emptiness is essenceless,

original: gang cung zad yod pa rtog pa tsam zhes pas /
analyzed: gang cung zad yod pa rtog pa tsam zhes pas /
translated: as it is said, ‚ÄòWhatever is knowable is only a conceptualized object,‚Äô

original: slar yang ci'i phyir na 'di dag kyang rang bzhin med pa dang rtog pa tsam du yod pa gnyis khas len par byed /üîΩgal te slar yang rang bzhin yod pa nyid pas /
analyzed: slar yang ci'i phyir na 'di dag kyang rang bzhin med pa dang rtog pa tsam du yod pa gnyis khas len par byed / gal te slar yang rang bzhin yod pa nyid pas /
translated: Again, why do you accept that these are also devoid of intrinsic existence and exist as mere conceptual thoughts?

original: rtog pa tsam gyi dngos por khas mi len na /
analyzed: rtog pa tsam gyi dngos por khas mi len na /
translated: If you do not accept that things exist as mere conceptual thoughts because they intrinsically exist,

original: de'i tshe skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe skyon cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: what fault would there be?

original: smras pa / gal te rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
translated: If they intrinsically existed,

original: de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe mya ngan las 'das pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: then nirvana would not exist,

original: yod bzhin pa la byed pa po don med pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa la byed pa po don med pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and since it would be pointless for an existent to act, the agent would not exist.

original: gal te rtog pa tsam yang med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rtog pa tsam yang med par 'gyur na /
translated: If even mere conceptual thoughts did not exist,

original: de'i tshe las kyi 'bras bu med pas log ltar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe las kyi 'bras bu med pas log ltar 'gyur la /
translated: then since the effects of karma would not exist, you would have a nihilistic view.

original: des na rang bzhin khas blang bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin khas blang bar mi bya zhing /
translated: Therefore, you should not accept intrinsic existence,üîΩand you should not not accept conceptual thoughts.

original: rtog pa khas mi blang bar yang mi bya'o zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtog pa khas mi blang bar yang mi bya'o zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: To prove this, the treatise states:

original: las kyi rang bzhin yod ce na /
analyzed: las kyi rang bzhin yod ce na /
translated: If the nature of karma exists,

original: myang 'das byed po las kyang med //
analyzed: myang 'das byed po las kyang med //
translated: nirvana and the agent of karma would not exist.

original: gal te med na las bskyed pa'i //
analyzed: gal te med na las bskyed pa'i //
translated: If it does not exist, then the effect generated by karma

original: 'bras bu sdug dang mi sdug med //
analyzed: 'bras bu sdug dang mi sdug med //
translated: would not exist, whether pleasant or unpleasant.

original: gal te las kyi rang bzhin yod na /
analyzed: gal te las kyi rang bzhin yod na /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of karma exists,

original: de'i tshe de rang bzhin gyis yod bzhin pa'i phyir slar yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe de rang bzhin gyis yod bzhin pa'i phyir slar yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya'o //
translated: then at that time, because it exists due to its intrinsic reality, it would not transform again into something else.

original: gang 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa las dang nyon mongs pa zad pa las rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa las dang nyon mongs pa zad pa las rnam par gzhag la /
translated: In this way, nirvana is posited as the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: de mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / las de yang byed pa po la mi ltos par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / las de yang byed pa po la mi ltos par 'gyur la /
translated: But if that does not occur, then that karma would not depend on the agent.

original: de lta na rgyu med pa'i phyir @320b 'di ni yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na rgyu med pa'i phyir @320b 'di ni yod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And in that case, because it would be causeless, it would not exist.

original: re zhig las la rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
analyzed: re zhig las la rang bzhin yod par gyur na /
translated: If karma had intrinsic reality,

original: skyon 'di dag ste de'i phyir las la rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: skyon 'di dag ste de'i phyir las la rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: then these errors would ensue. Therefore karma has no intrinsic reality.

original: gal te gang ci yang rung ba rtog pa tsam du mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gang ci yang rung ba rtog pa tsam du mi 'gyur na /
translated: If anything were not mere imagination,

original: de'i tshe las kyis bskyed pa'i sdug pa'am mi sdug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe las kyis bskyed pa'i sdug pa'am mi sdug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: then the pleasant or unpleasant generated by karma would not exist.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gi las kyis sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag kyang yod pas /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dag gi las kyis sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag kyang yod pas /
translated: Because of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, there are pleasant and unpleasant results.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gang ci yang rung rtog pa tsam du yod do zhes gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gang ci yang rung rtog pa tsam du yod do zhes gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha taught that whatever exists is merely conceptual.

original: gang yang 'di las kyi rang bzhin ni med la gang cung zad rtog pa tsam yod pas /
analyzed: gang yang 'di las kyi rang bzhin ni med la gang cung zad rtog pa tsam yod pas /
translated: Moreover, the nature of karma does not exist, but whatever exists is merely conceptual.

original: de nyid kyis shin tu tha dad pa'i spyod pa'i 'dus byas skye bo'i rjes su 'brang ba'i bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis shin tu tha dad pa'i spyod pa'i 'dus byas skye bo'i rjes su 'brang ba'i bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas /
translated: Therefore, the BhagavƒÅn, the TathƒÅgata, who follows the conduct of the world, taught that

original: nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po'i dngos por 'jug pa phan tshun du 'gal bas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po'i dngos por 'jug pa phan tshun du 'gal bas /
translated: the antidotes to the afflictions are mutually contradictory.

original: brjod pa'i tshig kyang chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar gnas so //
analyzed: brjod pa'i tshig kyang chos nyid dang mi 'gal bar gnas so //
translated: The words of the Buddha do not contradict reality.

original: 'di ltar las yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig med do zhes bya ba'i tshig dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i tshig yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig dang 'gal ba dang / de bzhin du gnyi gar brjod pa yang gnyi ga dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar las yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig med do zhes bya ba'i tshig dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba'i tshig yod do zhes bya ba'i tshig dang 'gal ba dang / de bzhin du gnyi gar brjod pa yang gnyi ga dang 'gal lo //
translated: Likewise, the statement ‚Äúit both exists and does not exist‚Äù contradicts both.

original: tshig 'di dag thams cad kyang las stong pa nyid 'jug pa'i thabs kyi phyir /
analyzed: tshig 'di dag thams cad kyang las stong pa nyid 'jug pa'i thabs kyi phyir /
translated: All of these statements are made in order to introduce the emptiness of karma.

original: chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to prove that they are not in contradiction with reality, it is said:

original: yod ces pa yod med ces yod //
analyzed: yod ces pa yod med ces yod //
translated: It is said to exist, to not exist,üîΩTo both exist and not exist,

original: med dang yod ces de yang yod //
analyzed: med dang yod ces de yang yod //
translated: And to neither exist nor not exist.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dgongs pa yis //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dgongs pa yis //
translated: The intention of the buddhas

original: gsungs pa rtogs par sla ma yin //
analyzed: gsungs pa rtogs par sla ma yin //
translated: Is not easily understood.

original: de la gcig tu nges par gzung bar mi nus pas las ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'jig rten pas yang dag par mthong nas mngon par zhen pa'i yod pa yang gang ci yang rung ba rtag pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de la gcig tu nges par gzung bar mi nus pas las ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'jig rten pas yang dag par mthong nas mngon par zhen pa'i yod pa yang gang ci yang rung ba rtag pa tsam ste /
translated: Since it cannot be ascertained in any one way, the existence of karma that is seen by the world as real and is conceived of as real is simply the conception of existence.

original: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i rnam pa la med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa khong du chud pas log par lta bas /
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i rnam pa la med do zhes bya bar rtogs pa khong du chud pas log par lta bas /
translated: The understanding that the aspects of the gandharva city and so on do not exist is comprehended.

original: gang zhig dmyal ba chen por ltung ba la mngon par phyogs pas sdig pa chen po dang ldan par gyur pas /üîΩde dag med par lta ba las bzlog pa'i don du las yod do //
analyzed: gang zhig dmyal ba chen por ltung ba la mngon par phyogs pas sdig pa chen po dang ldan par gyur pas / de dag med par lta ba las bzlog pa'i don du las yod do //
translated: Those who are about to fall into the great hells, who have great evil,üîΩin order to turn them away from the view of nonexistence, the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúKarma exists.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa yod do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa yod do zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
translated: The ripening of karma exists.‚Äù

original: gang zhig de gang ci yang rung ba rtog pa tsam byis pa'i skye bos yongs su brtags pa'i dri za'i grong khyer la @321a * //
analyzed: gang zhig de gang ci yang rung ba rtog pa tsam byis pa'i skye bos yongs su brtags pa'i dri za'i grong khyer la @321a * //
translated: Whatever is merely imagined by childish beings, like a gandharva city and so on,

original: sogs par yod pa de thugs la bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sogs par yod pa de thugs la bzhag pa'o //
translated: that exists in the mind.

original: gang yang las dang 'bras bu la 'di dag bden no zhes mngon bar zhen la /
analyzed: gang yang las dang 'bras bu la 'di dag bden no zhes mngon bar zhen la /
translated: Those who cling to the view that karma and its effects are real

original: mngon bar zhen pa des de dag 'khor ba las mi grol bas /
analyzed: mngon bar zhen pa des de dag 'khor ba las mi grol bas /
translated: are not liberated from sa·πÉsƒÅra by that clinging.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa thugs la bzhag nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa thugs la bzhag nas gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, having placed in their minds the non-arising by nature, he said:

original: gang la las med cing las kyi rnam par smin pa med pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la las med cing las kyi rnam par smin pa med pa de ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And, ‚ÄúThat which is without action and without the ripening of action is the family of the noble ones.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga yang thugs la bzhag nas 'ga' zhig tu yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga'o zhes so //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang thugs la bzhag nas 'ga' zhig tu yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga'o zhes so //
translated: Having set both of these in his mind, he said, ‚ÄúIn some cases, both existence and nonexistence are.‚Äù

original: de ltar ji skad smos pa'i rigs pas bden pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa ma byas na /üîΩsangs rgyas rnams kyi dgongs pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad smos pa'i rigs pas bden pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa ma byas na / sangs rgyas rnams kyi dgongs pa yis //
translated: Thus, if one does not posit the two truths in the manner just explained,

original: gsungs pa rtogs par sla ma yin //
analyzed: gsungs pa rtogs par sla ma yin //
translated: it will not be easy to understandüîΩthe teachings of the buddhas, which are given in consideration of two truths.

original: 'dir tshig kha cig ni don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug la /
analyzed: 'dir tshig kha cig ni don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug la /
translated: Here, some words are to be taken literally,

original: 'ga' zhig dgongs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug go //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dgongs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug go //
translated: while others are to be taken figuratively.

original: re zhig gang don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa de ni nges pa'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: re zhig gang don gyi rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa de ni nges pa'i don te dgongs pa ma yin pas na /
translated: Those that are to be taken literally are of definitive meaning and are not intended to be taken otherwise.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i don yod bzhin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i don yod bzhin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since they have the meaning that they literally express,

original: 'di lta ste chos rnams rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos rnams rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: they are like the statements, ‚ÄúAll phenomena are without intrinsic existence,‚ÄùüîΩand ‚ÄúThere is no intrinsic existence.‚Äù

original: de yang ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pa dang lung gis dpyad pa na de bzhin kho nar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pa dang lung gis dpyad pa na de bzhin kho nar 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, when one analyzes with the reasonings and scriptures as mentioned, it will be just as it is, and not otherwise.

original: gang du dgongs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa de ni dri ba'i don te dgongs pa dang bcas pa'o //üîΩ'di lta ste gzugs yod do tshor ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag kyang don gyi khyad par cung zad tsam thugs la bzhag nas gsungs so zhes nges te /
analyzed: gang du dgongs pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas 'jug pa de ni dri ba'i don te dgongs pa dang bcas pa'o // 'di lta ste gzugs yod do tshor ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig 'di dag kyang don gyi khyad par cung zad tsam thugs la bzhag nas gsungs so zhes nges te /
translated: The meaning of the question is to engage in the pursuit of the intention, which is with intention.

original: ji skad du thos pa'i don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du thos pa'i don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, these words ‚Äúform exists,‚Äù ‚Äúfeeling exists,‚Äù and so on were spoken by the Buddha after he had placed a certain distinction in meaning in his mind, because they are not endowed with the meaning of what is heard.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //üîΩrgyu rkyen tshogs pa'am so so yi //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ni // rgyu rkyen tshogs pa'am so so yi //
translated: The nature of thingsüîΩis not in the assembly of causes and conditions,

original: dngos la rnams kun yong min pa'i //
analyzed: dngos la rnams kun yong min pa'i //
translated: nor is it in each one individually.

original: rang bzhin gang zhig des na stong //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang zhig des na stong //
translated: Since it is not in the entities, it is empty of that.

original: yod pa yod phyir mi skye la //
analyzed: yod pa yod phyir mi skye la //
translated: Because the existent does not arise,

original: med pa med phyir mi skye zhing //
analyzed: med pa med phyir mi skye zhing //
translated: the nonexistent does not arise,

original: chos mi mthun phyir yod med min //
analyzed: chos mi mthun phyir yod med min //
translated: and because they are dissimilar, it is not both existent and nonexistent.

original: skye ba med pas gnas 'gag med //
analyzed: skye ba med pas gnas 'gag med //
translated: Since there is no arising, there is no abiding and no ceasing.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa dang / dge slong dag 'di dag ni don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs pa dang / dge slong dag 'di dag ni don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, this is the one ultimate truth,

original: 'di ltar zhi ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi ba'i chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: namely, nirvana, which is the property of peace.

original: 'du byed thams @321b cad ni brdzun zhing slu ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: 'du byed thams @321b cad ni brdzun zhing slu ba'i chos can te /
translated: All compounded things are false and deceptive phenomena.

original: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa lta bu /
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba rdos pa lta bu /
translated: Form is like a mass of foam.üîΩFeeling is like a water bubble.

original: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis kyang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid du gnas par mi nus te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni chu'i chu bur lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i lung gis kyang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i yod pa nyid du gnas par mi nus te /
translated: ‚Äù and so on.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig gis ji ltar thos bzhin pa'i don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dgongs pa nyid du nges te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig gis ji ltar thos bzhin pa'i don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir dgongs pa nyid du nges te /
translated: Therefore, such statements are ascertained to be intentional, because they do not accord with the meaning as it is heard.

original: rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed pa'i tshig bzhin du 'di dag ni don dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed pa'i tshig bzhin du 'di dag ni don dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig ma yin no //
translated: They are not words that accord with the meaning, like the words that clarify the absence of intrinsic existence.

original: 'on kyang don gyi bdag nyid cung zad tsam thugs la bzhag nas gsungs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang don gyi bdag nyid cung zad tsam thugs la bzhag nas gsungs so zhes bya'o //
translated: But it is said that he taught them after placing a little of the nature of reality in his mind.

original: de ltar gnyis nyid du rnam par gnas pa 'di dag 'dir bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gnyis nyid du rnam par gnas pa 'di dag 'dir bsam par bya ste /
translated: Thus, these two extremes should be considered here.

original: ci yod pa nyid kyi tshig 'di dag sgra ji bzhin pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci yod pa nyid kyi tshig 'di dag sgra ji bzhin pa yin nam /
translated: Are these words about existence to be taken literally?

original: 'on te dgongs pa dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te dgongs pa dang bcas pa yin /
translated: Or are they intentional?

original: de la re zhig yod pa nyid kyi tshig 'di dag sgra ji bzhin pa yin na /
analyzed: de la re zhig yod pa nyid kyi tshig 'di dag sgra ji bzhin pa yin na /
translated: First, if these words about existence are to be taken literally,

original: de'i tshe shin tu don ma yin pa skye ba thob par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i tshe shin tu don ma yin pa skye ba thob par 'gyur la /
translated: then it would follow that a very meaningless arising would be obtained.

original: med pas mthong ba tsam las ther zug pa dang rgyun chad pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: med pas mthong ba tsam las ther zug pa dang rgyun chad pa'i mtha'o //
translated: And from merely seeing nonexistence, the extremes of eternalism and nihilism would follow.

original: yang na drang don ni de'i tshe ji skad smos pa'i don dang mi ldan pas 'di ni don dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na drang don ni de'i tshe ji skad smos pa'i don dang mi ldan pas 'di ni don dang rjes su mthun pa'i tshig ma yin no //
translated: Or, if the interpretable meaning is not endowed with the meaning as stated, then this is not a word that accords with the meaning.

original: de lta na yang don gyi bdag nyid cung zad tsam thugs la bzhag nas gsungs pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang don gyi bdag nyid cung zad tsam thugs la bzhag nas gsungs pas zhes bya ste /
translated: Still, it is said that he taught after placing a little of the nature of reality in his mind.

original: re zhig 'di tsam yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'di tsam yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: This much, at least, is determined.

original: gang yang don 'di ni bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dir legs par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang yang don 'di ni bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa la mi mkhas pa rnams kyis 'dir legs par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, this point is not well understood here by those who are not skilled in the presentation of the two truths.

original: des na ji skad smos pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi blo dang ldan pas mngon par sbyor bar byed par rung ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na ji skad smos pa'i bden pa gnyis kyi blo dang ldan pas mngon par sbyor bar byed par rung ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is suitable for those who possess the intelligence of the two truths as they have been presented to engage in this.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gal te yang las dang byed pa po bkag la /
analyzed: gal te yang las dang byed pa po bkag la /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though you have refuted action and agent,

original: de lta na yang re zhig las kyi 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa yod pas gzugs la sogs med do zhes kyang brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang re zhig las kyi 'bras bu gzugs la sogs pa yod pas gzugs la sogs med do zhes kyang brjod par mi nus so zhes bya ste /
translated: still, since the effects of action, such as form, exist, you cannot say that form and so on do not exist.

original: skye bo thams cad kyi mngon sum du rags pa dang nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'i gzugs yod pa nyid las su zhig med do zhes smra /
analyzed: skye bo thams cad kyi mngon sum du rags pa dang nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'i gzugs yod pa nyid las su zhig med do zhes smra /
translated: Since coarse form is observed and is directly perceived by everyone, who would say that it does not exist?

original: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: gang du bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang gsungs te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said,

original: dge slong dag gzugs ni phyi rol gyi skye mched de 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i @322a * //
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs ni phyi rol gyi skye mched de 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'i @322a * //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, form is an external base that is derived from the four great elements.

original: gzugs bstan du yod la /
analyzed: gzugs bstan du yod la /
translated: Form is demonstrable.üîΩ

original: thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Form is that which is demonstrable and impeded.

original: de bzhin du dge slong dag reg bya ni phyi rol gyi skye mched de 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs can bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dag reg bya ni phyi rol gyi skye mched de 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas pa'i gzugs can bstan du yod la thogs pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Bhik·π£us, tactile objects are the external base, which is form derived from the four great elements and is impeded and demonstrable.

original: gal te de med na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas so zhes 'byung ba'i rgyu can du ston par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de med na 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas so zhes 'byung ba'i rgyu can du ston par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it did not exist, it would not be taught that the four great elements are its cause.

original: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i nam mkha'i me tog la 'byung ba rgyur byas pa nye bar ma bstan la /
analyzed: yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i nam mkha'i me tog la 'byung ba rgyur byas pa nye bar ma bstan la /
translated: The fact that the four great elements are its cause is not taught in regard to the sky flower, which does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa dang / lung las grags pa'i phyir gzugs yod do gzugs yod par gyur na de la 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa dang / lung las grags pa'i phyir gzugs yod do gzugs yod par gyur na de la 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, form exists because it is known in the world and in the scriptures. If form exists, then a sense consciousness apprehending it will arise.

original: de yod na yang de bzhin kho nar dngos po thams cad grub po zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na yang de bzhin kho nar dngos po thams cad grub po zhe na /
translated: If that exists, then all things are established in just the same way.

original: smras pa / gal te gzugs nyid yod na gzugs la brten nas dngos po thams cad 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te gzugs nyid yod na gzugs la brten nas dngos po thams cad 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: Objection: If form itself existed, then all things would be established in dependence on form.

original: yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: ji ltar med pa yang de ltar sngar nyid du rgyas par bsgrubs la /
analyzed: ji ltar med pa yang de ltar sngar nyid du rgyas par bsgrubs la /
translated: And how it does not exist was already extensively proven earlier.

original: gzhan yang gal te med pas gzugs med par grub kyang /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te med pas gzugs med par grub kyang /
translated: Moreover, if nonexistence establishes the nonexistence of form,

original: de lta na yang shin tu rags pa dang nye ba 'di dag mngon sum du dmigs pa bzhin du chags pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang shin tu rags pa dang nye ba 'di dag mngon sum du dmigs pa bzhin du chags pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: then even though that is so, since these very coarse and near objects are the objects of attachment, they are observed directly.

original: des na de sel ba'i sgo nas skye mched thams cad dgag pa'i don du slar yang brtag pa tsam pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na de sel ba'i sgo nas skye mched thams cad dgag pa'i don du slar yang brtag pa tsam pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute them and to refute all sense bases, again the following is stated as a mere examination.

original: gal te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gzugs //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gzugs //
translated: If form is the nature of the elements,

original: 'byung las gzugs ni 'byung ba min //
analyzed: 'byung las gzugs ni 'byung ba min //
translated: form does not arise from the elements.

original: rang las 'byung min gzhan las kyang //
analyzed: rang las 'byung min gzhan las kyang //
translated: It does not arise from itself, nor does it arise from another,

original: 'byung min de phyir med min nam //
analyzed: 'byung min de phyir med min nam //
translated: nor does it arise from both. Therefore it is not nonexistent.

original: gal te 'di snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think this,

original: gang las 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas gzugs nye bar bstan pas /üîΩde'i phyir gzugs yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gang las 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas gzugs nye bar bstan pas / de'i phyir gzugs yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that form exists because it is taught in dependence on the four great elements,üîΩthen why did the Blessed One teach that form is essenceless?

original: smras pa / de nyid kyis na gzugs rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsal bar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: smras pa / de nyid kyis na gzugs rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsal bar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: We say: Didn‚Äôt the Blessed One clearly teach that form is essenceless?

original: ji ltar byas na gang las 'jig rten 'dir rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'jug bzhin pa nye bar dmigs te /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na gang las 'jig rten 'dir rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu 'jug bzhin pa nye bar dmigs te /
translated: How is it that in this world an effect that resembles its cause is observed?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:üîΩRice arises from rice, barley arises from barley, a cow arises from a cow, and a goat arises from a goat.

original: s'a lu las s'a lu dang / gro las gro dang / ba lang las ba lang dang / ba men las ba men no zhes de bzhin du gzugs kyang @322b 'byung ba las kyang gyur pas na 'byung ba'i rang bzhin kho nar 'jug par 'gyur la rag na /
analyzed: s'a lu las s'a lu dang / gro las gro dang / ba lang las ba lang dang / ba men las ba men no zhes de bzhin du gzugs kyang @322b 'byung ba las kyang gyur pas na 'byung ba'i rang bzhin kho nar 'jug par 'gyur la rag na /
translated: In the same way, since form arises from the elements, it follows that it is the essence of the elements.

original: gzugs kyang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyang 'byung ba'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: But form is not the essence of the elements.

original: srab la sogs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i phyir dang / 'byung ba rnams lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bya'i phyir dang / gzugs ni mig gi dbang po'i gzung bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srab la sogs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo'i phyir dang / 'byung ba rnams lus kyi dbang po'i gzung bya'i phyir dang / gzugs ni mig gi dbang po'i gzung bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not of the nature of the subtle elements, etc., because the elements are the objects of the body faculty, and because form is the object of the eye faculty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'byung ba rgyur byas nas gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'byung ba rgyur byas nas gzugs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said that form arises from the elements as its cause,

original: gzugs la rigs pa dang 'gal bar gsungs pa'o zhes mtshon pas 'jig rten pa rnams kyis de mi bden par khong du chud par bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: gzugs la rigs pa dang 'gal bar gsungs pa'o zhes mtshon pas 'jig rten pa rnams kyis de mi bden par khong du chud par bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: but that statement is said to be contradictory to reason. The statement is made to indicate that worldly people should understand that is not true.

original: de'i phyir lung ni gzugs yod pa nyid kyi sgrub byed ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir lung ni gzugs yod pa nyid kyi sgrub byed ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, scripture is not a proof of the existence of form,

original: 'on kyang gzugs med pa'i sgrub byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzugs med pa'i sgrub byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: but rather it is a proof of the nonexistence of form.

original: gal te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gzugs //
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gzugs //
translated: If form were the nature of the elements,

original: 'byung las gzugs ni 'byung ba min //
analyzed: 'byung las gzugs ni 'byung ba min //
translated: form would not arise from the elements.

original: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin zhes pa 'di ni rgyu la rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin zhes pa 'di ni rgyu la rang bzhin du'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe nature of the elements‚Äù refers to the elements as the cause.

original: kha zas kyi rang bzhin srog la /
analyzed: kha zas kyi rang bzhin srog la /
translated: The nature of food is life.

original: rtsva'i rang bzhin ba lang zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva'i rang bzhin ba lang zhes pa'o //
translated: The nature of grass is cow.

original: ji ltar gal te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gal te 'byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: If it is the nature of the elements,

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu can gyi gzugs su skyes pa de ni 'byung ba las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu can gyi gzugs su skyes pa de ni 'byung ba las mi 'byung ste /
translated: and form is born from the cause of the elements, it does not arise from the elements.

original: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since it does not exist by the nature of the elements,

original: de ltar gyur na rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skye ba mi srid pas de ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ste go sla'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na rgyu dang mi 'dra ba'i 'bras bu skye ba mi srid pas de ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ste go sla'o //
translated: if that were so, it is impossible for a result to arise that is unlike its cause. Therefore, it is not the case that it is not the nature of form. This is easy to understand.

original: gal te de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rang bzhin las ma yin yang /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu dag mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir gzugs kyi rang bzhin las ma yin yang /
translated: If cause and effect are different in nature, although form is not from the nature of form,

original: de lta na yang gzhan dngos las 'byung ngo zhe na ;
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan dngos las 'byung ngo zhe na ;
translated: in that case, it arises from another entity.

original: smras pa / gal te gzugs ni rang dngos las 'byung min //
analyzed: smras pa / gal te gzugs ni rang dngos las 'byung min //
translated: If form does not arise from its own nature,

original: zhes gnas la /
analyzed: zhes gnas la /
translated: as stated,

original: de'i tshe de med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe de med pa ste /
translated: at that time, it does not exist.

original: rang gi dngos las gzhan las ma yin no zhes gsal bar nges so //
analyzed: rang gi dngos las gzhan las ma yin no zhes gsal bar nges so //
translated: It is clearly ascertained that it does not arise from another entity.

original: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gzhan la ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gzhan la ltos nas gzhan nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: Intrinsic nature is not other in dependence on another.

original: rang bzhin de yang med pas rang bzhin gzhan las kyang skyes pa med do /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang med pas rang bzhin gzhan las kyang skyes pa med do /
translated: Since that intrinsic nature does not exist, it is not generated from another intrinsic nature.

original: // / gzhan yang gal te 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas gzugs kyi skye mched 'byung ngo zhes pa de ltar gyur na gzugs kyi skye mched gcig pu la rnam pa bzhir thob par 'gyur te /üîΩgcig la phan tshun mtshan nyid tha @323a * //
analyzed: // / gzhan yang gal te 'byung ba chen po bzhi la brten nas gzugs kyi skye mched 'byung ngo zhes pa de ltar gyur na gzugs kyi skye mched gcig pu la rnam pa bzhir thob par 'gyur te / gcig la phan tshun mtshan nyid tha @323a * //
translated: Moreover, if the sense base of form arises in dependence on the four great elements, then the sense base of form would obtain four aspects.

original: dang pa'i bdag nyid bzhi brten par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: dang pa'i bdag nyid bzhi brten par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that four mutually different characteristics exist in one.

original: de'i phyir gzugs ni rnam pa bzhir khas blang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs ni rnam pa bzhir khas blang bar bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, form should be asserted to have four aspects.

original: gal te skye mched gcig gi rten gyi dngos por rtog na yang 'byung ba rnams gcig nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te skye mched gcig gi rten gyi dngos por rtog na yang 'byung ba rnams gcig nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Or, if you imagine that the four great elements are the basis of one sense base, then you should assert that the elements are one.

original: 'di dag kyang de ltar med do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang de ltar med do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to prove that they do not exist in that way, it is said:

original: gcig la bzhi ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: gcig la bzhi ni yod ma yin //
translated: Four do not exist in one.

original: bzhi gang gcig tu ma yin pas //üîΩgzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi //
analyzed: bzhi gang gcig tu ma yin pas // gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi //
translated: Since they are not one,üîΩHow can form exist

original: rgyur byas nas grub ji ltar yod //
analyzed: rgyur byas nas grub ji ltar yod //
translated: As the substantial cause of the four great elements?

original: gal te 'byung ba chen po bzhi yod bzhin pa la gzugs brten par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'byung ba chen po bzhi yod bzhin pa la gzugs brten par gyur na /
translated: If form were to depend on the four great elements that exist,

original: de'i tshe gzugs gcig kyang bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzugs gcig kyang bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time, even one form would become four,

original: brten pa ni rten gyi dbye ba'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brten pa ni rten gyi dbye ba'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is dependent is related to the classification of the support.

original: de ltar yod pa yang ma yin pas gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas nas grub par ci ltar yod /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa yang ma yin pas gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas nas grub par ci ltar yod /
translated: Since that does not exist, how can form exist as the substantial cause of the four great elements?

original: yang na rten tha dad kyi rjes su mthun pa brten pa'i gzugs ma yin na /
analyzed: yang na rten tha dad kyi rjes su mthun pa brten pa'i gzugs ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if form that is dependent is not related to the classification of the support,üîΩthen the supports should be related to the classification of the one that is supported.

original: de ltar na rten du gyur pa rnams brten pa gcig gi rjes su 'jug par byos shig / de dag kyang mi srid la /
analyzed: de ltar na rten du gyur pa rnams brten pa gcig gi rjes su 'jug par byos shig / de dag kyang mi srid la /
translated: That is not possible,

original: de'i phyir gar gyi skyes bu bzhin du phan tshun mi bden pa rnams nges par 'di dag gi yod pa nyid nyams so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gar gyi skyes bu bzhin du phan tshun mi bden pa rnams nges par 'di dag gi yod pa nyid nyams so zhes bya ste /
translated: and therefore, like the person in a painting, they are definitely not real. Thus their existence is undermined.

original: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas nas grub pa ji ltar yod /
analyzed: gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rgyur byas nas grub pa ji ltar yod /
translated: How does form exist as the establishment of the four great elements as its cause?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgzugs ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gzugs ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'dzin bzhin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dzin bzhin pa'i phyir /
translated: Form does exist because it is apprehended.

original: 'dir mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i sngon po'i rnam par skyes pas 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'dir mig gi rnam par shes pa de'i sngon po'i rnam par skyes pas 'dzin la /
translated: Here, since the eye consciousness arises in the aspect of blue, it apprehends blue.

original: de la gal te sngon po med na de'i 'dzin pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: de la gal te sngon po med na de'i 'dzin pa mi 'byung la /
translated: If blue does not exist, its apprehension would not occur.

original: 'dzin pa yang yod pas de'i phyir gzugs yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang yod pas de'i phyir gzugs yod do zhe na /
translated: Since its apprehension exists, form exists.

original: smras pa / gal te de'i 'dzin pa yod na gzugs yod la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te de'i 'dzin pa yod na gzugs yod la /
translated: If its apprehension exists, form exists.

original: 'di la 'dzin pa mi srid do /
analyzed: 'di la 'dzin pa mi srid do /
translated: But its apprehension is impossible.

original: de'i phyir shin tu yang 'dzin pa med pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu yang 'dzin pa med pas /
translated: Therefore, since its apprehension is utterly impossible,

original: gzugs ni ji ltar zhes pa 'dir 'brel to //
analyzed: gzugs ni ji ltar zhes pa 'dir 'brel to //
translated: how could form exist?

original: 'di dag gi shin tu mi 'dzin pa yang rgyas par bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi shin tu mi 'dzin pa yang rgyas par bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: We will extensively prove that its apprehension is utterly impossible.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gzugs la 'dzin pa ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la 'dzin pa ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: The apprehension of form exists.

original: rtags ci las she na /
analyzed: rtags ci las she na /
translated: What is the reason?

original: gal te gzugs 'dzin par mi 'gyur na 'di ni gzugs so zhes pa'i blo mi 'byung la /
analyzed: gal te gzugs 'dzin par mi 'gyur na 'di ni gzugs so zhes pa'i blo mi 'byung la /
translated: If it did not apprehend form, the thought ‚ÄúThis is form‚Äù would not occur.

original: 'di'i blo yang yod pas shes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i blo yang yod pas shes bya ste /
translated: But since the thought ‚ÄúThis is form‚Äù does occur, form is an object of knowledge.

original: rtags des na 'dzin pa yod do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtags des na 'dzin pa yod do zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of form exists.

original: smras pa / @323b rtags las she na de'i rtags kyang med de /
analyzed: smras pa / @323b rtags las she na de'i rtags kyang med de /
translated: Objection: How can you say that it exists on the basis of a reason when that reason does not exist?

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir med pa nyid do //
translated: Because it arises from causes and conditions, it does not exist.

original: gzhan yang gzugs yod na gzugs kyi blo 'thad kyi med pa la ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzugs yod na gzugs kyi blo 'thad kyi med pa la ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if form exists, the thought of form is tenable, but not if it does not exist.

original: gang gi tshe 'di dag de lta na de'i tshe yod pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs kyis blo skyed par byed na gzugs yod par rung na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di dag de lta na de'i tshe yod pa'i gzugs kyi gzugs kyis blo skyed par byed na gzugs yod par rung na /
translated: When form does not exist in that way, then if the thought of form generates form, it is suitable that form exists.

original: gzugs kyi blo med na ji ltar gzugs yod pa'i rtags su 'gyur zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo med na ji ltar gzugs yod pa'i rtags su 'gyur zhes gsungs pa /
translated: But if the thought of form does not exist, how can form exist as a reason?

original: yod na yang rtags de med na mi 'thad pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yod na yang rtags de med na mi 'thad pas zhes bya ste /
translated: If it does exist, it is not tenable to say that it exists on the basis of a reason that does not exist.

original: de nyid shin tu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid shin tu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not apprehended at all.

original: rtags las she na /
analyzed: rtags las she na /
translated: How can you say that it exists on the basis of a reason?

original: rtags de yang med de /
analyzed: rtags de yang med de /
translated: That reason does not exist.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises from causes and conditions.

original: yod na'ang rtags de med mi rigs //
analyzed: yod na'ang rtags de med mi rigs //
translated: If it exists, it is illogical for the sign not to exist.

original: zhes pa 'dis /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis /
translated: This verse

original: pha rol gyi rtags las gzugs yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa de sel to //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: pha rol gyi rtags las gzugs yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa de sel to // 'dir smras pa /
translated: refutes the assertion that form exists because of the existence of the sign.

original: gang 'di skad du shin tu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang 'di skad du shin tu mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes smos pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: Here, someone might say, ‚ÄúThe statement ‚Äòbecause it is not apprehended at all‚Äô is illogical,

original: gzugs 'dzin bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin bzhin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o // 'dir smras pa /
translated: because form is being apprehended.‚Äù

original: slar yang cis gzugs 'dzin na blos so //
analyzed: slar yang cis gzugs 'dzin na blos so //
translated: Here, someone might say, ‚ÄúWhat is it that apprehends form? It is the mind.‚Äù

original: smras pa / blos gzugs la ji ltar 'dzin /
analyzed: smras pa / blos gzugs la ji ltar 'dzin /
translated: We reply, ‚ÄúHow does the mind apprehend form?‚Äù

original: de'i rnam par skye bas so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par skye bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt arises in its aspect.‚Äù

original: smras pa / 'di dag mi 'thad de rgyu mtshan cis she na /üîΩgang gi phyir /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di dag mi 'thad de rgyu mtshan cis she na / gang gi phyir /
translated: We reply, ‚ÄúThese are not tenable. What is the reason?

original: gal te blo des gzugs 'dzin na //
analyzed: gal te blo des gzugs 'dzin na //
translated: Because if that mind apprehends form,

original: rang gi rang bzhin la 'dzin 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin la 'dzin 'gyur //
translated: it would apprehend its own nature.

original: rkyen las skyes pas yod min la //
analyzed: rkyen las skyes pas yod min la //
translated: Since it arises from conditions, it does not exist.

original: yang dag gzugs med ji ltar 'dzin //
analyzed: yang dag gzugs med ji ltar 'dzin //
translated: How could it apprehend real form?‚Äù

original: 'dir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'dzin na sngon du rang gi bdag nyid mthong ste /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin 'dzin na sngon du rang gi bdag nyid mthong ste /
translated: If the nature of things were to apprehend itself, then it would be seen first of all in its own nature.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩme'i dro ba nyid lta bu de dang ldan pa las pha rol gyi bdag nyid kyang nye bar dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / me'i dro ba nyid lta bu de dang ldan pa las pha rol gyi bdag nyid kyang nye bar dmigs par byed do //
translated: For example,

original: chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu lta bu'o //
translated: the heat of fire is seen in the burning of its own nature, and it is also perceived in the nature of other things, such as water.

original: de ltar gal te blo ni 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar gal te blo ni 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur na /
translated: But if the mind were to have the nature of apprehending itself,

original: de ni 'dzin pa'i rang gi bdag nyid kho na la re zhig nye bar dmigs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ni 'dzin pa'i rang gi bdag nyid kho na la re zhig nye bar dmigs par 'gyur la /
translated: then it would be perceived first of all in its own nature,

original: dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: but it is not perceived.

original: bdag nyid la 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / las dang byed pa po dag gcig nyid du thal ba dang / dmigs pa med par dmigs pa po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir dang / las dang byed pa po dag gcig nyid du thal ba dang / dmigs pa med par dmigs pa po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is contradictory for it to engage itself, because it would follow that the object and agent would be identical, and because it is untenable that the apprehender exists without an object.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar blo rang gi bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar blo rang gi bdag nyid la 'dzin par mi nus pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the mind is unable to apprehend its own nature,

original: 'dir gzugs ji ltar 'dzin @324a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzugs ji ltar 'dzin @324a * //
translated: then how can it apprehend form?

original: par byed / rigs pas ni rang gi bdag nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs kyang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: par byed / rigs pas ni rang gi bdag nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs kyang mi 'dzin te /
translated: And by reasoning, it does not apprehend form, because it does not apprehend itself.

original: bong ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bong ba la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya'o //
translated: It is like a clod, etc.

original: gzhan yang 'di'i blo ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di'i blo ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, its cognition does not exist inherently, because it is dependently arisen.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa'i gzugs ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir yang rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa'i gzugs ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: And because it is dependently arisen, how could it apprehend form that does not exist essentially?

original: des na gzugs 'dzin pa med do /
analyzed: des na gzugs 'dzin pa med do /
translated: Therefore, it does not apprehend form.

original: // /'di ltar yang 'dzin pa med de /
analyzed: // /'di ltar yang 'dzin pa med de /
translated: In the same way, it does not apprehend.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: ji skad smos pa gzugs skyes blos //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa gzugs skyes blos //
translated: The cognition that arises from the stated form

original: skad cig skad cig gis mi 'dzin /üîΩ'das dang ma 'ongs pa gzugs kyang //
analyzed: skad cig skad cig gis mi 'dzin / 'das dang ma 'ongs pa gzugs kyang //
translated: Does not apprehend it moment by moment.üîΩHow could it know the past and future

original: de yis ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur //üîΩji skad smos pa'i gzugs zhes pa la /
analyzed: de yis ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur // ji skad smos pa'i gzugs zhes pa la /
translated: Forms that it has not previously apprehended?üîΩThe cognition that arises from the stated form

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i gzugs la smos pa zhes brjod /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i gzugs la smos pa zhes brjod /
translated: The stated form is called the object of statement.

original: 'dir mig gi yul ni ji skad smos pa'i gzugs su shes par bya la /
analyzed: 'dir mig gi yul ni ji skad smos pa'i gzugs su shes par bya la /
translated: Here, the object of the eye is to be known as the stated form.

original: blo yang mig gi blos 'dzin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: blo yang mig gi blos 'dzin gyi gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The cognition is the visual cognition, not any other.

original: skyes pa'i sgra ni 'dir da ltar ba'i rjod du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i sgra ni 'dir da ltar ba'i rjod du shes par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúarisen‚Äù should be understood to refer to the present.

original: 'dir gal te blo yis gzugs la 'dzin par byed na /üîΩdes da ltar ba'i gzugs la 'dzin nam /
analyzed: 'dir gal te blo yis gzugs la 'dzin par byed na / des da ltar ba'i gzugs la 'dzin nam /
translated: Here, if cognition apprehends form,üîΩdoes it apprehend present form,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la'o //
translated: or does it apprehend past and future form?

original: de la re zhig ji skad smos pa'i rnam pas ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig ji skad smos pa'i rnam pas ni /
translated: First, in the manner described,

original: da ltar ba'i gzugs da ltar ba'i blos mi 'dzin te /üîΩgnyi ga yang skad cig ma'i phyir skyes ma thag tu rnam par 'jig pa'i blo ni de la skad cig tsam yang gnas pa med na /
analyzed: da ltar ba'i gzugs da ltar ba'i blos mi 'dzin te / gnyi ga yang skad cig ma'i phyir skyes ma thag tu rnam par 'jig pa'i blo ni de la skad cig tsam yang gnas pa med na /
translated: the present cognition does not apprehend present form,

original: gang las 'dis yul la 'dzin pa srid bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang las 'dis yul la 'dzin pa srid bar 'gyur /
translated: because both are momentary. If the cognition that arises and ceases immediately is not present for even a moment, how could it be possible for it to apprehend an object?

original: bskyed par bya ba la 'dzin no zhe na /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba la 'dzin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it apprehends the object that is being produced,

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: bskyed par bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin la /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa yin la /
translated: That which is being produced is future,

original: de yang ma skyes par gyur pa'i gzugs ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang ma skyes par gyur pa'i gzugs ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: and how could that which is not yet arisen be apprehended?

original: gzugs kyang skyes ma thag tu rnam par 'jig pas skad cig tsam yang gnas pa med na /
analyzed: gzugs kyang skyes ma thag tu rnam par 'jig pas skad cig tsam yang gnas pa med na /
translated: Also, form that has just arisen disintegrates, so it does not endure even for a moment.

original: gang las 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: gang las 'dzin par byed /
translated: How could it be apprehended?

original: de ni 'di ltar skad cig ma'i blo la ji skad smos pa'i gzugs skyes pa'i skad cig ma la mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar skad cig ma'i blo la ji skad smos pa'i gzugs skyes pa'i skad cig ma la mi 'dzin no //
translated: In this way, the mind that is momentary does not apprehend the form that is spoken of as arisen in the moment.

original: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
translated: Or, if you think,

original: skad cig ma'i phyir da ltar ba'i gzugs mi 'dzin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyir da ltar ba'i gzugs mi 'dzin la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is momentary, present form is not apprehended.

original: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ji ltar 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ji ltar 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even so, how could it not apprehend the past and future?‚Äù

original: smras pa / gang @324b gi tshe da ltar ba'i dngos po nyid skad cig ma'i phyir 'dzin par mi nus na /
analyzed: smras pa / gang @324b gi tshe da ltar ba'i dngos po nyid skad cig ma'i phyir 'dzin par mi nus na /
translated: We say: When the nature of the present is not able to be apprehended because it is momentary,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar rnam pa thams cad du yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i zhig pa dang ma skyes pa blos 'dzin par nus /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar rnam pa thams cad du yod bzhin pa ma yin pa'i zhig pa dang ma skyes pa blos 'dzin par nus /
translated: then how could the mind be able to apprehend that which has disintegrated and that which has not yet arisen, which in all ways do not exist?

original: de ltar re zhig 'dzin pa mi srid pa des na yang gzugs med do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'dzin pa mi srid pa des na yang gzugs med do zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa ;
translated: In this way, since it is impossible to apprehend form, it is said that form does not exist.

original: gang tshe nam yang kha dog dang // dbyibs dag tha dad nyid med pas //
analyzed: gang tshe nam yang kha dog dang // dbyibs dag tha dad nyid med pas //
translated: Since color and shape are never different,

original: de dag tha dad 'dzin yod min //
analyzed: de dag tha dad 'dzin yod min //
translated: there is no apprehension of them as different.

original: gcig tu'ang ma yin grags pa'i gzugs //
analyzed: gcig tu'ang ma yin grags pa'i gzugs //
translated: Nor is there a single form that is well known.

original: gal te mig gi yul gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba cung zad yod na de 'dzin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gal te mig gi yul gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba cung zad yod na de 'dzin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the object of the eye, called the form-source, existed even slightly, it would be apprehended.

original: yod pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin la /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: de yod bzhin pa ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir mi 'dzin no //
analyzed: de yod bzhin pa ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir mi 'dzin no //
translated: And since it does not exist, it is not apprehended.

original: ji ltar yang gzugs kyi skye mched yod bzhin pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang gzugs kyi skye mched yod bzhin pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the form-source does not exist?

original: smras pa / 'dir kha dog dang dbyibs dag la gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba la /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dir kha dog dang dbyibs dag la gzugs kyi skye mched ces bya ba la /
translated: Here, color and shape are called the form-source.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs 'di dag ni gcig nyid du gyur pas sam /üîΩtha dad pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs 'di dag ni gcig nyid du gyur pas sam / tha dad pa nyid du'o //
translated: These colors and shapes are either identical or different.

original: re zhig kha dog dang dbyibs dag tha dad pa nyid du med la /
analyzed: re zhig kha dog dang dbyibs dag tha dad pa nyid du med la /
translated: First, color and shape are not different.

original: gal te yod na phan tshun ma ltos par 'dzin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te yod na phan tshun ma ltos par 'dzin par 'gyur la /
translated: If they existed, they would be apprehended without mutual dependence.

original: 'di dag kyang kha dog las tha dad pa'i dbyibs 'dzin par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang kha dog las tha dad pa'i dbyibs 'dzin par mi nus te /
translated: Also, it is not possible to apprehend a shape that is different from color.üîΩIt is not like a cloth that is different from a pot.

original: bum pa las snam bu lta bu ma yin la de bzhin du dbyibs las tha dad pa'i kha dog 'dzin par mi nus so //
analyzed: bum pa las snam bu lta bu ma yin la de bzhin du dbyibs las tha dad pa'i kha dog 'dzin par mi nus so //
translated: Similarly, it is not possible to apprehend a color that is different from shape.

original: gdon mi za bar dbyibs gang yang rung ba la de'i kha dog 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dbyibs gang yang rung ba la de'i kha dog 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Undoubtedly, any shape whatsoever arises from color.

original: gang yang 'di'i gnas lugs la de'i dbyibs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'di'i gnas lugs la de'i dbyibs zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the shape of that color is called its mode of being.

original: dbyibs las tha dad pa'i kha dog logs su grub par mi srid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbyibs las tha dad pa'i kha dog logs su grub par mi srid do zhes bya'o //
translated: It is impossible for a color to exist separately from shape.

original: de 'di ltar tha dad pa nyid na /
analyzed: de 'di ltar tha dad pa nyid na /
translated: If they are different,

original: gang gi tshe kha dog nam yang dbyibs la mi srid la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kha dog nam yang dbyibs la mi srid la /
translated: then color is never possible in shape.

original: des na de dag tha dad par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag tha dad par 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to apprehend them as different.

original: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
analyzed: yang na 'di snyam du sems na /
translated: Or, if you think,

original: gal te tha dad du ma grub pa'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs dag tha dad du mi 'dzin la ;
analyzed: gal te tha dad du ma grub pa'i phyir kha dog dang dbyibs dag tha dad du mi 'dzin la ;
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are not established as different, color and shape are not apprehended as different.

original: de lta na yang gcig tu gyur pa 'dren ma'i dngos por de dag 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gcig tu gyur pa 'dren ma'i dngos por de dag 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then they would be apprehended as a composite entity, a unity.

original: smras pa / so so so sor ma grub pa dag 'dren ma'i dngos por med pas 'di dag gcig tu ga la zhig / de'i phyir de dag gang gcig tu 'dzin pa mi srid do //üîΩkha dog dang dbyibs las @325a * //
analyzed: smras pa / so so so sor ma grub pa dag 'dren ma'i dngos por med pas 'di dag gcig tu ga la zhig / de'i phyir de dag gang gcig tu 'dzin pa mi srid do // kha dog dang dbyibs las @325a * //
translated: We reply: How could they be a unity, since they do not exist as discrete entities? Therefore, it is impossible to apprehend them as a unity.

original: gzhan du gzugs mi dmigs la /
analyzed: gzhan du gzugs mi dmigs la /
translated: Form is not observed apart from color and shape.

original: gang gi phyir de yang pha rol pos gzugs na kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do zhes grags pa de dag kyang mi 'dzin no zhes bsgrubs so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de yang pha rol pos gzugs na kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bdag nyid do zhes grags pa de dag kyang mi 'dzin no zhes bsgrubs so zhes bya ste /
translated: And it is established that the opponent does not apprehend color and shape as having the nature of form.

original: des na mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs med do //
analyzed: des na mi 'dzin pa'i phyir gzugs med do //
translated: Therefore, because they do not apprehend it, form does not exist.

original: yang na gal te yang 'dzin pa med pas gzugs med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na gal te yang 'dzin pa med pas gzugs med par 'gyur la /
translated: Or else, if form does not exist because it is not apprehended,

original: de lta na yang mig gi blo re zhig yod de de ma bkag pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de lta na yang mig gi blo re zhig yod de de ma bkag pa'i phyir la /
translated: then visual cognition exists, because it has not been refuted.

original: de yang gzugs med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang gzugs med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
translated: And it is said that it does not occur without form.

original: de'i phyir gzugs kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, form also would come to exist.üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / gal te mig gi blo yod na gzugs yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te mig gi blo yod na gzugs yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the eye cognition exists, form would exist.

original: yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: mig blo mig la yod ma yin //
analyzed: mig blo mig la yod ma yin //
translated: The eye cognition does not exist in the eye,

original: gzugs la yod min par na med //üîΩgzugs dang mig la brten nas su //
analyzed: gzugs la yod min par na med // gzugs dang mig la brten nas su //
translated: nor does it exist in form, nor does it exist in between.

original: legs so log par yongs brtags pa //
analyzed: legs so log par yongs brtags pa //
translated: It is well imagined in dependence on form and the eye.

original: 'dir mig gi blo mig dang gzugs la brten nas skye'o zhes rnam par 'jog pa nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir mig gi blo mig dang gzugs la brten nas skye'o zhes rnam par 'jog pa nyid rnam par dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Here the very establishment of the eye cognition as arising in dependence on the eye and form should be analyzed.

original: ci mig gi blo 'di mig la yod dam /
analyzed: ci mig gi blo 'di mig la yod dam /
translated: Does this eye cognition exist in the eye?

original: de ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na gnas pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de mig la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phyir yul na gnas pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de mig la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not physical, it does not exist in a place, and therefore it does not exist in the eye.

original: ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med la /üîΩmig dang gzugs de dag gi bar du yang mi srid de /
analyzed: ji ltar mig la med pa de bzhin du gzugs la yang med la / mig dang gzugs de dag gi bar du yang mi srid de /
translated: Just as it does not exist in the eye, it also does not exist in form.

original: yul na mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yul na mi gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is also not possible in between the eye and form because it does not exist in a place.

original: gang yang de'i tshe mig gi blo mig la ma yin /
analyzed: gang yang de'i tshe mig gi blo mig la ma yin /
translated: Moreover, at that time, the eye consciousness does not exist in the eye,

original: gzugs la yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs la yang ma yin /
translated: nor does it exist in form,

original: bar na yang ma yin pas de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa nyid de ji ltar yod do zhes smra bar rung ste /
analyzed: bar na yang ma yin pas de'i tshe rnam pa thams cad du yod pa ma yin pa nyid de ji ltar yod do zhes smra bar rung ste /
translated: nor does it exist in between. Therefore, at that time, it does not exist in any way. How could it be tenable to say, ‚ÄúIt exists‚Äù?

original: 'di ni med pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni med pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúnonexistence.‚Äù

original: smras pa / gal te yang de mig la med cing gzugs dang bar na yang med kyang /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te yang de mig la med cing gzugs dang bar na yang med kyang /
translated: Objection: Even though it does not exist in the eye and does not exist in between form and the eye,

original: de lta na yang mig dang gzugs la brten nas skye ba yod pas /
analyzed: de lta na yang mig dang gzugs la brten nas skye ba yod pas /
translated: still, since it arises in dependence on the eye and form,

original: de'i phyir mig gi blo yang yod do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mig gi blo yang yod do zhe na /
translated: the eye consciousness exists.

original: smras pa / gang gang na mi gnas pa ji ltar de las skye /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gang na mi gnas pa ji ltar de las skye /
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: How could something that does not exist anywhere arise from that?

original: yang na de ltar 'gyur na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur na de dag ni med la /
analyzed: yang na de ltar 'gyur na thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur na de dag ni med la /
translated: If that were so, everything would arise from everything. But they do not.

original: ming dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi blo skye'o zhes smra na yang /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la brten nas mig gi blo skye'o zhes smra na yang /
translated: Even though you say the eye consciousness arises in dependence on name and form,

original: des na 'di ni yang dag par mi skye ste /
analyzed: des na 'di ni yang dag par mi skye ste /
translated: it does not arise in reality.

original: skye ba rigs pa dang mi ldan @325b pa'i phyir ro zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: skye ba rigs pa dang mi ldan @325b pa'i phyir ro zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to prove that, he says:

original: mig dang gzugs la brten nas su //üîΩlegs so log par yongs brtags pa //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs la brten nas su // legs so log par yongs brtags pa //
translated: The eye and form are the basis

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: For the thorough examination of the correct and incorrect.

original: gang gi bdag nyid kyis so sor snang ba de'i bdag nyid la brtags na mi srid pas na de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gang gi bdag nyid kyis so sor snang ba de'i bdag nyid la brtags na mi srid pas na de nyid kyis na /
translated: Since it is impossible to examine the nature of that which appears individually by itself, therefore:

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu yang //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu yang //
translated: The illusion-like consciousness

original: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i gnyen gyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: Was taught by the Friend of the Sun.

original: zhes mdo las gsungs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes mdo las gsungs so zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what the sutra says.

original: de ni de ltar mig gi blo mi srid pa'i phyir mi bzung bas gzugs med do //
analyzed: de ni de ltar mig gi blo mi srid pa'i phyir mi bzung bas gzugs med do //
translated: Since the eye consciousness is impossible in that way, form is not apprehended.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gzugs 'dzin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs 'dzin pa nyid de /
translated: Form is apprehended.

original: de la 'dzin pa po mig gi dbang po yod pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
