analyzed: de la 'dzin pa po mig gi dbang po yod pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: Since the eye faculty, which is the apprehender, exists, the Bhagavat taught:

original: mig gis gzugs mthong bas yid bde ba'i gnas la mngon par zhen no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong bas yid bde ba'i gnas la mngon par zhen no zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe eye sees form and becomes attached to the basis of mental satisfaction.‚Äù

original: smras pa / gal te mig rang gi bdag nyid mthong na gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te mig rang gi bdag nyid mthong na gzugs 'dzin par 'gyur la /
translated: Objection: If the eye sees its own nature, it would apprehend form.

original: mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But it does not see itself.

original: gal te mig gis bdag mthong min //
analyzed: gal te mig gis bdag mthong min //
translated: If the eye does not see itself,

original: des gzugs mthong ba ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: des gzugs mthong ba ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could it see other things?

original: de phyir mig dang gzugs bdag med //
analyzed: de phyir mig dang gzugs bdag med //
translated: Therefore the eye and form are devoid of self.

original: de bzhin skye mched lhag ma rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin skye mched lhag ma rnams //
translated: So too are the remaining sense bases.

original: gal te mig gis bdag nyid mi mthong la /
analyzed: gal te mig gis bdag nyid mi mthong la /
translated: If the eye does not see itself,

original: de'i tshe rang gi bdag nyid ma mthong bas bong ba la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs kyang mi mthong la /
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi bdag nyid ma mthong bas bong ba la sogs pa bzhin du gzugs kyang mi mthong la /
translated: then, since it does not see itself, like a lump of clay, it would not see form.

original: de ni bong ba la sogs pa bzhin pas mig nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes sgrub par byed na de //
analyzed: de ni bong ba la sogs pa bzhin pas mig nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes sgrub par byed na de //
translated: And since it would be like a lump of clay, it would not be an eye.

original: de phyir mig bdag med ces pa la /
analyzed: de phyir mig bdag med ces pa la /
translated: Therefore the eye is devoid of self.

original: gang gi phyir mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba de'i phyir rang bzhin med do //üîΩmig med na mig dang de la brten pa'i mig gi blo med pas gzung ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig gis gzugs mi mthong ba de'i phyir rang bzhin med do // mig med na mig dang de la brten pa'i mig gi blo med pas gzung ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the eye does not see form, it is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: gzugs ni shin tu yang rang bzhin med do //
analyzed: gzugs ni shin tu yang rang bzhin med do //
translated: Since the eye does not exist, the eye consciousness that depends on it does not exist. Therefore, since there is no object of apprehension, form is utterly devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: ji ltar mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched dag rang bzhin med pa nyid ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar mig dang gzugs kyi skye mched dag rang bzhin med pa nyid ltar /
translated: Just as the eye and form sense-spheres are devoid of intrinsic reality,

original: de bzhin skye mched lhag ma rnams ni /
analyzed: de bzhin skye mched lhag ma rnams ni /
translated: so too should you understand that the remaining sense-spheres

original: skye mched thams cad mig dang gzugs bzhin du rang bzhin yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skye mched thams cad mig dang gzugs bzhin du rang bzhin yin par khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: are like the eye and form sense-spheres in being devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: reg gi skye mched nye bar bstan pa'i phyir mig yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: reg gi skye mched nye bar bstan pa'i phyir mig yod pa nyid de /
translated: the eye exists because the sense-spheres of contact are taught.

original: 'dir reg gi skye mched drug pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir reg gi skye mched drug pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the six sense-spheres of contact are as follows:

original: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas /
analyzed: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas /
translated: The sense-sphere of eye contactüîΩup to

original: ji srid yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi @326a * //üîΩbar du zhes so //
analyzed: ji srid yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi @326a * // bar du zhes so //
translated: the sense-sphere of mental contact.

original: de la reg pa zhes brjod pa ni dbang po dang yul dang shes pa rnam gsum 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: de la reg pa zhes brjod pa ni dbang po dang yul dang shes pa rnam gsum 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid can /
translated: Here, contact is defined as the convergence of three factors: a sense faculty, an object, and a consciousness.

original: tshor ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos la /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rgyu sems las byung ba'i chos la /
translated: It is the cause of feeling, a mental factor.

original: de la reg pa'i skye mched ni reg pa skye ba'i sgo'i dngos por rnam par gnas pas reg pa'i skye mched de /
analyzed: de la reg pa'i skye mched ni reg pa skye ba'i sgo'i dngos por rnam par gnas pas reg pa'i skye mched de /
translated: The sense-sphere of contact is the basis for the arising of contact.

original: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas ji srid yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi reg pa'i skye mched nas ji srid yid kyi reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: The bases of contact should be understood from the base of eye contact to the base of mind contact.

original: gal te mig med na de'i reg pa'i skye mched nye bar mi ston la /
analyzed: gal te mig med na de'i reg pa'i skye mched nye bar mi ston la /
translated: If the eye did not exist, the base of contact would not be revealed.

original: de yang nye bar bstan pas de'i phyir reg gi skye mched nye bar bstan pas na mig yod pa nyid do zhe na ;
analyzed: de yang nye bar bstan pas de'i phyir reg gi skye mched nye bar bstan pas na mig yod pa nyid do zhe na ;
translated: Since it is revealed, the eye exists because the base of contact is revealed.

original: smras pa / skye mched rnams yod na reg gi skye mched ces bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / skye mched rnams yod na reg gi skye mched ces bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: We reply: If the bases exist, then the base of contact would exist.

original: de lta na yang skye mched rnams ma grub ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang skye mched rnams ma grub ste /
translated: But even so, the bases are not established.

original: ji ltar byas na gang gi phyir zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na gang gi phyir zhes gsungs pa /
translated: How is that? It is stated:

original: gang tshe gcig dang reg ldan gcig / de tshe cig shos stong pa nyid //üîΩstong pa'ang mi stong mi brten la //
analyzed: gang tshe gcig dang reg ldan gcig / de tshe cig shos stong pa nyid // stong pa'ang mi stong mi brten la //
translated: When one is endowed with contact, the other is emptiness.üîΩEmptiness does not rely on the nonempty.

original: mi stong pa yang stong pa min //
analyzed: mi stong pa yang stong pa min //
translated: The nonempty also does not rely on emptiness.

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rgyud gcig gi phyir rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyud nyid la nye bar 'byung la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rgyud gcig gi phyir rnam par shes pa gcig gi rgyud nyid la nye bar 'byung la /
translated: Because the consciousnesses of sentient beings arise in the same continuum, one consciousness arises in the continuum of another.

original: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la nye ba na /
analyzed: de yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la nye ba na /
translated: When the eye consciousness is about to arise,

original: mig gcig nyid reg pa dang lhan cig gyur par 'byung bas reg ldan gcig ste /
analyzed: mig gcig nyid reg pa dang lhan cig gyur par 'byung bas reg ldan gcig ste /
translated: the eye sense faculty is the single one that is present, since it is the basis of the contact that occurs simultaneously with it.

original: reg dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: reg dang 'brel pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the one that possesses contact, since it is related to contact.

original: gang gi tshe gcig reg dang lhan cig gnas pa na de'i tshe cig shos rna ba la sogs pa'i reg gi skye mched rnams stong pa reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig reg dang lhan cig gnas pa na de'i tshe cig shos rna ba la sogs pa'i reg gi skye mched rnams stong pa reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When one sense faculty is present with contact, the other sense faculties such as the ear are empty of the sense base of contact, since they are devoid of the nature of the sense base of contact.

original: yang 'di snyam du sems na /üîΩgal te yang de'i gnas skabs nas rang gi rnam par shes pa stong pa'i rna ba la sogs pa reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba yod pa'i rna ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rang gi rnam shes mngon du gyur pa na reg gi
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du sems na / gal te yang de'i gnas skabs nas rang gi rnam par shes pa stong pa'i rna ba la sogs pa reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin dang bral ba yod pa'i rna ba la sogs pa de dag kyang rang gi rnam shes mngon du gyur pa na reg gi
translated: If you think thatüîΩeven though the ear and so on are empty of their own consciousness, the ear and so on that exist in their own state are not devoid of the nature of the sense base of contact, and that when their own consciousness manifests, they are not empty of the nature of the sense base of contact,

original: skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis mi stong par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyis mi stong par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then that is not so.

original: smras pa / stong pa'am mi stong mi brten la //
analyzed: smras pa / stong pa'am mi stong mi brten la //
translated: Objection: Emptiness and non-emptiness are not dependent.

original: gang las gang gi rang bzhin dang bcas par mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang las gang gi rang bzhin dang bcas par mi rung ste /
translated: Reply: How could anything be dependent on anything?

original: 'di lta ste gang sra ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nam yang sra ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gang sra ba'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nam yang sra ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa ma yin la /
translated: For example, that which lacks the nature of solidity is never endowed with the nature of solidity.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa @326b yang nam yang reg gi skye mched mi 'byung la /üîΩmig kyang rtag pa nyid du reg gi skye mched can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa @326b yang nam yang reg gi skye mched mi 'byung la / mig kyang rtag pa nyid du reg gi skye mched can du 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, the ear and so on never arise as the sense base of touch.

original: gang gi phyir mi stong pa yang stong pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi stong pa yang stong pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the eye would always be the sense base of touch, because that which is not empty is not empty.

original: gang mi stong pa'i rang bzhin de ni stong pa nyid mi brten la /
analyzed: gang mi stong pa'i rang bzhin de ni stong pa nyid mi brten la /
translated: That which has the nature of non-emptiness is not dependent on emptiness.

original: da ltar ba me dro ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de nyid des stong pa mi brten no ;
analyzed: da ltar ba me dro ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa de nyid des stong pa mi brten no ;
translated: Also, the present, which is endowed with the characteristic of fire‚Äôs heat, is not dependent on that.

original: / yang na rang bzhin gyis mi 'gyur ba'i phyir stong pa yang mi stong pa mi brten la /
analyzed: / yang na rang bzhin gyis mi 'gyur ba'i phyir stong pa yang mi stong pa mi brten la /
translated: Or, because the nature of things does not change, emptiness is not dependent on non-emptiness, and non-emptiness is not dependent on emptiness.

original: mi stong pa yang stong pa min //
analyzed: mi stong pa yang stong pa min //
translated: Non-emptiness is not emptiness.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: Therefore, if something has the intrinsic reality of the sense bases of contact,

original: de ni reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin nyid thob pa'am /
analyzed: de ni reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin nyid thob pa'am /
translated: then it would obtain the intrinsic reality of the sense bases of contact.

original: gang zhig reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid thob pa de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig reg gi skye mched kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid thob pa de yang mi 'thad do zhes bya'o //
translated: But it is also untenable that something that does not have the intrinsic reality of the sense bases of contact obtains it.

original: de'i phyir reg gi skye mched med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg gi skye mched med do //
translated: Therefore the sense bases of contact do not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te reg gi skye mched med kyang de lta na yang re zhig reg pa yod de /
analyzed: gal te reg gi skye mched med kyang de lta na yang re zhig reg pa yod de /
translated: Even if the sense bases of contact do not exist, still contact exists.

original: gsum 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid pas /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid pas /
translated: Since it is characterized by the assembly of three,

original: de yod na reg gi skye mched kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na reg gi skye mched kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: if it exists, then the sense bases of contact would also occur.

original: smras pa / gal te reg pa nyid yod na reg pa'i skye mched yod de /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te reg pa nyid yod na reg pa'i skye mched yod de /
translated: Response: If contact itself exists, then the sense bases of contact would exist.

original: de yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But it does not exist.

original: ji ltar yang med pa de ltar sgrub par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar yang med pa de ltar sgrub par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: How it does not exist is established by the following statement:

original: ngo bo mi gnas yod min pas //
analyzed: ngo bo mi gnas yod min pas //
translated: Since an intrinsic reality does not endure, it does not exist.

original: gsum 'dus pa yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa yang yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore the assembly of three does not exist.

original: de yi bdag nyid reg med pas //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid reg med pas //
translated: Since it does not have the intrinsic reality of contact,

original: de tshe tshor ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: de tshe tshor ba yod ma yin //
translated: At that time, there is no feeling.

original: gnas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po rnams las phan tshun 'dus pa 'byung srid la /
analyzed: gnas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dngos po rnams las phan tshun 'dus pa 'byung srid la /
translated: It is possible that things that have the nature of enduring come together.

original: mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams la ma yin te /üîΩskyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i ngo bo la /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i rang bzhin can gyi dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa rnams la ma yin te / skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa'i phyir mi gnas pa'i ngo bo la /
translated: But the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses that have the nature of not enduring do not.üîΩBecause they are momentary, they do not endure.

original: mi gnas pa'i ngo bo'i phyir yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyis ni 'du ba'i dus kyi bar du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i ngo bo'i phyir yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa nyid kyis ni 'du ba'i dus kyi bar du med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have the nature of not enduring, they do not endure.

original: 'di dag phrad pa ga la zhig / ces bsgrubs pas /
analyzed: 'di dag phrad pa ga la zhig / ces bsgrubs pas /
translated: Since they cease as soon as they arise, how could they come together?

original: ngo bos mi gnas pa'i ngo bo la gsum 'dus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bos mi gnas pa'i ngo bo la gsum 'dus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is established that that which has the nature of not enduring does not come together with that which has the nature of not enduring.

original: gang gi tshe med pa de'i tshe 'du ba med pas ;üîΩde'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa med de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe med pa de'i tshe 'du ba med pas ; de'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa med de /
translated: When they do not exist, they do not come together.

original: gsum 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi reg pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i rang bzhin gyi reg pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, contact that has the nature of the coming together of the three does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: reg pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: reg pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Contact exists.

original: de'i 'bras bu tshor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu tshor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of that, feeling, exists.

original: 'dir reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nye bar dmigs la /
analyzed: 'dir reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba nye bar dmigs la /
translated: Here, feeling is observed in dependence on contact.

original: de yod pas de'i @327a * //
analyzed: de yod pas de'i @327a * //
translated: Since that exists,

original: rgyu reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / gal te tshor ba nyid yod na reg pa yod la yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu reg pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na / smras pa / gal te tshor ba nyid yod na reg pa yod la yod pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: its cause, contact, will arise.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩIf feeling exists, contact exists.

original: de tshe tshor ba yod ma yin //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: de tshe tshor ba yod ma yin // zhes pa la /
translated: If feeling does not exist, contact does not exist.

original: gal te reg pa yod na de'i tshe reg pa'i rgyu can tshor ba yod la ;
analyzed: gal te reg pa yod na de'i tshe reg pa'i rgyu can tshor ba yod la ;
translated: If contact exists, at that time feeling that has contact as its cause exists.

original: gang gi tshe reg pa nyid med na de'i tshe rgyu med pa'i tshor ba ga las 'byung /
analyzed: gang gi tshe reg pa nyid med na de'i tshe rgyu med pa'i tshor ba ga las 'byung /
translated: But when contact itself does not exist, at that time how could feeling arise without a cause?

original: tshor ba med pa'i phyir yang reg pa med do zhes grub po //
analyzed: tshor ba med pa'i phyir yang reg pa med do zhes grub po //
translated: Because feeling does not exist, contact does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: gal te yang khyod kyis /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod kyis /
translated: Even though you have said,

original: de'i phyir mig dang gzugs bdag med //
analyzed: de'i phyir mig dang gzugs bdag med //
translated: Therefore the eye and form are selfless.

original: de bzhin skye mched lhag ma rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin skye mched lhag ma rnams //
translated: So too the remaining sense bases.

original: shes pas skye mched dgag pa de ltar smras la /
analyzed: shes pas skye mched dgag pa de ltar smras la /
translated: In this way you have refuted the sense bases with knowledge,

original: de lta na yang rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ma bkag pa'i phyir yod la /
analyzed: de lta na yang rnam par shes pa'i khams drug ma bkag pa'i phyir yod la /
translated: Still, since the six elements of consciousness are not refuted, they exist.

original: de yod pas de'i rten dang dmigs pa'i skye mched kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yod pas de'i rten dang dmigs pa'i skye mched kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And since they exist, their supports and objects, the sense bases, also arise.üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna states the following:

original: smras pa / gal te rnam par shes pa nyid yod na skye mched rnams yod la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te rnam par shes pa nyid yod na skye mched rnams yod la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: If consciousness itself existed, the sense bases would exist, but since it does not,üîΩhe says this to demonstrate that they do not exist.üîΩConsciousness arises in dependence

original: nang dang phyi yi skye mched la //üîΩbrten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung //
analyzed: nang dang phyi yi skye mched la // brten nas rnam par shes pa 'byung //
translated: on the internal and external sense bases.

original: de phyir rnam par shes pa med //
analyzed: de phyir rnam par shes pa med //
translated: Therefore consciousness does not exist.

original: smig rgyu sgyu ma lta bur stong //
analyzed: smig rgyu sgyu ma lta bur stong //
translated: Like a mirage or an illusion, it is empty.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis yod na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa rang bzhin gyis yod na /
translated: If consciousness existed intrinsically,

original: de ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched la brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni nang dang phyi'i skye mched la brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: it would not arise in dependence on the internal and external sense bases.

original: da ltar bzhin du rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du gnas pas brten nas 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ltar bzhin du rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid du gnas pas brten nas 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as it is now, consciousness would exist as a permanent reality, and so it would not arise in dependence on the sense bases.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las skyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it would arise from causes and conditions,

original: nges par rnam par shes pa de med de //
analyzed: nges par rnam par shes pa de med de //
translated: Consciousness is definitely not real,

original: rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because it does not exist intrinsically.

original: gal te de ltar rnam par shes pa med na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rnam par shes pa med na /
translated: If consciousness does not exist in this way,

original: de bzhin du de lta yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du de lta yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then, because it does not exist in this way,

original: 'di ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa /üîΩsmig rgyu sgyu ma lta bur stong //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa / smig rgyu sgyu ma lta bur stong //
translated: it cannot be an object of apprehension.

original: zhes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa la /
translated: It is said:üîΩLike a mirage or an illusion, it is empty.

original: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu bzhin du rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa yang 'jig rten pas nye bar dmigs la /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang smig rgyu bzhin du rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa yang 'jig rten pas nye bar dmigs la /
translated: Consciousness, which is empty of intrinsic reality like a mirage or an illusion, is perceived by the world.

original: de tsam zhig kyang 'di'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de tsam zhig kyang 'di'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: But that much is not its intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: yul yongs su gcod pa yod pas rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul yongs su gcod pa yod pas rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness exists because the object is apprehended.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam par yul yongs su gcod pa po yod na de ltar yod la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par yul yongs su gcod pa po yod na de ltar yod la /
translated: If the object were apprehended, then it would exist in this way.

original: yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bsgrub @327b pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin no zhes bsgrub @327b pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: But in order to prove that it does not exist, it is said:

original: rnam shes shes bya la brten nas //
analyzed: rnam shes shes bya la brten nas //
translated: Consciousness arises in dependence on the object of consciousness.

original: 'byung ba shes bya yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'byung ba shes bya yod ma yin //
translated: The object of consciousness does not exist.

original: shes bya shes pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: shes bya shes pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no object of cognition,

original: de phyir shes pa po nyid med //
analyzed: de phyir shes pa po nyid med //
translated: Therefore there is no cognizer.

original: 'dir 'di'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med par mi 'byung bas shes bya la ltos la /
analyzed: 'dir 'di'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med par mi 'byung bas shes bya la ltos la /
translated: Here, since consciousness does not occur without an object of cognition, it depends on the object of cognition.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par shes pa dang / shes bya dag la brten nas 'byung bas ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par shes pa dang / shes bya dag la brten nas 'byung bas ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub pas /
translated: Since consciousness and the object of cognition arise in dependence on each other, they are not established by their own intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir shes bya med la /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya med la /
translated: Therefore, the object of cognition does not exist.

original: shes bya med par gyur na dmigs pa med par rnam par shes pa ga la 'byung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya med par gyur na dmigs pa med par rnam par shes pa ga la 'byung zhes bya ste /
translated: If the object of cognition does not exist, how could consciousness occur without an object of cognition?

original: rnam par shes pa med pas rnam shes ni //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med pas rnam shes ni //
translated: Since consciousness does not exist,

original: smig rgyu sgyu ma bzhin du stong //
analyzed: smig rgyu sgyu ma bzhin du stong //
translated: Consciousness is empty like a mirage or an illusion.

original: zhes gnas so //
analyzed: zhes gnas so //
translated: This is the position.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩrnam par shes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / rnam par shes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: shes bya dang shes pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya dang shes pa po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Consciousness exists because the object of cognition and the cognizer exist.

original: 'dir re zhig rnam par shes so zhes pas rnam par shes pa po yod de /
analyzed: 'dir re zhig rnam par shes so zhes pas rnam par shes pa po yod de /
translated: Here, first, since it is said, ‚ÄúIt cognizes,‚Äù the cognizer exists.

original: phung po la brten nas brtags pa'i gang zag byed pa por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la brten nas brtags pa'i gang zag byed pa por gyur pa'o //
translated: The person imputed in dependence on the aggregates is the agent.

original: de gang gis rnam par shes so zhes de ni 'di'i byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de gang gis rnam par shes so zhes de ni 'di'i byed pa yin la /
translated: How is it cognized? That is its function.

original: gang zhig rnam par shes so zhes de ni 'di'i las so //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par shes so zhes de ni 'di'i las so //
translated: What cognizes? That is its action.

original: byed pa dang las med par byed pa po yod par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byed pa dang las med par byed pa po yod par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: It is not tenable that an agent exists without function and action.

original: des na byed pa po yod pas na /
analyzed: des na byed pa po yod pas na /
translated: Therefore, since an agent exists,

original: de bzhin du shes bya dang shes pa po yod do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya dang shes pa po yod do zhes bya'o //
translated: so too the object of knowledge and the knower exist.

original: smras pa / gal te shes pa po nyid yod na /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te shes pa po nyid yod na /
translated: Objection: If the knower itself exists,

original: rnam par shes pa dang shes bya yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang shes bya yod par 'gyur na /
translated: then knowledge and the object of knowledge would exist.

original: gang ji srid du rnam par shes pa dang shes bya dag med pas las dang byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang ji srid du rnam par shes pa dang shes bya dag med pas las dang byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: But since as long as knowledge and the object of knowledge do not exist, because it is devoid of action and agent,üîΩhow could an agent exist at all?

original: byed pa po nyid 'ga' yang ga la zhig ces bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: byed pa po nyid 'ga' yang ga la zhig ces bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: To prove this, it is said:

original: shes bya shes pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: shes bya shes pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since the object of knowledge and knowledge do not exist,

original: de phyir shes pa po nyid med //
analyzed: de phyir shes pa po nyid med //
translated: therefore the knower itself does not exist.

original: ces pas / shes pa po med pas shes pa dang shes bya med do zhes grub po //
analyzed: ces pas / shes pa po med pas shes pa dang shes bya med do zhes grub po //
translated: Since the knower does not exist, knowledge and the object of knowledge do not exist. This is established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: phyi rol dang nang gi skye mched dag yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi skye mched dag yod pa nyid de /
translated: The external and internal sense spheres do exist.

original: de dag mi rtag par nye bar bstan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag mi rtag par nye bar bstan pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn taught that they are impermanent.

original: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad mi rtag pa'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll conditioned things are impermanent.‚Äù

original: gal te na yang nad dang phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyi skye mched med na /
analyzed: gal te na yang nad dang phyi rol gyi bdag nyid kyi skye mched med na /
translated: But if the external sense spheres do not exist,

original: de'i tshe ci gal te thams cad mi rtag par 'gyur zhes bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci gal te thams cad mi rtag par 'gyur zhes bya /
translated: then what is it that is impermanent?

original: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid bstan pas @328a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid bstan pas @328a * //
translated: Therefore, because impermanence is taught,

original: dngos po thams cad grub po zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad grub po zhe na /
translated: all things are established.

original: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: smras pa / bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: We reply: The BhagavƒÅn said,

original: thams cad mi rtag cung zad kyang //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtag cung zad kyang //
translated: ‚ÄúNothing is impermanent.

original: mi rtag med la yang na rtag / dngos po yod na rtag pa dang // mi rtag par 'gyur de ga la //
analyzed: mi rtag med la yang na rtag / dngos po yod na rtag pa dang // mi rtag par 'gyur de ga la //
translated: If things exist, then they would be either permanent or impermanent.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du thams cad mi rtag go zhes gsungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du thams cad mi rtag go zhes gsungs zhes bya'o //
translated: Here the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúNothing is impermanent.‚Äù

original: de rnam par 'jig pa'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba min la /
analyzed: de rnam par 'jig pa'i dngos po'i rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba min la /
translated: He saw the nature of things that are destroyed.

original: 'on kyang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ma gzigs la /
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ma gzigs la /
translated: But the nature of things is not seen.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma gzigs pas snying po med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa la ltos nas /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma gzigs pas snying po med pa nyid gsal bar byed pa la ltos nas /
translated: And since the nature of all things is not seen, in dependence on the fact that he makes clear the absence of any essence,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di ni rang bzhin la log par rtogs pa dgag pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa 'di ni rang bzhin la log par rtogs pa dgag pa'i don du'o //
translated: the statement of the Transcendent Lord is for the purpose of refuting the misconception of essence.

original: don dam par ni rnam par dpyad na mi rtag pa cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni rnam par dpyad na mi rtag pa cung zad kyang med do //
translated: But in reality, when analyzed, there is not the slightest thing that is impermanent.

original: yang rtag pa'o //
analyzed: yang rtag pa'o //
translated: And there is not the slightest thing that is permanent.

original: 'di dag gnyi ga yang don dam par ma grub po zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyi ga yang don dam par ma grub po zhes dgongs so //
translated: The point is that neither of these two is established in reality.

original: ci'i phyir slar yang 'di dag gnyi ga ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir slar yang 'di dag gnyi ga ma grub ce na /
translated: Why are neither of these two established?

original: smras pa / gang gi phyir dngos por yod na rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: smras pa / gang gi phyir dngos por yod na rtag pa'am mi rtag par 'gyur na /
translated: It is said: Because if something exists as a thing, it would be permanent or impermanent.

original: dngos po de ga la zhig go ste /
analyzed: dngos po de ga la zhig go ste /
translated: But how could there be such a thing?

original: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas dngos po med par bsgrub pa'i phyir dngos po de ga la zhig pa'o ;
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pas dngos po med par bsgrub pa'i phyir dngos po de ga la zhig pa'o ;
translated: Since the argument stated earlier establishes that things do not exist, how could there be such a thing?

original: / dngos po de med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / dngos po de med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that there is no such thing.

original: dngos po med par gyur pa la rtag pa nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid ga la zhig / de'i phyir dngos po rnams snying po med pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa la ltos nas 'di dag gsungs pa nyid la rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed paüîΩyin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med par gyur pa la rtag pa nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid ga la zhig / de'i phyir dngos po rnams snying po med pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa la ltos nas 'di dag gsungs pa nyid la rang bzhin med pa gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the elucidation of the essencelessness of things, these statements elucidate essencelessness.

original: rnam pa thams cad du tshig 'di dag gis rang bzhin gsal bar sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //üîΩji ltar yang dngos po med pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i log par rtog pa 'byung ba mi srid pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du tshig 'di dag gis rang bzhin gsal bar sgrub par byed pa ma yin no // ji ltar yang dngos po med pas rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i log par rtog pa 'byung ba mi srid pas /
translated: They do not in any way establish essencelessness through these statements.üîΩJust as it is impossible for the misconceptions of permanence and impermanence to arise in the absence of things,

original: de bzhin du sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag gi phyin ci log kyang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med par gyur pas 'byung mi srid la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dag gi phyin ci log kyang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med par gyur pas 'byung mi srid la /
translated: in the same way, the errors of attractiveness and unattractiveness are impossible in the absence of the essence of things.

original: de med pas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log gi rgyu can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang mi rigs so zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de med pas sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i phyin ci log gi rgyu can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang mi rigs so zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Since that does not exist, it is not tenable that there is attachment, aversion, and delusion, which are caused by the error of the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log /
analyzed: sdug dang mi sdug phyin ci log /
translated: The pleasant, the unpleasant, and error

original: @328b rkyen skyes chags sdang gti mug ste //
analyzed: @328b rkyen skyes chags sdang gti mug ste //
translated: arise from conditions.

original: de phyir ngo bos 'dod chags dang // zhe sdang gti mug yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir ngo bos 'dod chags dang // zhe sdang gti mug yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, attachment, aversion, and delusion do not exist essentially.

original: de la sdug pa zhes brjod pa yid dang mthun pa'i phyin ci log pas mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug pa zhes brjod pa yid dang mthun pa'i phyin ci log pas mi sdug pa'o //
translated: Here, the unpleasant is the opposite of the pleasant, that which is not in accordance with the mind.

original: phyin ci log kyang rtag pa bdag med pa gtsang ba'o zhes so //üîΩde la sdug pa la brten nas 'dod chags 'byung /
analyzed: phyin ci log kyang rtag pa bdag med pa gtsang ba'o zhes so // de la sdug pa la brten nas 'dod chags 'byung /
translated: And error is the opposite of permanence, the self, and purity.üîΩAttachment arises in dependence on the pleasant.

original: mi sdug pa la brten nas zhe sdang 'byung zhing /
analyzed: mi sdug pa la brten nas zhe sdang 'byung zhing /
translated: Aversion arises in dependence on the unpleasant.

original: phyin ci log la brten nas gti mug 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phyin ci log la brten nas gti mug 'byung ngo //
translated: Delusion arises in dependence on error.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod na de la sdug pa la sogs par ram /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin yod na de la sdug pa la sogs par ram /
translated: If the nature of things existed, then the pleasant and so on would exist.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du rtog pa las 'dod chags la sogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa nyid du rtog pa las 'dod chags la sogs par 'gyur na /
translated: Attachment and so forth arise from the conception of things as permanent and so forth.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pas sdug pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin med pas sdug pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: But since attractive and so forth do not exist because things lack intrinsic existence,

original: de'i rgyu can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu can gyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: attachment, aversion and delusion do not exist either.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sdug pa la sogs pa mi srid pas 'dod chags la sogs pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sdug pa la sogs pa mi srid pas 'dod chags la sogs pa mi rigs so //
translated: Not only do things lack intrinsic existence, but since attractive and so forth are impossible, attachment and so forth are illogical.üîΩIn this way, since attractive and so forth are impossible, they are untenable.

original: 'di ltar yang sdug pa la sogs pa mi srid pas mi rung ngo zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang sdug pa la sogs pa mi srid pas mi rung ngo zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: To prove this, it is said:

original: gang phyir de nyid la chags shing //
analyzed: gang phyir de nyid la chags shing //
translated: Since one is attached to that,

original: de la zhe sdang de la rmongs //
analyzed: de la zhe sdang de la rmongs //
translated: averse to that and confused about that,

original: de phyir rnam par rtog pas bskyed //
analyzed: de phyir rnam par rtog pas bskyed //
translated: it is produced by conception.

original: rnam rtog de yang de nyid med //
analyzed: rnam rtog de yang de nyid med //
translated: But that conception also does not exist in reality.

original: 'dir sdug pa zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis med de /
analyzed: 'dir sdug pa zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis med de /
translated: Here, what is called attractive does not exist inherently.

original: rgyu mtshan ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ci'i phyir na /
translated: For what reason?

original: gang gi phyir gang zhig kho na kha dog dang dbyibs gzhon sha can la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dngos por gyur pa gang ci yang rung ba la 'dod chags can 'ga' zhig shin tu yid du 'ong bar gyur pa la sdug pa'i rnam par brjod la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang zhig kho na kha dog dang dbyibs gzhon sha can la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i dngos por gyur pa gang ci yang rung ba la 'dod chags can 'ga' zhig shin tu yid du 'ong bar gyur pa la sdug pa'i rnam par brjod la /
translated: Because whatever thing is endowed with color, shape, youthfulness, and so on, some lustful person will call it beautiful and attractive.

original: de nyid la zhe sdang can 'ga' zhig gis mi sdug par brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid la zhe sdang can 'ga' zhig gis mi sdug par brjod de /
translated: Some hateful person will call it ugly.

original: 'di lta ste chung ma gnyis kyi gzugs la /üîΩchung ma dag zhe sdang ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chung ma gnyis kyi gzugs la / chung ma dag zhe sdang ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, with regard to the form of two wives,üîΩthe husbands are attached to their own wives and hate the other.

original: gang kho na la khyo shin tu chags pa de nyid la chung ma dag zhe sdang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang kho na la khyo shin tu chags pa de nyid la chung ma dag zhe sdang bar 'gyur la /
translated: The husbands are attached to their own wives, but they hate the other wives.

original: de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas de la 'ga' zhig rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pas de la 'ga' zhig rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the nature of the wives is not fully understood, some become confused about them.

original: dngos po gcig nyid skad cig la phan tshun du 'gal ba'i don de dag mi srid do //
analyzed: dngos po gcig nyid skad cig la phan tshun du 'gal ba'i don de dag mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for a single thing to have mutually exclusive meanings at the same time.

original: des na dngos po gcig la rang bzhin gsum mi srid la /
analyzed: des na dngos po gcig la rang bzhin gsum mi srid la /
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for a single thing to have three natures.

original: rnam par rtog pas de'i phan tshun tha dad par rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas de'i phan tshun tha dad par rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable for conceptualization to be different from it.

original: yang na 'di sum du sems na /
analyzed: yang na 'di sum du sems na /
translated: Or, if you think of it in three ways,

original: gal te @329a * //
analyzed: gal te @329a * //
translated: then,

original: yang dngos po rnam pa gsum gcig nyid du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang dngos po rnam pa gsum gcig nyid du mi 'gyur la /
translated: even though the three things are not one,

original: de lta na yang de'i rnam par rtog pa re zhig yod la /
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i rnam par rtog pa re zhig yod la /
translated: still, the conceptualization of them is.

original: des na de yod pas de las skyes pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na de yod pas de las skyes pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it exists, the desire, etc. that arise from it will also occur.

original: smras pa / rnam rtog de yang de kho na nyid du ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam rtog de yang de kho na nyid du ma yin te /
translated: We reply: That conceptualization also does not exist in reality,

original: log pa'i rnam par bskyed pa rnams la bden pa'i rang bzhin mi srid pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir yang rnam par rtog pa yang de kho na nyid du med do //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par bskyed pa rnams la bden pa'i rang bzhin mi srid pa dang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir yang rnam par rtog pa yang de kho na nyid du med do //
translated: because it is generated in a mistaken way, it is impossible for it to have a real nature, and because it is dependently arisen, conceptualization also does not exist in reality.

original: de med na de las skyes pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yang med do zhes grub bo /
analyzed: de med na de las skyes pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa yang med do zhes grub bo /
translated: If it does not exist, then the desire, etc. that arise from it also do not exist.üîΩThus it is established.

original: // /'di ltar yang rnam par rtog pa de kho na nyid du med pa ste /
analyzed: // /'di ltar yang rnam par rtog pa de kho na nyid du med pa ste /
translated: In this way, that conceptualization does not exist in reality.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: rtog bya med na rnam rtog gang //
analyzed: rtog bya med na rnam rtog gang //
translated: If there is no object of conceptualization, what is the conceptualization?

original: de med rnam rtog ga la zhig / de phyir rtog bya rkyen skye phyir //
analyzed: de med rnam rtog ga la zhig / de phyir rtog bya rkyen skye phyir //
translated: Since it does not exist, how can there be conceptualization?üîΩTherefore, since the object of conceptualization arises dependently, it is empty.

original: stong yin rnam par rtog pa yang //
analyzed: stong yin rnam par rtog pa yang //
translated: Conceptualization also is empty.

original: gal te rnam par rtog par bya ba'i dngos po cung zad yod na de la rtog par byed pa rnam par rtog pa skye la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog par bya ba'i dngos po cung zad yod na de la rtog par byed pa rnam par rtog pa skye la /
translated: If there were some existent thing that is the object of conceptualization, then the conceptualization that conceptualizes it would arise.

original: de yang dngos po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
analyzed: de yang dngos po rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyis stong la /
translated: Moreover, since that thing arises dependently, it is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: des na de la rnam par rtog bya med na rnam rtog med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na de la rnam par rtog bya med na rnam rtog med do zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, if there is no object of conceptualization, there is no conceptualization.

original: stong yin rnam par rtog pa yang //
analyzed: stong yin rnam par rtog pa yang //
translated: Conceptualization also is empty.

original: gal te rnam par rtog par bya ba'i rang bzhin stong pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog par bya ba'i rang bzhin stong pa'o //
translated: If the nature of the object of conceptualization is empty,

original: de las dngos po gang yang rung ba'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: de las dngos po gang yang rung ba'i rang bzhin mi dmigs pas /
translated: then since the nature of any existent thing whatsoever is not perceived,

original: rnam par rtog bya dang rtog pa dag tu yongs su mi rtog pa'i phyir de kho na nyid rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog bya dang rtog pa dag tu yongs su mi rtog pa'i phyir de kho na nyid rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: one does not conceive of an object of conceptualization and a conceptualizer. Therefore, one realizes reality.

original: de las kyang de nyid rtog pas phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba'i ma rig med /
analyzed: de las kyang de nyid rtog pas phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba'i ma rig med /
translated: Moreover, ignorance that arises from the four misconceptions about reality does not exist.

original: de med 'du byed 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: de med 'du byed 'byung ba ni //
translated: If that does not exist, formation does not arise.

original: srid min de bzhin lhag ma rnams //
analyzed: srid min de bzhin lhag ma rnams //
translated: Likewise, the rest do not exist.

original: de kho na nyid mthong ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mthong ba ni phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: Seeing reality is non-erroneous.

original: de kho na nyid de mthong ba de dang 'gal ba'i phyir phyin ci log rnams nges par spong la /
analyzed: de kho na nyid de mthong ba de dang 'gal ba'i phyir phyin ci log rnams nges par spong la /
translated: Because it is incompatible with seeing reality, misconceptions are definitely abandoned.

original: de spangs pas phyin ci log las byung ba'i ma rig pa spong ngo //
analyzed: de spangs pas phyin ci log las byung ba'i ma rig pa spong ngo //
translated: By abandoning that, ignorance that arises from misconceptions is abandoned.

original: ma rig pa spangs pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ldog la da 'gags pas skye ba'i rkyen gyi rgas pa dang shi ba la sogs pa'i bar du thams cad ldog go //
analyzed: ma rig pa spangs pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ldog la da 'gags pas skye ba'i rkyen gyi rgas pa dang shi ba la sogs pa'i bar du thams cad ldog go //
translated: By abandoning ignorance, formations conditioned by ignorance cease. Since that has ceased, everything up to aging and death conditioned by birth ceases.

original: slar yang ji ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed la sogs pa 'gag ce na /
analyzed: slar yang ji ltar ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed la sogs pa 'gag ce na /
translated: Again, how does the cessation of ignorance cause the cessation of formations and so on?

original: bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: To prove that, it is said:

original: gang la gang rten skye ba'i dngos //
analyzed: gang la gang rten skye ba'i dngos //
translated: The things that arise in dependence on something

original: de de med pas de mi skye //
analyzed: de de med pas de mi skye //
translated: do not arise without that.

original: dngos dang dngos med @329b 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med @329b 'dus ma byas //
translated: Non-entity and entity, non-compounded,

original: 'dus byas zhi bas mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhi bas mya ngan 'das //
translated: And compounded, are pacified, and thus nirvana.

original: gang zhig ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu la brten nas 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'bras bu gang zhig skye /
analyzed: gang zhig ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu la brten nas 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'bras bu gang zhig skye /
translated: What is the effect called ‚Äúembellishment‚Äù that arises in dependence on the cause called ‚Äúignorance‚Äù?

original: 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'bras bu de'i rgyu ma rig pa zhes bya ba med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed ces bya ba'i 'bras bu de'i rgyu ma rig pa zhes bya ba med na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ste /
translated: The effect called ‚Äúembellishment‚Äù does not occur without the cause called ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa med na 'du byed la sogs pa srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa med na 'du byed la sogs pa srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, if ignorance and so on do not exist, embellishment and so on are not possible.

original: gang gi tshe 'di ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med na de'i tshe dngos po med la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di ltar ma rig pa la sogs pa 'jug pa med na de'i tshe dngos po med la /
translated: When ignorance and so on do not operate in this way, then entities do not exist.

original: dngos po med na de yang log pa'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa yang med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med na de yang log pa'i rang bzhin dngos po med pa yang med do zhes bya ste /
translated: If entities do not exist, then nonentities, which are the nature of the negation of entities, do not exist.

original: gang yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med na yang ;
analyzed: gang yang dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag med na yang ;
translated: If entities and nonentities do not exist,

original: dngos po'i tshul gyis 'dus byas dang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis 'dus ma byas med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po'i tshul gyis 'dus byas dang dngos po med pa'i tshul gyis 'dus ma byas med do zhes bya ste /
translated: then compounded phenomena do not exist in the manner of entities, and uncompounded phenomena do not exist in the manner of nonentities.

original: dngos dang dngos med dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag zhi ba'o //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas dag zhi ba'o //
translated: The pacification of entities and non-entities, of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: zhi ba ni mi 'jug pa la /
analyzed: zhi ba ni mi 'jug pa la /
translated: Pacification is non-engagement.

original: de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: That itself is nirvana.

original: slar yang 'dus ma byas kyi tshul mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: slar yang 'dus ma byas kyi tshul mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, nirvana is not the mode of the unconditioned,

original: 'dus ma byas su rtog pa 'jug par thal bas so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su rtog pa 'jug par thal bas so //
translated: because it follows that the conception of the unconditioned would engage.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gang smos pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pas phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba'i ma rig pa mi 'byung ngo zhes pas /
analyzed: gang smos pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pas phyin ci log bzhi las byung ba'i ma rig pa mi 'byung ngo zhes pas /
translated: ‚ÄúSince it is said that by realizing the reality that is mentioned, the ignorance that arises from the four errors does not occur,

original: slar yang ci ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa ni ci zhig gang las de kho na mthong ba na mi 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: slar yang ci ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid dang / dmigs pa ni ci zhig gang las de kho na mthong ba na mi 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: what then is the characteristic of ignorance and what is its object? When reality is seen, what does not occur?‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid dang dmigs pa dag bsgrub par 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang dmigs pa dag bsgrub par 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Desiring to establish the characteristic and the object, he says:üîΩThings that arise from causes

original: rgyu rkyen las skyes dngos po rnams //üîΩdngos por khong du chud pa gang //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen las skyes dngos po rnams // dngos por khong du chud pa gang //
translated: are not established as things

original: ston pas ma rig par gsungs la //
analyzed: ston pas ma rig par gsungs la //
translated: by the Teacher as ignorance.

original: de las yan lag bcu gnyis 'jug / rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes ba la /
analyzed: de las yan lag bcu gnyis 'jug / rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes ba la /
translated: From that, the twelve factors engage.

original: de dag la gang zhig rang bzhin du rtog pa de la ma rig par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
analyzed: de dag la gang zhig rang bzhin du rtog pa de la ma rig par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
translated: The Blessed One taught that the non-production of things that are produced from causes and conditions is ignorance.

original: yang dag pa ji lta bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin med pa ma rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of not understanding the nature of reality,

original: ma rtogs pa las ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa las ma rig pa zhes brjod do //
translated: the non-understanding is called ignorance.

original: de yang rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin la dmigs pas de kho na nyid yongs su ma shes pa'i ngo bo'i phyir mi shes pa'i rang bzhin la /üîΩma rig pa de las 'du byed la @330a * //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin du sgro 'dogs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir dang / rang bzhin la dmigs pas de kho na nyid yongs su ma shes pa'i ngo bo'i phyir mi shes pa'i rang bzhin la / ma rig pa de las 'du byed la @330a * //
translated: Moreover, because it engages in superimposing intrinsic nature, and because it is by nature the non-understanding of reality due to observing intrinsic nature,

original: sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'jug go //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis 'jug go //
translated: from that ignorance, the twelve factors of dependent arising, such as compositional activity, engage.

original: yang 'di'i ma rig pa sgro btags nas 'jug pa ji ltar bzlog par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di'i ma rig pa sgro btags nas 'jug pa ji ltar bzlog par bya zhe na /
translated: How does one stop the engagement of ignorance through superimposition?

original: gsungs pa / dngos po stong par yang dag par //
analyzed: gsungs pa / dngos po stong par yang dag par //
translated: When one knows that things are empty,

original: shes na rmongs pa mi 'jug la //
analyzed: shes na rmongs pa mi 'jug la //
translated: ignorance does not occur.

original: ma rig legs par 'gags pa yis //
analyzed: ma rig legs par 'gags pa yis //
translated: When ignorance is well stopped,üîΩthen the twelve members cease.

original: de nas yan lag bcu gnyis 'gag / gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de nas yan lag bcu gnyis 'gag / gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag par shes pa ste /
translated: One who knows dependent origination well,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba mthong ba de nam yang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin du sgro mi 'dogs la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba mthong ba de nam yang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin du sgro mi 'dogs la /
translated: who sees things as they really are, never superimposes an intrinsic nature on things.

original: gang gi tshe rang bzhin du mi 'dogs pa de'i tshe 'di'i ma rig pa spong la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang bzhin du mi 'dogs pa de'i tshe 'di'i ma rig pa spong la /
translated: When one does not superimpose an intrinsic nature, then his ignorance is eliminated.

original: ma rig pa spangs pas 'du byed kyang mi skye la /
analyzed: ma rig pa spangs pas 'du byed kyang mi skye la /
translated: When ignorance is eliminated, then volitions are not produced.

original: ji srid du skye ba med pas rgas pa dang 'chi ba mi 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid du skye ba med pas rgas pa dang 'chi ba mi 'byung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: As long as there is no production, there is no aging and death.

original: de las dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhi bas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las dngos po dang dngos po med pa dang 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas zhi bas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, through the pacification of things and nonthings, the conditioned and the unconditioned, nirvana is attained.

original: slar yang thar pa 'dod pas ma rig pa spong bar 'dod pa ma rig pa spong bar 'dod pas dngos po 'di dag ji ltar blta bar bya /
analyzed: slar yang thar pa 'dod pas ma rig pa spong bar 'dod pa ma rig pa spong bar 'dod pas dngos po 'di dag ji ltar blta bar bya /
translated: Again, one who desires liberation, desiring to abandon ignorance, should view these things in what way, desiring to abandon ignorance?

original: smras pa / thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid la blta bar bya la /
analyzed: smras pa / thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis de kho na nyid la blta bar bya la /
translated: Objection: Those who desire liberation should view reality.

original: de kho na nyid kyang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin la ;
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin la ;
translated: And reality is the intrinsic reality of things.

original: de yang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: And that is unarisen.

original: des na thar pa 'dod pas 'di dag la dngos por blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na thar pa 'dod pas 'di dag la dngos por blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who desires liberation should not view these things as real.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'o na de ltar na 'di ltar dngos po thams cad ma mthong ngo zhes mi nus te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar na 'di ltar dngos po thams cad ma mthong ngo zhes mi nus te /
translated: In that case, it is not possible to say, ‚ÄúIn this way, I do not see any thing.‚Äù

original: mig ma nyams shing mig bye ba dang yul phun sum tshogs pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa mi mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mig ma nyams shing mig bye ba dang yul phun sum tshogs pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa mi mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: It is not possible that one with unimpaired eyes who opens his eyes does not see such things as blue that are endowed with the object and endowed with appearance.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang pos kyang rang gi yul ji lta bar mi 'dzin par mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang pos kyang rang gi yul ji lta bar mi 'dzin par mi nus so //
translated: In the same way, it is not possible that the sense faculties such as the ear do not apprehend their objects as they are.

original: smras pa / gal te yang dbang po la ltos nas sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum la /
analyzed: smras pa / gal te yang dbang po la ltos nas sngon po la sogs pa mngon sum la /
translated: Objection: Even if blue and so on are direct perception in dependence on the sense faculties,

original: de lta na yang rig pas nye bar dpyad pa las skyes pa'i blo'i mngon sum gang zhig de nyid 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i mngon sum pas glengs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rig pas nye bar dpyad pa las skyes pa'i blo'i mngon sum gang zhig de nyid 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i mngon sum pas glengs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: still, the direct perception of the mind that arises from the investigation of reasoning is not direct perception of the sense faculties that apprehend that.

original: 'di ltar rab rib can la mi bden pa'i skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pa mngon sum du so sor snang la /üîΩde dag kyang rigs pa dang @330b bcas pa'i blo'i mngon sum du med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab rib can la mi bden pa'i skra dang sbrang bu la sogs pa mngon sum du so sor snang la / de dag kyang rigs pa dang @330b bcas pa'i blo'i mngon sum du med la /
translated: In this way, the false hairs, flies, and so on directly appear to those with eye disease.üîΩThey do not exist as the direct perception of the mind that is in accordance with reasoning.

original: de ni blo'i dbang po'i mngon sum du yang de dag gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni blo'i dbang po'i mngon sum du yang de dag gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: They also do not exist as the direct perception of the mind‚Äôs sense faculty,

original: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i blos yang dag pa'i mngon sum nyid du mngon par rlom pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i blos yang dag pa'i mngon sum nyid du mngon par rlom pa gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind that follows reasoning clearly infers that they are not real direct perception.

original: gal te de lta na yang dngos po de dag phyin ci log gi las las byung bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don yongs su gcod pa dbang po dang yul gyi gnas par yod pas mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang dngos po de dag phyin ci log gi las las byung bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don yongs su gcod pa dbang po dang yul gyi gnas par yod pas mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, those things are not real, because they arise from distorted karma. They are apprehended as existing in the domain of sense faculties and objects, and so they are direct perception.

original: de lta na yang rigs pas nye bar dpyod pa la zhugs pa'i blos de dag gi blos mngon sum nyid ldog ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang rigs pas nye bar dpyod pa la zhugs pa'i blos de dag gi blos mngon sum nyid ldog ste /
translated: Even so, the mind that engages in rational analysis turns away from their direct perception.

original: de ni stobs can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni stobs can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ste /
translated: Because that mind is powerful.

original: des na dngos po rnams su mngon par zhen nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / de kho na 'jug pa'i sgo'i phyir dpe'i phreng ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na dngos po rnams su mngon par zhen nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / de kho na 'jug pa'i sgo'i phyir dpe'i phreng ba gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, because things are apprehended through attachment to things, and because they are the gateway to engaging reality, a garland of similes is taught:üîΩGandharva cities, illusions, mirages, foam, bubbles,

original: dri za'i grong khyer sgyu ma dang // smig rgyu dbu ba chu bur dang // gzugs brnyan sprul pa rmi lam dang // mgal me dang mtshungs 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer sgyu ma dang // smig rgyu dbu ba chu bur dang // gzugs brnyan sprul pa rmi lam dang // mgal me dang mtshungs 'du byed rnams //
translated: reflections, emanations, dreams, and fire wheels.

original: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is like a gandharva city, and so on.

original: 'di dag nyid rang gi rgyu dang rkyen ji lta ba las 'byung na yang /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid rang gi rgyu dang rkyen ji lta ba las 'byung na yang /
translated: Although these things arise from their own causes and conditions,

original: grong khyer la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa grong khyer la sogs pa nyid du snang la /üîΩde bzhin du 'di ltar gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po yang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid snang ba la /
analyzed: grong khyer la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa grong khyer la sogs pa nyid du snang la / de bzhin du 'di ltar gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po yang gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid snang ba la /
translated: they appear as cities, etc., empty of the nature of cities, etc.

original: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that things such as form and feeling appear as emptiness of the nature of form and feeling, etc.

original: yang dpe gcig nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yang dpe gcig nyid kyi rang bzhin med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: If one understands the absence of intrinsic reality of one example,

original: dpe mang po nyid nye bar bsdus pa la don med do zhe na /
analyzed: dpe mang po nyid nye bar bsdus pa la don med do zhe na /
translated: what is the point of citing many examples?

original: 'di dag de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag de ltar ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: rang bzhin med pa'i don la 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas ma goms pa'i 'jig rten pa de dag dpe du mas 'jig rten pa'i sems la phebs pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i don la 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas ma goms pa'i 'jig rten pa de dag dpe du mas 'jig rten pa'i sems la phebs pas /
translated: because worldly people, who have not been accustomed to the meaning of intrinsic realitylessness from beginningless cyclic existence, understand reality by means of many examples, and thus their minds are led to reality.

original: de kho na nyid la nges pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la nges pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They thereby generate certainty in reality.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: re zhig phung po mi gtsang ba /
analyzed: re zhig phung po mi gtsang ba /
translated: The aggregates are impure,

original: rags pa mngon sum spyod yul te //
analyzed: rags pa mngon sum spyod yul te //
translated: gross, and the domain of direct perception.

original: rtag tu mthong bar gyur na yang //
analyzed: rtag tu mthong bar gyur na yang //
translated: Even though they are always seen,

original: gang tshe sems ni mi gnas pa //
analyzed: gang tshe sems ni mi gnas pa //
translated: when the mind does not abide in them,

original: de tshe shin tu phra zhing zab //
analyzed: de tshe shin tu phra zhing zab //
translated: then they are very subtle and profound.

original: dam chos 'di ni gnas med pa //üîΩmngon sum min pa ji ltar du //
analyzed: dam chos 'di ni gnas med pa // mngon sum min pa ji ltar du //
translated: This holy Dharma is without abode,üîΩand is not direct perception.

original: sems la bde blag rtogs par 'gyur //üîΩzhes @331a * //
analyzed: sems la bde blag rtogs par 'gyur // zhes @331a * //
translated: How can it be easily understood in the mind?

original: so ; / de'i sems la bde blag tu 'jug pa'i phyir dpe mang po bstan pa ni rigs pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so ; / de'i sems la bde blag tu 'jug pa'i phyir dpe mang po bstan pa ni rigs pa nyid do zhes bya'o //
translated: It is reasonable to teach many examples in order to easily introduce the mind to that.

original: gzhan yang dpe mang po nye bar bkod pas 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig la shin tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dpe mang po nye bar bkod pas 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig la shin tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ste /
translated: Moreover, by setting forth many examples, one will be certain about something through another.

original: de la dpe des de'i don bde blag tu bdag nyid kyis khong du chud pas des na dpe mang po nye bar bsdu ba rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la dpe des de'i don bde blag tu bdag nyid kyis khong du chud pas des na dpe mang po nye bar bsdu ba rigs pa nyid do //
translated: In that regard, it is reasonable to collect many examples because one easily understands that meaning by oneself through those examples.

original: yang na dngos por 'dzin pa tha dad pas dpe tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dngos por 'dzin pa tha dad pas dpe tha dad pa'o //
translated: Or, the examples are different because the apprehensions of entities are different.

original: yul dang dus nges par 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: yul dang dus nges par 'dzin pa la /
translated: In apprehending the definite object and time,

original: med pa la yul dang dus nges par 'dzin pa mi rung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa la yul dang dus nges par 'dzin pa mi rung zhes bya ste /
translated: It is not possible to apprehend a nonexistent thing as being limited in terms of place and time.

original: de la ltos nas dri za'i grong khyer dper brjod do //
analyzed: de la ltos nas dri za'i grong khyer dper brjod do //
translated: In this regard, the city of gandharvas is given as an example.

original: gzhan dbang du 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dbang du 'dzin pa la /
translated: As for apprehending something as being dependent on something else,

original: med pa la rgyu gzhan gyi dbang las ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa la rgyu gzhan gyi dbang las ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: it is not possible for a nonexistent thing to be dependent on something else.

original: de la ltos nas sgyu ma dper brjod do //
analyzed: de la ltos nas sgyu ma dper brjod do //
translated: In this regard, an illusion is given as an example.

original: ldog par 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: ldog par 'dzin pa la /
translated: As for apprehending something as being reversible,

original: med pa ldog pa med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa ldog pa med do zhes bya ste /
translated: it is not possible for a nonexistent thing to be reversible.

original: de la ltos nas smig rgyu dper brjod do //
analyzed: de la ltos nas smig rgyu dper brjod do //
translated: In this regard, a mirage is given as an example.

original: de yang bye brag med par ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bye brag med par ldog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, this is a reversal without distinction.

original: snying po med par 'dzin pa la //
analyzed: snying po med par 'dzin pa la //
translated: As for apprehending something as being without essence,

original: snying po med pas de med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: snying po med pas de med do zhes bya ste /
translated: it is not possible for something without essence to be nonexistent.

original: de la ltos nas dbu ba dper brjod do //
analyzed: de la ltos nas dbu ba dper brjod do //
translated: In this regard, foam is given as an example.

original: gzhan dang gzhan du 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du 'dzin pa la /
translated: As for apprehending something as being one thing after another,

original: med pa la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: it is not possible for a nonexistent thing to be one thing after another.

original: de la ltos nas chu'i chu bur dper brjod do //
analyzed: de la ltos nas chu'i chu bur dper brjod do //
translated: In this regard, a water bubble is given as an example.

original: kun nas snang bar 'dzin pa la //
analyzed: kun nas snang bar 'dzin pa la //
translated: As for apprehending something as being all-pervading,

original: med pa la kun nas snang ba med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa la kun nas snang ba med do zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said that what does not exist does not appear at all.

original: de la ltos nas sprul pa dper brjod de //
analyzed: de la ltos nas sprul pa dper brjod de //
translated: In this regard, an emanation is given as an example.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs par 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs par 'dzin pa la /
translated: In the apprehension of various aspects,

original: med pa la rnam pa sna tshogs pa med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa la rnam pa sna tshogs pa med do zhes bya ste /
translated: it is said that what does not exist does not have various aspects.

original: de la ltos nas rmi lam dper brjod do //
analyzed: de la ltos nas rmi lam dper brjod do //
translated: In this regard, a dream is given as an example.

original: 'jug par 'dzin pa la /
analyzed: 'jug par 'dzin pa la /
translated: In the apprehension of engagement,

original: med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa la 'jug pa la mi ltos so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: med pa'i myu gu la sogs pa la 'jug pa la mi ltos so zhes bya ste /
translated: it is said that what does not exist does not depend on the engagement of a sprout, etc.

original: de la ltos nas mgal ma'i 'khor lo dper brjod do /
analyzed: de la ltos nas mgal ma'i 'khor lo dper brjod do /
translated: In this regard, a firebrand wheel is given as an example.

original: de'i 'jug pa'i sa bon mgal ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'jug pa'i sa bon mgal ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Because its engagement does not depend on a firebrand as a seed.

original: de ltar de dag 'das ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa bzhis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji lta bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar de dag 'das ma thag pa'i tshigs su bcad pa drug cu rtsa bzhis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ji lta bar gnas pa'i rang bzhin bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, immediately after these, the sixty-four verses establish the nature of reality as it is in dependent origination.

original: de las gzhan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis don 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma @331b log par bshad pas /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis don 'di nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba phyin ci ma @331b log par bshad pas /
translated: In the two verses following this, the TathƒÅgata explains dependent origination correctly.

original: des na shin tu yang de dang 'brel par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: des na shin tu yang de dang 'brel par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be established as being very much related to that.

original: de ltar gyur na legs par nyan pa rnams don 'di la shin tu nges pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na legs par nyan pa rnams don 'di la shin tu nges pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is the case, those who listen well will generate certainty in this meaning.

original: dngos kun rang bzhin stong pas na //
analyzed: dngos kun rang bzhin stong pas na //
translated: Since all things are empty of essence,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di //
translated: This dependent origination

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs med kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshungs med kyis //
translated: Was taught by the unequaled TathƒÅgata

original: dngos po rnams ni nye bar bstan //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni nye bar bstan //
translated: As the reality of things.

original: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub bo zhes nye bar bstan pa'i don du 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa dang 'dra bar 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid kyis ma grub bo zhes nye bar bstan pa'i don du 'di dag ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes gsungs so /
translated: In order to teach that compounded phenomena are like a city of gandharvas and so on in being essentially non-existent, he said, ‚ÄúThese are dependently originated.‚Äù

original: mtshungs med kyis zhes pa /
analyzed: mtshungs med kyis zhes pa /
translated: ‚ÄúUnequaled‚Äù means

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu brtsams nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'dra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu brtsams nas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan na yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'dra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If one begins with one world-realms, there is no Tathagata in another world-realm who is like the Tathagata.

original: yang na sh'akya thub pa goo ta ma'o zhes smra na brtsad pa 'di dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na sh'akya thub pa goo ta ma'o zhes smra na brtsad pa 'di dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: Or if one says, ‚ÄúGautama, the Sakyan,‚Äù these disputes arise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra 'di ni yang dag pa ji lta bar ston pa'i yon tan la brten nas 'jug la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra 'di ni yang dag pa ji lta bar ston pa'i yon tan la brten nas 'jug la /
translated: This word ‚ÄúTathagata‚Äù is used in dependence upon the quality of teaching the truth just as it is.

original: de yang sangs rgyas thams cad la thun mong du grub bo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas thams cad la thun mong du grub bo zhes bya ste /
translated: And that is established in common for all Buddhas.
