original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mtshungs med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni mtshungs med ces bya'o //
translated: All Tathagatas are said to be ‚Äúwithout compare.‚Äù

original: lhag ma bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhag ma bshad zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained.

original: de ni dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin med pa'i don dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ni dam pa nyid du nye bar mtshon par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni dri za'i grong khyer la sogs pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin med pa'i don dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don ni dam pa nyid du nye bar mtshon par gsungs pa /
translated: This is said to illustrate the meaning of the absence of intrinsic nature of these cities of gandharvas, etc., and the meaning of dependent origination as the highest truth:

original: 'di tsam re zhig don dam ste //
analyzed: 'di tsam re zhig don dam ste //
translated: This much is the ultimate.

original: zhes pa la dngos por rtog pa thams cad ji lta ba'i don ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa la dngos por rtog pa thams cad ji lta ba'i don ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since all conceptualizations of entities are not the way things are,

original: 'di ni re zhig ces pa nges par gzung ba ste ;
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig ces pa nges par gzung ba ste ;
translated: this is a specification, ‚Äúat this point.‚Äù

original: nye bar bsgrubs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: nye bar bsgrubs pa'i chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: All phenomena that are established are devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: stong pa nyid de la ji srid du dngos por mngon par zhen pa thams cad 'dir phyin ci log pas 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de la ji srid du dngos por mngon par zhen pa thams cad 'dir phyin ci log pas 'khrul pa ste /
translated: As for emptiness, as long as all conceptualizations of entities are mistaken here, they are deluded.

original: 'khrul pa yang don dam pa yin par ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang don dam pa yin par ni mi rigs so //
translated: And it is not tenable that delusion is ultimate.

original: 'di nyid yod pa dang med pas ma bsdus pas skyon gyis rnam par dpen pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid yod pa dang med pas ma bsdus pas skyon gyis rnam par dpen pa /
translated: Since this is not subsumed by existence and nonexistence, it is free from faults.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa las dbu ma khong du chud pa ni don dam pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsungs pa las dbu ma khong du chud pa ni don dam pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The understanding of the middle way from the statement of dependent origination is the ultimate itself.

original: 'di tsam re zhig don dam ste //
analyzed: 'di tsam re zhig don dam ste //
translated: This much is the ultimate at this point.

original: 'jig rten tha snyad la brten nas //
analyzed: 'jig rten tha snyad la brten nas //
translated: In dependence on worldly conventions,

original: sna tshogs thams cad bcom ldan 'das//
analyzed: sna tshogs thams cad bcom ldan 'das//
translated: the BhagavƒÅn

original: @332a * // sangs rgyas bden par gdags pa mdzad //
analyzed: @332a * // sangs rgyas bden par gdags pa mdzad //
translated: designated the Buddha as true.

original: ces pa la ji ltar rmi lam mthong ba 'ga' zhig gi rmi lam rmis pa'i sems 'ga' zhig rnam par shes nas de ni bden par smra'o zhes brjod cing /
analyzed: ces pa la ji ltar rmi lam mthong ba 'ga' zhig gi rmi lam rmis pa'i sems 'ga' zhig rnam par shes nas de ni bden par smra'o zhes brjod cing /
translated: In the same way, some people, having seen some mind that is a dream, say, ‚ÄúI saw a dream,‚Äù and they say, ‚ÄúThat is true.‚Äù

original: de ring rmi lam du mas mgo la'o byas shing phas so sor bsngags pa brjod /
analyzed: de ring rmi lam du mas mgo la'o byas shing phas so sor bsngags pa brjod /
translated: Today in a dream, many people kissed my head and praised me.

original: skyed mos tshal btsongs nas stong phrag gcig bram ze la byin pa dang / bskor ba byed pa mthong zhes so //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal btsongs nas stong phrag gcig bram ze la byin pa dang / bskor ba byed pa mthong zhes so //
translated: I saw a park being sold and given to a brahmin for a thousand coins, and I saw them circumambulate it.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis byin pas mngon par zhen pa ltar skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad dang dngos po thams cad med par tha snyad kyis gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das kyis byin pas mngon par zhen pa ltar skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad dang dngos po thams cad med par tha snyad kyis gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the Blessed One would say conventionally that all things do not exist, dividing them into different categories such as arising, enduring, and disintegrating, as if they were given by a benefactor.

original: de la rmi lam du mthong ba'i ma la sogs pa nyid la bden par mngon par 'dod pa de'i ngo bo rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rmi lam du mthong ba'i ma la sogs pa nyid la bden par mngon par 'dod pa de'i ngo bo rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not rational to assert that the mother and so on that one sees in a dream are real.

original: de bzhin du byis pa phyin ci log pa rnams kyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa mngon par brjod kyi sangs rgyas rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du byis pa phyin ci log pa rnams kyis skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa mngon par brjod kyi sangs rgyas rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, childish beings who are mistaken superimpose origination, endurance, and destruction, but not the buddhas.

original: lhag ma bshad zin to //
analyzed: lhag ma bshad zin to //
translated: The rest has been explained.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa la gnas pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn Buddha abides in the absence of intrinsic existence of all phenomena, which is similar to nirvana.üîΩHow could there be conceptual elaborations?

original: spros pa ga la zhig / ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: spros pa ga la zhig / ji skad du mdo las /
translated: As a s≈´tra says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo reg pa'i skye mched drug po zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nub par gyur pa 'di las gzhan pa'i spros pas spros par byed pa yod dam zhes pa dang /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo reg pa'i skye mched drug po zad pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gags pa dang / nye bar zhi ba dang / nub par gyur pa 'di las gzhan pa'i spros pas spros par byed pa yod dam zhes pa dang /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ƒÄnanda, is there any conceptual elaboration apart from the cessation, fading away, and ending of the six sense bases, their abandonment, their cessation, their pacification, and their disappearance?‚Äù

original: yod pa dang med pa zhes pa'i spros pas spros par byed dam zhes pa nas /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa zhes pa'i spros pas spros par byed dam zhes pa nas /
translated: ‚ÄúIs there any conceptual elaboration apart from the conceptual elaborations of existence and nonexistence?‚Äù

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo skye mched drug ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo skye mched drug ni spros pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable ƒÄnanda, the six sense bases are conceptual elaborations.‚Äù

original: skye mched drug 'gag pa las spros pa med pa'o zhes pa'i bar du mya ngan las 'das pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gag pa las spros pa med pa'o zhes pa'i bar du mya ngan las 'das pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: up to the cessation of the six sense-spheres is the nirvana taught by the Lord.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis na don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis na don dam pa'o //
translated: By the power of the Tathagata's intuition, it is the ultimate.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis kyang kun rdzob bo zhes gnas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i dbang gis kyang kun rdzob bo zhes gnas so //
translated: By the power of mundane knowledge, it is the conventional.

original: de nyid kyis na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na /
translated: Thus,

original: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma for the world does not fail,

original: yang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan med //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan med //
translated: And yet the Dharma is never taught in reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma rig pas //üîΩ@332b des na dri med brjod pa 'di la skrag / des na skrag ces pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma rig pas // @332b des na dri med brjod pa 'di la skrag / des na skrag ces pa la /
translated: The Tathagata's teaching is misunderstood by the ignorant,üîΩAnd so they fear this stainless teaching.

original: des na'i sgra ni ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pa dang lung gis dpyad pa rnams te /
analyzed: des na'i sgra ni ji skad du smos pa'i rigs pa dang lung gis dpyad pa rnams te /
translated: The word thus in thus they fear refers to the reasonings and scriptural passages mentioned above.

original: 'jig rten pa'i thog mar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i thog mar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The mundane should be understood as the first.

original: des na 'jig rten pa'i zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pa'i zhes bya ste /
translated: Thus it is called mundane.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa sdebs pa'i ngor 'jug pas rim pa 'chol bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa sdebs pa'i ngor 'jug pas rim pa 'chol bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the order of the verses is confused because of the requirements of meter.

original: des na 'di'i don kyang gang gi phyir ji skad du smos pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad par /
analyzed: des na 'di'i don kyang gang gi phyir ji skad du smos pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad par /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this is as follows: Because of the dependent origination that was explained,

original: brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can tsam byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul /
analyzed: brdzun pa slu ba'i chos can tsam byis pa'i skye bo'i blo'i spyod yul /
translated: the mere false and deceptive phenomena are the domain of activity of the minds of childish beings.

original: rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa can de'i rang bzhin gyi las kyi 'bras bu kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par byang ba 'ching ba dang grol ba'i rgyu mtshan 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du yod pa nyid du 'dod
analyzed: rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang dri za'i grong khyer gyi rnam pa can de'i rang bzhin gyi las kyi 'bras bu kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang rnam par byang ba 'ching ba dang grol ba'i rgyu mtshan 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad du yod pa nyid du 'dod
translated: The results of the actions of the nature of that, which are afflicted and pure, are the reasons for bondage and liberation. Because of existing in the conventions of the world,

original: pa des na de'i phyir /
analyzed: pa des na de'i phyir /
translated: therefore,

original: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing /üîΩtha snyad pa nyid la ji lta ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnas pa phyin ci ma log par 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams kyi de kho na nyid brjod la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing / tha snyad pa nyid la ji lta ba'i don yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnas pa phyin ci ma log par 'jig rten pa'i dngos po rnams kyi de kho na nyid brjod la /
translated: the teaching of worldly phenomena does not degenerate.üîΩBecause it is the meaning of just the conventional, it is the unmistaken reality of worldly things as they are.

original: de nyid brjod bya las rim gyis de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir yang /
analyzed: de nyid brjod bya las rim gyis de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i rgyu'i phyir yang /
translated: Because it is the cause for gradually engaging in reality by means of the expressed meaning,

original: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing ngo //
translated: The teaching of mundane dharmas is not impaired, and is appropriate.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan pa yang dngos po gang cung zad kyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pas /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan pa yang dngos po gang cung zad kyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pas /
translated: The teaching of mundane dharmas is not impaired, because, since the nature of any entity whatsoever is not accepted,

original: ston pa dang bstan bya dang ston pa po rnams rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ston pa dang bstan bya dang ston pa po rnams rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: the teacher, the teaching, and the taught are not established by intrinsic nature.

original: yang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan med //
analyzed: yang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan med //
translated: In reality, there is never any teaching of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'ga' zhig yang dag par dmigs nas nye bar ston par mi 'gyur la ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos 'ga' zhig yang dag par dmigs nas nye bar ston par mi 'gyur la ;
translated: The Tathagata does not teach by apprehending any dharma whatsoever as real,

original: des na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su mi rtog pas 'di ni bden no zhes par mngon par zhen pa yongs su btang nas gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa nges par mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su mi rtog pas 'di ni bden no zhes par mngon par zhen pa yongs su btang nas gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa nges par mya ngan las 'das pa la gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and therefore, since the nature of all dharmas is not imagined, the yogi who abides, having given up the notion that this is true, will certainly be inclined toward nirvana.

original: de ltar na 'di ni bden pa gnyis la brten nas las yod pa'i phyir dang rtog pa med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa yang cung zad kyang mi nyams la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni bden pa gnyis la brten nas las yod pa'i phyir dang rtog pa med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa grub pa yang cung zad kyang mi nyams la /
translated: Thus, because of the existence of karma and because of the absence of conceptual thought, the yogis‚Äô nirvana is not impaired in the least, and

original: grol ba yang bde blag kho nar myur du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grol ba yang bde blag kho nar myur du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: liberation is produced quickly and easily.

original: gal te yang rang bzhin med pa la phyin ci log pa rnams kyis de yongs su ma shes pas @333a * //
analyzed: gal te yang rang bzhin med pa la phyin ci log pa rnams kyis de yongs su ma shes pas @333a * //
translated: If, on the other hand, those who are mistaken do not understand the absence of intrinsic reality,

original: rang bzhin med pa la dngos po'i rgyu mtshan gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su 'jug la /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa la dngos po'i rgyu mtshan gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su 'jug la /
translated: they will engage in the side of affliction because of the signs of things that lack intrinsic reality.

original: phyin ci ma log pa rnams rang bzhin med pa mthong ba las kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs las log nas rnam par byang ba yang bskyed do //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa rnams rang bzhin med pa mthong ba las kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs las log nas rnam par byang ba yang bskyed do //
translated: Those who are unmistaken, on the other hand, will turn away from the side of affliction by seeing the absence of intrinsic reality and will produce complete purification.

original: de ni ci slar yang 'dir brjod pa la de skrag pas 'jig rten pa rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la brten /
analyzed: de ni ci slar yang 'dir brjod pa la de skrag pas 'jig rten pa rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la brten /
translated: Why is it that some are afraid of this and rely on the worldly who speak of intrinsic reality?

original: skyon dang ldan par brjod pa ni spang bar rigs la /
analyzed: skyon dang ldan par brjod pa ni spang bar rigs la /
translated: It is proper to abandon what is said to be faulty.

original: brjod pa 'di ni skyon dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa 'di ni skyon dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: But this statement is not faulty.

original: yon tan dang ldan na yang brjod pa la brten par rigs na /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan na yang brjod pa la brten par rigs na /
translated: If it is proper to rely on a statement that has good qualities,

original: rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba ni yon tan dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: then it is said that one who speaks with intrinsic reality does not have good qualities.

original: de la 'jig rten pa 'di dag rang bzhin smra ba spangs nas rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa 'di dag rang bzhin smra ba spangs nas rang bzhin dang bcas par smra ba la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it that worldly people, having abandoned the proponents of intrinsic reality, rely on those who speak with intrinsic reality?

original: smras pa / dngos po ji ltar smras pa rnams mi srid pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: smras pa / dngos po ji ltar smras pa rnams mi srid pa nyid kyis /
translated: We say: Because things are impossible just as they are said to be,

original: ji skad smos pa'i brjod pa spangs nas gnas pas 'jig rten pa dngos po'i lta ba la mi gnas shing phyin ci log ji lta bar gnas so //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i brjod pa spangs nas gnas pas 'jig rten pa dngos po'i lta ba la mi gnas shing phyin ci log ji lta bar gnas so //
translated: having abandoned the statements as they are said, worldly people abide. Therefore, worldly people do not abide in the view of things and abide in error just as it is.

original: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa nyi ma'i gsung gi 'od zer gsal bar snang bas na 'jig rten pa rnams kyi phyin ci log par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'o na de bzhin gshegs pa nyi ma'i gsung gi 'od zer gsal bar snang bas na 'jig rten pa rnams kyi phyin ci log par mi rigs so //
translated: Well, since the light rays of the sun of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs speech shine brightly, it is not tenable that worldly people abide in error.

original: bden te gal te 'jig rten pa la shes rab kyi mig yod na rigs kyi ma rig pas ldongs pa'i 'jig rten pas ji lta ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las khong du chud par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: bden te gal te 'jig rten pa la shes rab kyi mig yod na rigs kyi ma rig pas ldongs pa'i 'jig rten pas ji lta ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung las khong du chud par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: True, but if the worldly person had the eye of wisdom, how could the worldly person, blinded by the ignorance of his class, understand the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs teaching of the way things really are?

original: de ma rtogs pas gdon mi za bar 'jigs pa ma yin pa'i gnas la skrag par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ma rtogs pas gdon mi za bar 'jigs pa ma yin pa'i gnas la skrag par 'gyur ro zhes bsgrub pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to prove that, without understanding that, the worldly person would certainly be afraid of what is not a source of fear, it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma rig pas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma rig pas //
translated: The TathƒÅgata‚Äôs teaching is obscured by ignorance.

original: des na dri med brjod pa 'di la skrag / ces pa la /üîΩji ltar bud shing la brten nas me 'byung la /
analyzed: des na dri med brjod pa 'di la skrag / ces pa la / ji ltar bud shing la brten nas me 'byung la /
translated: Therefore, they are afraid of this stainless teaching.

original: sprin la brten nas char pa'o zhes pa ni 'dir rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: sprin la brten nas char pa'o zhes pa ni 'dir rgyu'i don to //
translated: Here, ‚Äújust as fire arises in dependence on fuel, and rain falls in dependence on clouds,‚Äù the meaning of ‚Äúin dependence on‚Äù is the meaning of cause.

original: de bzhin du gsungs pa ma rig pas shes pa 'dir yang kta'i rkyen gyis rgyu'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs pa ma rig pas shes pa 'dir yang kta'i rkyen gyis rgyu'i don to //
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúthe teaching is obscured by ignorance‚Äù has the meaning of cause, because the suffix kta has the meaning of cause.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mi mkhas pa'i skye bos de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa mi shes la /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mi mkhas pa'i skye bos de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa mi shes la /
translated: The childish, who are not skilled in the conventional and ultimate truths as they have been explained, do not understand the teachings of the Tathagata.

original: mi shes pas gdod ma nas zhi ba skye ba med pa'i chos bstan pa la nges par @333b skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi shes pas gdod ma nas zhi ba skye ba med pa'i chos bstan pa la nges par @333b skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because they do not understand, they are frightened by the teaching of the Dharma of non-production, of peace from the very beginning.

original: de yang gdod ma nas zhi ba ma skyes pa'i chos bstan pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: de yang gdod ma nas zhi ba ma skyes pa'i chos bstan pa'i rnam par dbye ba mi mthong zhing /
translated: Moreover, they do not see the classification of the teaching of the Dharma of non-production, of peace from the very beginning.

original: ji ltar nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'i bdag dang bdag gi ba'i chos kyi dngos po sems la bzhag nas /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar dmigs bzhin pa'i bdag dang bdag gi ba'i chos kyi dngos po sems la bzhag nas /
translated: And, having established in their minds the things of the Dharma of self and what belongs to a self just as they are perceived,

original: bdag ni med par gyur ta re zhes byis pa dag dri med kyi brjod bya la skrag par 'gyur ro //üîΩbrjod par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ste bshad pa'i don la brjod pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: bdag ni med par gyur ta re zhes byis pa dag dri med kyi brjod bya la skrag par 'gyur ro // brjod par bya ba'i phyir brjod pa ste bshad pa'i don la brjod pa zhes brjod de /
translated: the childish are frightened by the subject matter of the stainless, thinking, ‚ÄúI will be annihilated!‚ÄùüîΩBecause of the subject matter, the expression is called the explanation, because it is taught.

original: bstan bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because it is taught, the expression is called the teaching, because it is taught.

original: brjod pa de yang mtshan ma med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa de yang mtshan ma med pa'i phyir dri ma med pa'o //
translated: And that expression is stainless because it is signless.

original: mi gsal ba mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba mngon sum ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The unclear is not direct perception.üîΩNow, in this verse:

original: 'o na dri med brjod bya 'di la skrag / ces pa 'dir /
analyzed: 'o na dri med brjod bya 'di la skrag / ces pa 'dir /
translated: ‚ÄúBeings are frightened of this stainless topic.üîΩ‚Äù

original: 'jigs pa'i rgyu ni 'byung khungs so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rgyu ni 'byung khungs so //
translated: The cause of fear is the source.

original: zhes pas 'dir 'byung khungs la brten nas lnga par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pas 'dir 'byung khungs la brten nas lnga par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the fifth case is based on the source.

original: ma yin te kta'i rkyen gyis rgyu'i don gsungs pas she na /
analyzed: ma yin te kta'i rkyen gyis rgyu'i don gsungs pas she na /
translated: If it is said that it is not so because the instrumental case expresses the meaning of cause,

original: ma yin te don gzhan yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te don gzhan yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is not so because it has a different meaning.

original: dri ma med pa'i brjod bya nyid la srog chags rnams skrag pas so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i brjod bya nyid la srog chags rnams skrag pas so //
translated: Because beings are frightened of the stainless topic itself.

original: brjod bya ci'i phyir na rgyur 'gyur /
analyzed: brjod bya ci'i phyir na rgyur 'gyur /
translated: Why is the topic a cause?

original: de las skrag pas so //
analyzed: de las skrag pas so //
translated: Because of fear of it.

original: de la 'jigs pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pa'i rgyu ci zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of fear in that?

original: ma rtogs pa rgyur kta'i rkyen gyis brjod la /
analyzed: ma rtogs pa rgyur kta'i rkyen gyis brjod la /
translated: Non-realization is expressed as the cause by the instrumental case.

original: de'i phyir 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma rtogs pa rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma rtogs pa rgyu mtshan no //
translated: Therefore, the very cause of fear is non-realization as the reason.

original: dri ma med pa'i brjod bya 'jigs pa'i rgyu'o zhes pas yang /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i brjod bya 'jigs pa'i rgyu'o zhes pas yang /
translated: Since the stainless topic is the cause of fear,

original: gal te dri ma med pa'i brjod pa 'jigs pa'i rgyur 'gyur na lnga par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te dri ma med pa'i brjod pa 'jigs pa'i rgyur 'gyur na lnga par 'gyur la /
translated: if the stainless expression were the cause of fear, it would be the fifth case.

original: 'di ni 'jigs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jigs pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: This is not a cause for fear.

original: 'jigs pa ma lus pa las ldog pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ma lus pa las ldog pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause for turning away from all fear.

original: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rin po che phreng ba las /
analyzed: rin po che phreng ba las /
translated: In the Precious Garland:

original: sdug bsngal thams cad zad byed chos //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad zad byed chos //
translated: The Dharma that ends all suffering

original: thos pas rtogs pa mi ldan pa //üîΩskrag 'gyur yongs su ma shes pas //
analyzed: thos pas rtogs pa mi ldan pa // skrag 'gyur yongs su ma shes pas //
translated: Is not understood through study.üîΩThose who are frightened by itüîΩFear what is not to be feared.

original: 'jigs min gnas la 'jigs par 'gyur //üîΩ'di dag thams cad mi 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: 'jigs min gnas la 'jigs par 'gyur // 'di dag thams cad mi 'byung ba'i //
translated: Nirvana, where none of this occurs,

original: mya ngan 'das pas de mi 'jigs //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pas de mi 'jigs //
translated: Is not feared by those who understand.

original: 'dir smros pa yi dngos med la ;
analyzed: 'dir smros pa yi dngos med la ;
translated: Here, what is the nonexistence of things?

original: / ci yis de la de 'jigs byed //
analyzed: / ci yis de la de 'jigs byed //
translated: By what is that feared?

original: thar pa bdag med phung po med //
analyzed: thar pa bdag med phung po med //
translated: Liberation is selfless and without aggregates.

original: 'di 'dra'i thar pa la yang dga' //üîΩphung po khams dang skye mched rnams //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i thar pa la yang dga' // phung po khams dang skye mched rnams //
translated: One should delight in such liberation.

original: 'di lta bu des ci mi dga' //
analyzed: 'di lta bu des ci mi dga' //
translated: Why not delight in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases?

original: zhes so // de nyid kyis na 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyid du ma yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes so // de nyid kyis na 'jigs pa'i rgyu nyid du ma yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to understand that this is not a cause for fear, it is said:

original: @334a * // dri ma med pa'i brjod pa yul ma yin par bstan to zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: @334a * // dri ma med pa'i brjod pa yul ma yin par bstan to zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is taught to be the object of the stainless expression.

original: gang yang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang yang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Also, someone thinks like this:

original: sgra'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i don du slob dpon gyi bsams bzhin du zur chag pa'i sgra'i skyor ba byas so zhes pa de mi 'thad de //
analyzed: sgra'i mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i don du slob dpon gyi bsams bzhin du zur chag pa'i sgra'i skyor ba byas so zhes pa de mi 'thad de //
translated: ‚ÄúFor the sake of abandoning attachment to the characteristics of words, the master intentionally uses irregular words.‚Äù That is not tenable.

original: gal te sgra'i mtshan nyid bor nas brjod pas des mngon par zhen pa dang bral nas sgra'i mtshan nyid logs su bor ba'i brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i mtshan nyid bor nas brjod pas des mngon par zhen pa dang bral nas sgra'i mtshan nyid logs su bor ba'i brjod pa la mngon par zhen pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: If one abandons the characteristics of words by expressing them, then by that one would be free from attachment and the arising of attachment to the expression that abandons the characteristics of words separately would not occur.

original: de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: yang ji lta de ltar sgra'i sbyor ba byed na /
analyzed: yang ji lta de ltar sgra'i sbyor ba byed na /
translated: Also, if one uses words in that way,

original: de'i tshe tshig lhug pa la yang mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir sbyor ba mdzad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshig lhug pa la yang mngon par zhen pa spong ba'i phyir sbyor ba mdzad par 'gyur na /
translated: then at that time one would use them for the sake of abandoning attachment to loose speech.

original: de yang ma mdzad la /
analyzed: de yang ma mdzad la /
translated: But that is not done.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi dran pa nyid srid kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa spong bas ni yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid mi dran pa nyid srid kyi mtshan nyid la mngon par zhen pa spong bas ni yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is possible that one may not remember the definition, but it is not possible that one may not abandon adherence to the definition.

original: thabs gzhan gyis de'i mngon par zhen pa spong bar byed pa med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: thabs gzhan gyis de'i mngon par zhen pa spong bar byed pa med pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not that there is no other method to abandon adherence to the definition.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon ni nam yang zur chag pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi mdzad do //üîΩ'o na re zhig 'gro ba mi 'gro zhing //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon ni nam yang zur chag pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi mdzad do // 'o na re zhig 'gro ba mi 'gro zhing //
translated: Therefore, the master never uses a corrupt form of a word.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa zur chag pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa zur chag pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Well then, haven't you seen such usages of corrupt forms of words as, for instance, The goer does not go?

original: 'di ni zur chag pa'i sgra ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zur chag pa'i sgra ma yin te /
translated: This is not a corrupt form of a word.

original: gang gi phyir bzlog pa ni mang po'o zhes pas 'di ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bzlog pa ni mang po'o zhes pas 'di ni /
translated: Because of the statement, The reverse is many, this isüîΩa statement of indecision,üîΩsince the author of the treatise has reversed the following:üîΩthe final sa, the final ri, the final ya, the final ra,üîΩthe final ha, the final la, the final i, the final u,

original: sa mtha'i ri mtha' nye bar gzung ba rtags dang skyes bu dang // ka la hal  dbyangs yig byed po yang nya //
analyzed: sa mtha'i ri mtha' nye bar gzung ba rtags dang skyes bu dang // ka la hal  dbyangs yig byed po yang nya //
translated: and the final o.

original: bstan bcos byed pas 'di dag bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: bstan bcos byed pas 'di dag bzlog pa ste //
translated: The author of the treatise has reversed these,

original: des kyang mang po 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya //
analyzed: des kyang mang po 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya //
translated: and thereby many are accomplished.

original: zhes pa ma nges par brjod pa las te /
analyzed: zhes pa ma nges par brjod pa las te /
translated: This is a statement of indecision.

original: bzlog par smra ba la /üîΩsmra bas bdag gi tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlog par smra ba la / smra bas bdag gi tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: To the one who maintains the opposite,üîΩwe reply: it is our statement.

original: 'o na rig byed kyi'o zhes pa'i gzhi las 'di ni rig byed kyi brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na rig byed kyi'o zhes pa'i gzhi las 'di ni rig byed kyi brjod pa'o //
translated: But it is the statement of the Vedas.

original: gzhan yang bzlog pa ni sdeb sbyor gyi kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bzlog pa ni sdeb sbyor gyi kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Moreover, the opposite is only in poetry.

original: de dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: der ni tshigs su bcad pa'i sdeb sbyor 'jig rten pas rig byed kyi sgras yongs su gzung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni tshigs su bcad pa'i sdeb sbyor 'jig rten pas rig byed kyi sgras yongs su gzung ba ma yin no //
translated: The meter of a verse is not known to the world as a Vedic sound.

original: 'on kyang sngags dang bram ze rtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngags dang bram ze rtogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Rather, it is the meter of mantras and the meter of the learned.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, these are not the followers of the definition.

original: smras pa / de ltar 'gyur du chug na yang /
analyzed: smras pa / de ltar 'gyur du chug na yang /
translated: We reply: even if that were so,

original: de lta na yang rig byed bzhin du snyan ngag mkhan gyis sbyor te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rig byed bzhin du snyan ngag mkhan gyis sbyor te /
translated: the poet composes poetry like the Vedas.

original: de skad du yang /üîΩrig byed 'jig rten bar @334b mthong la //
analyzed: de skad du yang / rig byed 'jig rten bar @334b mthong la //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe world sees the Vedas.

original: 'jig rten pa yang rig byed la //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang rig byed la //
translated: The world also sees the Vedas.

original: sgra ni khyad 'phags sbyor ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra ni khyad 'phags sbyor ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the sound is composed with distinction,

original: nam yang tha dad ma yin no //
analyzed: nam yang tha dad ma yin no //
translated: it is never different.

original: zhes so // khyad par 'phags pa yang slob dpon 'di'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes so // khyad par 'phags pa yang slob dpon 'di'o zhes bya ste /
translated: The master is also superior in this regard.

original: des na 'dir zur chag pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi srid la /
analyzed: des na 'dir zur chag pa'i sgra'i sbyor ba mi srid la /
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to apply the corrupted form here.

original: mtshan nyid byed pas mtshan nyid ma tshang ba yang srid do /
analyzed: mtshan nyid byed pas mtshan nyid ma tshang ba yang srid do /
translated: It is also possible that the definition is incomplete due to the function of the definition.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshon bya ma lus pa la khyab par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshon bya ma lus pa la khyab par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because the definition would pervade all that is to be defined.

original: mtshon cha yang khyad par 'phags pas sbyar ba byas pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha yang khyad par 'phags pas sbyar ba byas pa'i sgra'o //
translated: The weapon is also a term that is applied due to superiority.

original: de rnams mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid byed pa'i skyon yin gyi slob dpon gyi ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de rnams mtshan nyid kyis ma bsdus pa'i phyir 'di ni mtshan nyid byed pa'i skyon yin gyi slob dpon gyi ni ma yin no /
translated: Because those are not included in the definition, this is a fault in the function of the definition, not of the master.

original: de'i dus na rab tu grags pa'i sgra mang po slob dpon gyis gzigs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de'i dus na rab tu grags pa'i sgra mang po slob dpon gyis gzigs pa rnams kyang /
translated: The many terms that were well-known at that time, which the master saw,

original: deng sang gi p'a ni ni la mtshan nyid la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: deng sang gi p'a ni ni la mtshan nyid la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: are not present in the definition of the modern PƒÅ·πáini.

original: deng sang dus na des mtshan nyid byas pa yang ma lus pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'brangs nas mtshan nyid brjod kyang /
analyzed: deng sang dus na des mtshan nyid byas pa yang ma lus pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'brangs nas mtshan nyid brjod kyang /
translated: Even though the definition made by him in the modern times follows all the terms, the definition is stated.

original: gal te na yang /
analyzed: gal te na yang /
translated: If so,

original: de bsams pa dang dran pa nyams pa dag gis mtshon bya ma lus pa la khyab pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par ma lus pas na /
analyzed: de bsams pa dang dran pa nyams pa dag gis mtshon bya ma lus pa la khyab pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par ma lus pas na /
translated: And since the characteristics of all the things to be indicated are encompassed by the two, memory and thought, the characteristics are not incomplete.

original: de'i tshe de su'i skyon yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe de su'i skyon yin /
translated: So whose fault is it that the characteristics are incomplete?

original: 'di ltar k'a ty'a ya nas 'dir yang shin tu ches ma tshang ba'i mtshan nyid smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar k'a ty'a ya nas 'dir yang shin tu ches ma tshang ba'i mtshan nyid smos pa ni /
translated: In this way, Katyayana also states that the characteristics are extremely incomplete.

original: ji ltar p'a ni ni dran pa dang bsams pa nyams pas mtshan nyid ma tshang ba ltar de bzhin du dus deng sang na skyes pa'i k'a ty'a ya na la sogs pa'i la srid la /
analyzed: ji ltar p'a ni ni dran pa dang bsams pa nyams pas mtshan nyid ma tshang ba ltar de bzhin du dus deng sang na skyes pa'i k'a ty'a ya na la sogs pa'i la srid la /
translated: Just as the characteristics are incomplete because of the degeneration of memory and thought, in the same way, it is possible that Katyayana and so on who were born in this degenerate ageüîΩmay also be incomplete.

original: gal te na yang rig pa'i sgras sngags dang bram ze dang rtog pa gzung yang rung /
analyzed: gal te na yang rig pa'i sgras sngags dang bram ze dang rtog pa gzung yang rung /
translated: Moreover, it is acceptable to take the term knowledge to refer to mantras, brahmins and thought.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i sdeb sbyor gyi mdo ru gzung yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i sdeb sbyor gyi mdo ru gzung yang rung ste /
translated: And it is acceptable to take the term sutra to refer to the meter of a verse.

original: de ltar p'a ni ni'i sgra yang skyon can du mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar p'a ni ni'i sgra yang skyon can du mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, the term panini would not be faulty.

original: sder sbyor gyi mtshan nyid ston pa po rnams la yang 'di dag 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sder sbyor gyi mtshan nyid ston pa po rnams la yang 'di dag 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would be tenable that the authors of the meter are these.

original: gzhan yang mon sran gre'ur byas pa'i sdeb sbyor nyams par mi bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan yang mon sran gre'ur byas pa'i sdeb sbyor nyams par mi bya'o zhes so //
translated: Moreover, one should not allow the meter to be spoiled by making the beans of the peas too small.

original: de bzhin du yang khyad par 'phags pa'i sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang khyad par 'phags pa'i sbyor ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Similarly, following the composition of the special ones,

original: yangs shing che ba la sogs pa dang / rma bya rol pa la sogs pa dang / sbyor ba rnams par phye ba la sogs pa yang don chen por 'thad de /
analyzed: yangs shing che ba la sogs pa dang / rma bya rol pa la sogs pa dang / sbyor ba rnams par phye ba la sogs pa yang don chen por 'thad de /
translated: the compositions of the great and vast, the peacock dance, and so forth, and the compositions of the analysis of the compositions, and so forth, are also acceptable as having great meaning.

original: mtshan nyid byed pas ma tshang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: mtshan nyid byed pas ma tshang ba ma yin la /
translated: They are not incomplete because they are not the characteristics.

original: khyad par 'phags pas sbyar ba'i sgra rnams kyang zur chag pa'i sgra ni ma yin no zhes bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par 'phags pas sbyar ba'i sgra rnams kyang zur chag pa'i sgra ni ma yin no zhes bya ste /
translated: The sounds composed by the special ones are also not corrupted sounds.

original: @335a * // spros pa de tsam gyis chog go //
analyzed: @335a * // spros pa de tsam gyis chog go //
translated: That much elaboration is sufficient.

original: skabs su bab pa nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, what is relevant should be explained.

original: yang ni ji skad smos pa de las //
analyzed: yang ni ji skad smos pa de las //
translated: Again, as it was said,

original: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing //üîΩyang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan med //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi chos bstan mi nyams shing // yang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan med //
translated: the teaching of worldly dharmas does not decline,

original: ces pa la /
analyzed: ces pa la /
translated: and the teaching of the dharmas as they are never exists.

original: slar yang 'dir ji ltar na /
analyzed: slar yang 'dir ji ltar na /
translated: Here, again, how is it that

original: 'jig rten pa la chos bstan cing //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la chos bstan cing //
translated: the teaching of worldly dharmas

original: ji ltar yang 'dir mi 'jigs la //
analyzed: ji ltar yang 'dir mi 'jigs la //
translated: How could there be fear in this?

original: gzhan yang nam yang de kho na nyid la gang du gang chos bstan pa med ces pa de dag 'dir ston par 'dod pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang nam yang de kho na nyid la gang du gang chos bstan pa med ces pa de dag 'dir ston par 'dod pas gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, since there is no place where the reality of phenomena is taught, in order to teach that here, it is said:

original: 'di la brten nas 'di 'byung zhes //
analyzed: 'di la brten nas 'di 'byung zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúThis arises in dependence on that.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten tshul 'di mi 'gog cing //üîΩgang rten rang bzhin med pas de //
analyzed: 'jig rten tshul 'di mi 'gog cing // gang rten rang bzhin med pas de //
translated: This worldly convention is not refuted.üîΩSince that which is dependent has no intrinsic reality,

original: ji ltar yod 'gyur de nyid des //
analyzed: ji ltar yod 'gyur de nyid des //
translated: how could it exist?

original: 'dir sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten du brdar btags pa 'di dag ma rig pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim pas 'jug pa nang gi bdag nyid dang phyi'i dbye bas tha dad pa rnams//
analyzed: 'dir sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten du brdar btags pa 'di dag ma rig pa dang rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim pas 'jug pa nang gi bdag nyid dang phyi'i dbye bas tha dad pa rnams//
translated: Here, these sentient beings and the world of their environment, which are designated by conventional symbols, are engaged in the process of the circle of wind and so on, which is due to ignorance. They are differentiated by the division into inner and outer.

original: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i rgyu dang yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa las skye bar brtags pa rnams rkyen 'di pa tsam las skye bar brtags pa las skye bar skye ba nye bar bstan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i rgyu dang yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa las skye bar brtags pa rnams rkyen 'di pa tsam las skye bar brtags pa las skye bar skye ba nye bar bstan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i chos
translated: They are imagined to arise from causes that are self, other, both, existent, nonexistent, both, and neither. They arise from the mere assemblage of conditions. The teaching of arising from that is the worldly convention of arising.

original: bstan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the teaching.

original: de yang rkyen 'di pa tsam du khas blangs par gyur pas mi nyams la /
analyzed: de yang rkyen 'di pa tsam du khas blangs par gyur pas mi nyams la /
translated: Moreover, since it is accepted as mere conditionality, it is not undermined.

original: de las gzhan du na brtags nas khas blangs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de las gzhan du na brtags nas khas blangs par 'gyur na /
translated: If it were otherwise, it would be accepted as a fabrication.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi srid par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mi srid par 'gyur la /
translated: In that case, dependent origination would be impossible.

original: gzhan du brtags pa yang 'jig rten pa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du brtags pa yang 'jig rten pa'i ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the fabrication is not that of the worldly,

original: de ni 'jig rten las de bzhin du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las de bzhin du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: because the worldly do not accept it in that way.

original: 'jig rten pa ma yin pa thar pa 'dod pa kha cig gis phyin ci log gis 'dir brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ma yin pa thar pa 'dod pa kha cig gis phyin ci log gis 'dir brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a fabrication by some nonworldly ones who desire liberation, who are mistaken here.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bstan bcos las /üîΩbyed po las kyi rten 'byung ni //
analyzed: bstan bcos las / byed po las kyi rten 'byung ni //
translated: The treatise says:üîΩThe agent arises in dependence on the action.

original: de la brten nas byed po dang // las 'jug gzhan pa 'grub pa yi //
analyzed: de la brten nas byed po dang // las 'jug gzhan pa 'grub pa yi //
translated: In dependence on that, the agent and action

original: rgyu mtshan ci yang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ci yang ma mthong ngo //
translated: are seen to be established as different.

original: zhes so ; / de 'di ltar 'di la brten nas 'byung ngo zhes pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tshul 'di ni mi 'gog pas /
analyzed: zhes so ; / de 'di ltar 'di la brten nas 'byung ngo zhes pa'i 'jig rten pa'i tshul 'di ni mi 'gog pas /
translated: Since this worldly way of ‚Äúthis arises in dependence on that‚Äù is not refuted,

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan mi nyams so zhes gnas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos bstan mi nyams so zhes gnas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe teaching of mundane dharmas will not decline.‚Äù

original: gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni ngo bo nyid kyis med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de ni ngo bo nyid kyis med pa ste /
translated: That which is dependently arisen is essentially non-existent,

original: yod bzhin pa la brten nas 'byung @335b ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod bzhin pa la brten nas 'byung @335b ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which exists would not arise in dependence on something else.

original: gang yang de ltar rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gang yang de ltar rang bzhin gyis yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Moreover, since it does not exist through its own intrinsic nature,

original: de ji ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod bzhin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yod bzhin par 'gyur /
translated: how could that which is dependently arisen exist?

original: de'i rang bzhin yod bzhin pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yod bzhin pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Its intrinsic nature does not exist.

original: des na 'di ltar dpyad na rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar dpyad na rnal 'byor pa de kho na nyid nges par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, when the yogi analyzes in this way, he will ascertain reality,

original: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩde kho na nyid mthong bar gyur na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma skyes pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid yongs su shes par 'gyur ro // de kho na nyid mthong bar gyur na chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: and he will fully understand the reality of things that are not essentially arisen.üîΩWhen he sees reality, he will never again illuminate the intrinsic nature of phenomena,

original: nam yang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su gsal bar mi byed de /
analyzed: nam yang chos rnams kyi rang bzhin yongs su gsal bar mi byed de /
translated: because he does not observe the intrinsic nature of any phenomenon.

original: rang nyid kyis ma dmigs par gzhan la bshad pa mi srid do //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis ma dmigs par gzhan la bshad pa mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible to explain to others what one has not perceived oneself.

original: des na yang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan pa ma yin no zhes grub bo //
analyzed: des na yang dag nyid du nam yang chos bstan pa ma yin no zhes grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that in reality, the Dharma is never taught.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis rab tu byed pa ma lus par bsgrub pa'i don bsdus pa'i tshul gyis nye bar bstan nas /üîΩde las gzhan la ji ltar bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par 'byed pas nges par bla na med pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos grub ma thob pa rnams /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis rab tu byed pa ma lus par bsgrub pa'i don bsdus pa'i tshul gyis nye bar bstan nas / de las gzhan la ji ltar bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin rnam par 'byed pas nges par bla na med pa'i 'bras bu'i dngos grub ma thob pa rnams /
translated: Having thus taught by way of summary the meaning of the entire chapter in two verses,

original: slar yang thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la yang dag par brtson pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / ma zhugs pa rnams zhugs pa dang ldan pa yang spro ba bskyed pa'i don du yang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa /üîΩtshul 'di yang dag rjes dpog gang //
analyzed: slar yang thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la yang dag par brtson pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / ma zhugs pa rnams zhugs pa dang ldan pa yang spro ba bskyed pa'i don du yang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa / tshul 'di yang dag rjes dpog gang //
translated: in order to generate renewed enthusiasm for listening, reflection, and meditation in those who have not yet attained the unexcelled result of mastery over the Dharma that is taught in this text, and in order to generate enthusiasm in those who have entered the path, he states two more verses:üîΩThe correct inference of this method

original: dad ldan de nyid tshol la brtson //
analyzed: dad ldan de nyid tshol la brtson //
translated: is for the faithful who strive to find reality.

original: rten med chos 'gal brten pa yis //
analyzed: rten med chos 'gal brten pa yis //
translated: The non-existence of a basis is the support of a contradiction.

original: srid dang srid min spangs nas zhi //
analyzed: srid dang srid min spangs nas zhi //
translated: Abandoning existence and non-existence, there is peace.

original: tshul 'di ni de ltar ji skad du smos pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni de ltar ji skad du smos pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This method is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúDependent origination is thus.‚Äù

original: yang dag rjes dpog gang ni /
analyzed: yang dag rjes dpog gang ni /
translated: What is right inference?

original: rang gi rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin yongs su gcod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is the determination of one‚Äôs own nature.

original: khong du chud pa yang gal te na skyon rjes su tshol ba la brtson pas khong du chud pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: khong du chud pa yang gal te na skyon rjes su tshol ba la brtson pas khong du chud pa'o zhe na /
translated: If one understands, then one understands through striving to seek out faults.üîΩIt is said:

original: gsungs pa / dad pa dang ldan yang gal te rtsod pa'i bsam pas kyang 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gsungs pa / dad pa dang ldan yang gal te rtsod pa'i bsam pas kyang 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: Even if one has faith, one may still be motivated by the desire to argue.

original: gsungs pa / de nyid tshol la brtson zhes pa la /
analyzed: gsungs pa / de nyid tshol la brtson zhes pa la /
translated: It is said:

original: dad pa dang ldan na yang don dam pa khong du chud par 'dod pas de kho na nyid 'di nyid tshol ba'o //üîΩde yang rang bzhin gyis mi @336a * //
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan na yang don dam pa khong du chud par 'dod pas de kho na nyid 'di nyid tshol ba'o // de yang rang bzhin gyis mi @336a * //
translated: One who strives to seek out reality, even if one has faith, desires to understand ultimate reality, and seeks out reality itself.

original: dmigs pa'i phyir mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i phyir mi brten pa'o //
translated: Moreover, because one does not perceive one‚Äôs own nature, one does not rely on it.

original: chos 'ga' brten pas ni /
analyzed: chos 'ga' brten pas ni /
translated: Because one does not rely on any phenomenon,

original: chos 'ga' zhig gsal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig gsal bar byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it illuminates some phenomena.

original: de ltar rten med chos 'ga' brten pa des ci zhig byed ce na /üîΩgsungs pa / srid dang srid min spangs nas zhi //
analyzed: de ltar rten med chos 'ga' brten pa des ci zhig byed ce na / gsungs pa / srid dang srid min spangs nas zhi //
translated: If it is like that, what does that which is not a basis do by depending on some phenomena?üîΩIt is said:

original: zhes pa la ;
analyzed: zhes pa la ;
translated: ‚ÄúPeace is the abandonment of existence and non-existence.‚Äù

original: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Here, existence is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: srid min ni de med pa'o //
analyzed: srid min ni de med pa'o //
translated: Non-existence is their absence.

original: de gnyis 'dir spangs na nges par dngos po dang dngos po med pa zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gnyis 'dir spangs na nges par dngos po dang dngos po med pa zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: If those two are abandoned here, then certainly existence and non-existence will be pacified.

original: srid dang srid min dag gi 'jug pa 'gag pas zhi bar gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: srid dang srid min dag gi 'jug pa 'gag pas zhi bar gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that by stopping the engagement of existence and non-existence, they are pacified.

original: // / slar yang ji ltar /
analyzed: // / slar yang ji ltar /
translated: Again, how?

original: srid dang srid min rtag spong zhing //
analyzed: srid dang srid min rtag spong zhing //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways abandoning existence and non-existence,

original: ji ltar de zhi zhes brjod na //
analyzed: ji ltar de zhi zhes brjod na //
translated: how is that peace described?

original: gang las de'i rnal 'byor pa ni //
analyzed: gang las de'i rnal 'byor pa ni //
translated: From that, the yogi

original: 'di dag rkyen 'di las rig na //
analyzed: 'di dag rkyen 'di las rig na //
translated: knows these from these conditions,üîΩand turns away from the net of bad views.

original: lta ngan dra bas zin pa ldog / des ni chags rmongs khro ba rnams //
analyzed: lta ngan dra bas zin pa ldog / des ni chags rmongs khro ba rnams //
translated: Therefore, by abandoning attachment, delusion, and anger,

original: spangs phyir mya ngan 'das pa thob //
analyzed: spangs phyir mya ngan 'das pa thob //
translated: nirvƒÅ·πáa is attained.‚Äù

original: 'di ni 'di'i rkyen la'o zhes pas /üîΩrkyen 'di pa la /üîΩde'i dngos po ni rkyen 'di pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rkyen la'o zhes pas / rkyen 'di pa la / de'i dngos po ni rkyen 'di pa'o //
translated: This is the condition of that.üîΩThe entity of that is the condition of that.

original: 'dis ji skad du bstan pa'i rkyen 'dis gsungs so //üîΩrnal 'byor pa gang zhig gis ji skad du smos pa'i rkyen 'di pa khong du chud pas chos kyi rang bzhin 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dis ji skad du bstan pa'i rkyen 'dis gsungs so // rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gis ji skad du smos pa'i rkyen 'di pa khong du chud pas chos kyi rang bzhin 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the condition of that.üîΩThe yogi who understands the condition of that, as it has been taught,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu yongs su mi rtog par gyur pas /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag tu yongs su mi rtog par gyur pas /
translated: does not conceive of existence and nonexistence, because he does not observe any nature of things.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba'i nang nas ldog la /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lta ba ngan pa'i dra ba'i nang nas ldog la /
translated: He turns away from the net of bad views of the world.

original: de las log nas kyang /
analyzed: de las log nas kyang /
translated: Having turned away from that,

original: dngos po dang dngos med kyi lta bas bslang ba 'di'i srid dang srid min gyi rang bzhin du nye bar dmigs pa spangs pas spongs la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos med kyi lta bas bslang ba 'di'i srid dang srid min gyi rang bzhin du nye bar dmigs pa spangs pas spongs la /
translated: he abandons the nature of existence and nonexistence that is imagined by the views of existence and nonexistence.

original: de spangs nas kyang lta ba'i rtsa ba 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di'i nyon mongs pa las ldog go //
analyzed: de spangs nas kyang lta ba'i rtsa ba 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di'i nyon mongs pa las ldog go //
translated: Having abandoned that, he turns away from the afflictions, such as desire, which are the root of views.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas kun nas bslangs pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i yul nyid 'jig rten pas rtogs la /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i lta bas kun nas bslangs pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i yul nyid 'jig rten pas rtogs la /
translated: The objects of things and nonthings are understood by worldly people, who are motivated by incorrect views.

original: de spangs par gyur na yang /
analyzed: de spangs par gyur na yang /
translated: When they abandon those,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag de la mi snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag de la mi snang ba'i phyir /
translated: things and nonthings do not appear to them.

original: rgyu mtshan med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di la mi ldan la /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pas 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di la mi ldan la /
translated: Since there is no reason for that, they are not endowed with attachment and so on.

original: des na rnal 'byor ba de 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / gti mug spangs pa'i phyir dri ma med pa ste /üîΩnyon mongs pa med par @336b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnal 'byor ba de 'dod chags dang / khong khro dang / gti mug spangs pa'i phyir dri ma med pa ste / nyon mongs pa med par @336b 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the yogi/nƒ´ abandons attachment, anger, and delusion, he/she is stainless,üîΩand thus free of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa med na yang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med na yang /
translated: But if there are no afflictions,

original: sngar 'phangs pa'i dngos po 'di yongs su zad pa dang / sngon med pa'i dngos po 'phen pa spangs pas nges par mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngar 'phangs pa'i dngos po 'di yongs su zad pa dang / sngon med pa'i dngos po 'phen pa spangs pas nges par mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba ma yin nam /
translated: since the previously projected things are exhausted and the projection of new things is abandoned, wouldn‚Äôt one definitely go to nirvana?

original: de 'di ltar bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de 'di ltar bla na med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'bras bu don du gnyer ba'i thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: It is not so, because the yogi/nƒ´ is endowed with great compassion, which seeks the result of unexcelled nirvana.

original: shes rab can dang / dad pa can dang ldan pas kyang /
analyzed: shes rab can dang / dad pa can dang ldan pas kyang /
translated: Those who are wise and have faith

original: ji skad du smos pa'i rkyen 'di pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: ji skad du smos pa'i rkyen 'di pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: should meditate on the characteristics of the conditions as they have been explained,

original: rang bzhin gyis stong pa la /üîΩde bzhin du bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis stong pa la / de bzhin du bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: as being empty of intrinsic nature,üîΩand should listen to and reflect on them properly.

original: tshul bzhin du nyan pa dang bsam par bya ba yin la gzhan yang rnal 'byor pas rtag tu bsgom pa la shin tu brtson pa dang ldan par 'gyur bar rigs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin du nyan pa dang bsam par bya ba yin la gzhan yang rnal 'byor pas rtag tu bsgom pa la shin tu brtson pa dang ldan par 'gyur bar rigs so zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is fitting that the yogi/nis should always be very diligent in meditation.

original: bsil ba'i ngag gi 'od kyi ku mu da can ni //
analyzed: bsil ba'i ngag gi 'od kyi ku mu da can ni //
translated: The moon of the cool-rayed Candraprabha

original: bdun cu pa ni kun nas rab tu gsal byed pa'i //
analyzed: bdun cu pa ni kun nas rab tu gsal byed pa'i //
translated: illuminates the entire Seventy.

original: zla ba rnam par 'phro bas gsal byas lam rig pa //
analyzed: zla ba rnam par 'phro bas gsal byas lam rig pa //
translated: The path is illuminated by the light of the moonüîΩthat radiates from the clear Candraprabha.

original: ci yang min zhing ci yang min min chags pas brten //
analyzed: ci yang min zhing ci yang min min chags pas brten //
translated: It is nothing at all, and it is not nothing at all.

original: gang zhig dbu mar 'jug par ma smos pa dag dang / gang zhig dbu ma'i tshigs su bcad pa mi gsal ba //
analyzed: gang zhig dbu mar 'jug par ma smos pa dag dang / gang zhig dbu ma'i tshigs su bcad pa mi gsal ba //
translated: Those who do not understand the middle way, and those who do not understand the verses of the middle way,

original: dngos po'i de nyid ma lus de dag bdag gis ni //
analyzed: dngos po'i de nyid ma lus de dag bdag gis ni //
translated: I have explained all of reality to them.

original: bdun cu pa yi rnam par byed pa 'dir gsal byas //
analyzed: bdun cu pa yi rnam par byed pa 'dir gsal byas //
translated: This work, the Seventy, has been composed to clarify that.

original: gang zhig thugs rje'i bdag nyid thub pa'i dbang po yis //
analyzed: gang zhig thugs rje'i bdag nyid thub pa'i dbang po yis //
translated: The one who is the embodiment of compassion, the Lord of Sages,

original: yun ring sa dus nas 'bad pa chen pos mdzad pa yi //
analyzed: yun ring sa dus nas 'bad pa chen pos mdzad pa yi //
translated: Who for a long time, over many eons, has striven with great effort,

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa zhes bya 'di //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyi stong pa zhes bya 'di //
translated: Has taught this doctrine of emptiness of essence.

original: lam chen rgyal ba thams cad rjes su gshegs pa ste //üîΩde la 'jug phyir stong nyid bdun cu zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: lam chen rgyal ba thams cad rjes su gshegs pa ste // de la 'jug phyir stong nyid bdun cu zhes bya ba'i //
translated: This is the great path traversed by all the conquerors.üîΩIn order to enter into that, the treatise called

original: bstan bcos gang zhig 'phags pa klu sgrub ces bya bas //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang zhig 'phags pa klu sgrub ces bya bas //
translated: The Seventy Stanzas on Emptiness was composed by the noble Nagarjuna.

original: gsungs pa de ni bdag gis rnam par phye ba yi //
analyzed: gsungs pa de ni bdag gis rnam par phye ba yi //
translated: I have analyzed it.üîΩBy whatever virtue has been created here, may all beings attain buddhahood.

original: dge ba gang gis skye bos sangs rgyas nyid gyur cig / stong nyid bdun cu pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon zla ba grags pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dge ba gang gis skye bos sangs rgyas nyid gyur cig / stong nyid bdun cu pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon zla ba grags pas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the Seventy Stanzas on Emptiness composed by the master Candrakirti.

original: // / stong nyid bdun cu'i 'grel pa ni //
analyzed: // / stong nyid bdun cu'i 'grel pa ni //
translated: The commentary on the Seventy Stanzas on Emptiness

original: dge slong dharma grags kyis bsgyur //
analyzed: dge slong dharma grags kyis bsgyur //
translated: was translated by the monk Dharma grags.

original: gzhung grangs stong phrag gnyis dang ni //
analyzed: gzhung grangs stong phrag gnyis dang ni //
translated: The text has two thousand stanzas.

original: brgya phrag gcig gis lhag pa yin //
analyzed: brgya phrag gcig gis lhag pa yin //
translated: One hundred and one.

original: dpal na len dra'i gtsug lag khang du pandi ta aa bha y'a k'a ra dang / snur lo ts'a ba dharma grags kyis bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: dpal na len dra'i gtsug lag khang du pandi ta aa bha y'a k'a ra dang / snur lo ts'a ba dharma grags kyis bsgyur ba'o /
translated: This was translated by the pandit Abhayakara and the Tibetan translator Dharma grags of Nub.
